original: yod par lta ba skyes pa de'i tshe yang de'i thob pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor zhes bya'o //🔽nying mtshams ni rnam pa dgu cig car du sbyar ba la /
analyzed: yod par lta ba skyes pa de'i tshe yang de'i thob pa kun du spyod pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor zhes bya'o // nying mtshams ni rnam pa dgu cig car du sbyar ba la /
translated: When the view of existence is produced, the roots of good are again joined, because the possession of the roots of good is again practiced.

original: mngon sum @209a * //
analyzed: mngon sum @209a * //
translated: The joining of the roots of good is simultaneous with the nine modes of joining.

original: du ni rim gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: du ni rim gyis 'gyur te /
translated: The possession of the roots of good is gradual,

original: nad med nas stobs rnyed pa bzhin no //🔽yang de dag gi nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: nad med nas stobs rnyed pa bzhin no // yang de dag gi nying mtshams sbyor ba ni /
translated: like the acquisition of strength after recovery from an illness.

original: mtshams med byed pa 'di las min //
analyzed: mtshams med byed pa 'di las min //
translated: The joining of the roots of good is not for those who have committed the actions with immediately successive retribution.

original: gzhan gyis ni 'di nyid la 'gyur gyi mtshams med par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni 'di nyid la 'gyur gyi mtshams med par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is for others, but not for those who have committed the actions with immediately successive retribution.

original: de nyid la dgongs nas /🔽gang zag 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skal pa dang ldan pa ma yin gyi 'di ni nges par dmyal ba dag na 'chi 'pho ba 'am skye ba na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor bar
analyzed: de nyid la dgongs nas / gang zag 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor ba'i skal pa dang ldan pa ma yin gyi 'di ni nges par dmyal ba dag na 'chi 'pho ba 'am skye ba na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nying mtshams sbyor bar
translated: With this in mind, the Fortunate One said:🔽This person does not have the opportunity to join the roots of good in this life; he will join them when he is reborn in hell and dies there.

original: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Fortunate One said that this person will join the roots of good when he dies in hell and is reborn in hell.

original: skye ba ni srid pa bar ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni srid pa bar ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: Birth is the state of the intermediate existence.

original: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ni 'chi 'pho ba la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Death is the state of being about to die.

original: de la gang zhig rgyu'i stobs kyis kun du gcod pa de ni 'chi 'pho ba na nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang zhig rgyu'i stobs kyis kun du gcod pa de ni 'chi 'pho ba na nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who abandons the wholesome roots through the power of causes will be reborn in the intermediate existence.

original: gang zhig rkyen gyi stobs kyis kun du gcod pa de ni skye ba na nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen gyi stobs kyis kun du gcod pa de ni skye ba na nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who abandons the wholesome roots through the power of conditions will be reborn in the womb.

original: rang gi stobs kyis gcod pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan gyi stobs kyis gcod pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rang gi stobs kyis gcod pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan gyi stobs kyis gcod pa gang yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is similar to the case of one who abandons the wholesome roots through his own power and the case of one who abandons the wholesome roots through the power of others.

original: yang smras pa /🔽gang zhig bsam pa nyams pas kun du gcod par byed pa de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang smras pa / gang zhig bsam pa nyams pas kun du gcod par byed pa de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, it is said:🔽One who abandons the wholesome roots through the degeneration of his intention will be reborn in the present life.

original: gang zhig bsam pa dang sbyor ba nyams pas gcod par byed pa de ni lus zhig nas nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig bsam pa dang sbyor ba nyams pas gcod par byed pa de ni lus zhig nas nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who abandons the wholesome roots through the degeneration of his intention and application will be reborn after the body is destroyed.

original: lta ba nyams pa gang yin pa dang / lta ba dang tshul khrims nyams pa gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lta ba nyams pa gang yin pa dang / lta ba dang tshul khrims nyams pa gang yin pa de yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to those who are degenerate in view and those who are degenerate in both view and morality.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa yin la log pa nyid du nges pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa yin la log pa nyid du nges pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities regarding the severence of the roots of virtue and being fixed in error.

original: mu dang po ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is those who complete the karmic path of the heinous acts.

original: gnyis pa ni ma skyes dgra'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni ma skyes dgra'o //
translated: The second is Ajatashatru.

original: gsum pa ni lha sbyin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni lha sbyin no //
translated: The third is Devadatta.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is those not included in these.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du gcod par byed pa'i log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa ni mnar med pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du gcod par byed pa'i log par lta ba'i rnam par smin pa ni mnar med pa yin no //
translated: The karmic maturation of the wrong view that severs the roots of virtue is the Avīci hell.

original: mtshams med par byed pa rnams kyis ni der ram gzhan gyi nang du'o //
analyzed: mtshams med par byed pa rnams kyis ni der ram gzhan gyi nang du'o //
translated: Those who commit heinous acts are born there or in another hell.

original: 'di ni las kyi skabs yin pas de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi skabs yin pas de la las kyi lam du zhig dang sems pa lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since this is the section on action, we will now discuss how many karmic paths exist simultaneously with intention.

original: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa cig car lhan cig 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge brgyad kyi bar dag dang // sems pa cig car lhan cig 'byung //
translated: Up to eight nonvirtuous actions arise simultaneously with intention.🔽First, one nonvirtuous action arises simultaneously with intention.

original: re zhig sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gzhan med par brnab sems la @209b sogs par mngon du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: re zhig sems pa gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni gzhan med par brnab sems la @209b sogs par mngon du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: When covetousness and so on manifest without other nonvirtuous actions,

original: sems pa nyon mongs pa can /
analyzed: sems pa nyon mongs pa can /
translated: or when intention is afflicted.

original: de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig mthar phyin par byed na'o //🔽gnyis dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni gnod sems su 'gyur ba srog gcod pa dang / brnab sems dang ldan pa ma byin par len pa'am /
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas gzugs can rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig mthar phyin par byed na'o // gnyis dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba ni gnod sems su 'gyur ba srog gcod pa dang / brnab sems dang ldan pa ma byin par len pa'am /
translated: When one perfects any of the physical actions through its preparation.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pa'am /
translated: Two nonvirtuous actions arise simultaneously with intention when one kills with malice, or when one steals or engages in sexual misconduct with covetousness.

original: tshig kyal pa smra na'o //
analyzed: tshig kyal pa smra na'o //
translated: Or when one engages in idle speech.

original: gsum dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba na brnab sems dang ldan pa cag car du gzhan gyis srog chags bsad pas 'phrog na'o //
analyzed: gsum dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba na brnab sems dang ldan pa cag car du gzhan gyis srog chags bsad pas 'phrog na'o //
translated: Three nonvirtuous actions arise simultaneously with intention when one steals through suddenly overpowering another with covetousness.

original: 'o na ni de chags pa kho nas ma byin par len pa mthar phyin par byed pa mi 'grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni de chags pa kho nas ma byin par len pa mthar phyin par byed pa mi 'grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it established that one perfects taking what is not given through attachment alone?

original: nges pa de ni sems gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i de rdzogs pa la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa de ni sems gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i de rdzogs pa la shes par bya'o //
translated: That certainty should be understood to be completed by that without other mental factors.

original: brnab sems mngon sum du gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzugs can gnyis mthar phyin par byed na yang gsum kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: brnab sems mngon sum du gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzugs can gnyis mthar phyin par byed na yang gsum kho na dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: If one who has manifest covetousness completes the two physical karmas through that preparation, then he arises simultaneously with three.

original: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dbye na bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa brdzun gyi tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra na ste /
analyzed: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dbye na bya ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa brdzun gyi tshig gam tshig rtsub po smra na ste /
translated: Arising simultaneously with four is when one who has the intention to divide speaks false speech or harsh speech.

original: de la ni yid kyi gcig yin la ngag gi gsum yin no //
analyzed: de la ni yid kyi gcig yin la ngag gi gsum yin no //
translated: There is one mental one and three verbal ones.

original: yang na brnab sems la sogs par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum mthar phyin par byed na ste /
analyzed: yang na brnab sems la sogs par gyur pa de'i sbyor bas gzhan gsum mthar phyin par byed na ste /
translated: Or if one who has covetousness and so on completes the other three through that preparation.

original: lnga dang drug dang bdun dang yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga dang drug dang bdun dang yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, five, six, and seven should be applied.

original: brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa kho na drug la sbyor ba byas nas 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag nyid kyis byed la mnyam du mthar phyin par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni brnab sems la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa kho na drug la sbyor ba byas nas 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag nyid kyis byed la mnyam du mthar phyin par 'gyur na'o //
translated: Eight arising simultaneously with intention means that when one who has manifest covetousness and so on engages in six actions and then simultaneously completes sexual misconduct, they arise simultaneously.

original: re zhig mi dge ba dag dang ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba dag dang ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: That is the extent of nonvirtuous action.🔽Up to ten virtuous actions🔽arise simultaneously with intention.

original: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // dge ba'i las kyi lam dag ni bcu'i bar dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de /
analyzed: dge ba bcu yi bar dag dang // dge ba'i las kyi lam dag ni bcu'i bar dang sems pa lhan cig 'byung ngo zhes spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de /
translated: In general, it is said that up to ten virtuous karmic paths arise simultaneously with intention, but this is specified:

original: gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang min //
analyzed: gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang min //
translated: One, eight, and five do not.

original: las kyi lam gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang lhan cig tu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las kyi lam gcig dang brgyad dang lnga dang lhan cig tu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: One, eight, and five karmic paths do not arise simultaneously.

original: de la gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni de dag rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de la gnyis dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni de dag rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa ni /
translated: Two arising simultaneously with intention means that when one abiding in five consciousnesses

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: arises from the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space and the meditative attainment of the summit of existence, the intention of the desire realm that is the actual basis of the first absorption arises simultaneously with the five sense consciousnesses.

original: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Three together with the arising of the pratimoksa vows means when abiding in the mental consciousness concomitant with right view.

original: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
analyzed: bzhi dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge tshul gyi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
translated: Four together with the arising of the pratimoksa vows means when possessing a virtuous, nonvirtuous or neutral mind and correctly taking up the vows of a novice.

original: drug dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa de yang dag par len pa na'o //🔽bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par @210a * //
analyzed: drug dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa de yang dag par len pa na'o // bdun dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par @210a * //
translated: Six together with the arising of the pratimoksa vows means when abiding in the five virtuous sense consciousnesses and correctly taking up the pratimoksa vows.

original: shes pa la gnas te de kho na yang dag par len pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
analyzed: shes pa la gnas te de kho na yang dag par len pa dang / mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa na'o //
translated: Seven together with the arising of the pratimoksa vows means when abiding in virtuous mental consciousness and correctly taking up the pratimoksa vows and when possessing a nonvirtuous or neutral mind and correctly taking up the vows of a fully ordained monk.🔽Eight together with the arising of the pratimoksa vows means when abiding in nonvirtuous or neutral mental consciousness and correctly taking up the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: dgu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa de yang dag par len pa dang /
analyzed: dgu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni dge ba'i rnam par shes pa lnga la gnas pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa de yang dag par len pa dang /
translated: Nine occurring simultaneously means that when abiding in the five virtuous sense consciousnesses and the mind consciousness concomitant with the knowledge of elimination and nonarising, one also takes up the vows of a fully ordained monk.🔽Ten occurring simultaneously means that when abiding in the mind consciousness subsumed by the absorptions, all the volition that occurs simultaneously with the absorptions and uncontaminated vows, except for the virtuous mind consciousness other than those and the knowledge of elimination and nonarising, takes up the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: de nyid bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa la gnas pa bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'i dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa kho na dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kho na ma gtogs pa bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i sems pa thams cad yin no //🔽sdom pa ma gtogs par ni gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de nyid bsam gtan gyis bsdus pa la gnas pa bcu dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni de las gzhan pa'i dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas pa dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par len pa kho na dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kho na ma gtogs pa bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i sems pa thams cad yin no // sdom pa ma gtogs par ni gcig dang lhan cig 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: Vows do not occur simultaneously with one,🔽because it is said that one branch of abandoning is taken up.

original: sems gzhan dang ldan pa spong ba'i yan lag gcig yang dag par len pa na'o //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang ldan pa spong ba'i yan lag gcig yang dag par len pa na'o //
translated: One does not occur simultaneously with one, because it is said that one branch of abandoning is taken up when possessing another mind.

original: lnga dang brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lnga dang brgyad dang lhan cig 'byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also the arising of five and eight together.

original: dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa cig car du yan lag gnyis dang lnga yang dag par len pa na'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa cig car du yan lag gnyis dang lnga yang dag par len pa na'o //
translated: When one who possesses a wholesome mental consciousness simultaneously takes up two or five branches.

original: 'gro ba gang na dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang na dge ba'am mi dge ba'i las kyi lam du zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'am ldan pa'i sgo nas yod ce na /
translated: In which realm of rebirth are the paths of action virtuous or nonvirtuous, by being manifest or possessed?

original: dmyal ba na ni kyal pa dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: dmyal ba na ni kyal pa dang // tshig rtsub gnod sems rnam gnyis so //
translated: In the hells, idle chatter, harsh words and malice exist in both ways.

original: dmyal ba na ni las kyi lam 'di gsum mngon sum du gyur pa dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas yod de /🔽smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir tshig kyal pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba na ni las kyi lam 'di gsum mngon sum du gyur pa dang ldan pa dang rnam pa gnyi ga'i sgo nas yod de / smre sngags 'don pa'i phyir tshig kyal pa yin no //
translated: In the hells, these three paths of action exist in both ways, by being manifest and possessed.🔽Idle chatter exists there because of lamenting.

original: phan tshun brgyad gags byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub po yin no//
analyzed: phan tshun brgyad gags byed pa'i phyir tshig rtsub po yin no//
translated: Harsh words exist there because of mutual obstruction.

original: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir gnod sems yin no //
analyzed: gcig la gcig sems kyi rgyud rtsub pos zhe sdang ba'i phyir gnod sems yin no //
translated: Malice exists there because of mutual enmity through the continuum of mind being rough.

original: brnab sems log lta ldan pas so //
analyzed: brnab sems log lta ldan pas so //
translated: Covetousness and wrong view exist there by being possessed.

original: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
analyzed: chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
translated: They do not exist by way of direct perception, because there is no object of attachment and because the effect of action is directly perceived.

original: las zad nas 'chi ba'i phyir dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
analyzed: las zad nas 'chi ba'i phyir dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dag med do //
translated: They do not exist by way of killing, stealing, or sexual misconduct, because one dies when the life force is exhausted and because there is no appropriation of substances or women.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba med do //
translated: They do not exist by way of lying, because there is no need for it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dang / rtag tu byed zin pa'i phyir phra ma med do //🔽sgra mi snyan @210b na gsum yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dang / rtag tu byed zin pa'i phyir phra ma med do // sgra mi snyan @210b na gsum yod do //
translated: They do not exist by way of slander, because there is no need for it and because it is always done.

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang log par lta ba dag ste /
translated: They exist by way of covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: ldan pa'i sgo nas yod par sbyar gyi nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyud 'jam pa'i phyir dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
analyzed: ldan pa'i sgo nas yod par sbyar gyi nga yir 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir dang / rgyud 'jam pa'i phyir dang / kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir dang / sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni med do //
translated: They are not present in the form of possession, because there is no grasping of “mine” there, because there is no mental continuum, because there is no basis for malice, and because there is no sinful intention.

original: de na bdun pa dngos su yang //
analyzed: de na bdun pa dngos su yang //
translated: The seventh is also present there in the form of manifestation.

original: de na tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas yang yod de /
analyzed: de na tshig kyal pa ni mngon sum du gyur pa'i sgo nas yang yod de /
translated: Frivolous speech is also present there in the form of manifestation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems su gyur pa de dag ni res 'ga' glu dag len to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems su gyur pa de dag ni res 'ga' glu dag len to //
translated: Those who are in a defiled state of mind sometimes sing songs.

original: sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshe nges pa'i phyir dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi bsam pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / tshe nges pa'i phyir dang / rdzas dang bud med yongs su gzung ba med pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir srog gcod pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: There is no killing, etc. there, because there is no sinful intention, because life is fixed, because there is no appropriation of property or women, and because there is no need for it.

original: ji ltar 'di dag mi tshangs par spyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag mi tshangs par spyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are not celibate?

original: de dag ni bud med gang dag lhan cig dga' bar 'dod pa de'i lag nas gzung nas zhing gi drung du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bud med gang dag lhan cig dga' bar 'dod pa de'i lag nas gzung nas zhing gi drung du 'gro ste /
translated: They take the hand of a woman with whom they wish to copulate and go to a field.

original: gal te bgrod par bya ba zhig yin na ni shing gis sgrib par byed pas de dag de la nyal po byed do //
analyzed: gal te bgrod par bya ba zhig yin na ni shing gis sgrib par byed pas de dag de la nyal po byed do //
translated: If the field is one that is to be entered, they enter it and have intercourse with her.

original: ci ste bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig yin na ni sgrib par mi byed pas ni de dag de la nyal po mi byed do //
analyzed: ci ste bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig yin na ni sgrib par mi byed pas ni de dag de la nyal po mi byed do //
translated: If the field is one that is not to be entered, they do not enter it and do not have intercourse with her.

original: 'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu //🔽dngos su yang yod ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan na mi dge bcu // dngos su yang yod ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The ten nonvirtuous actions exist in the desire realm.🔽The ten nonvirtuous actions exist in the desire realm in the sense that they are manifest and also in the sense that they are possessed.

original: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan dag las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams na ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
translated: They are manifest in the desire realm except in hells and Uttarakuru.

original: dud 'gro dang yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang yi dags dang lha dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pa ma gtogs so //
translated: They are not manifest among animals, ghosts and gods, except for those who have violated their vows.

original: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa yang yod do //
translated: They are manifest among humans who have violated their vows.

original: gal te yang lhas lha mi gsod kyang 'gro ba gzhan na gnas na ni gsod par byed do //
analyzed: gal te yang lhas lha mi gsod kyang 'gro ba gzhan na gnas na ni gsod par byed do //
translated: If the gods do not kill the gods, they kill beings of other destinies.

original: gzhan dag na re lha yang mgo dang rked pa bcad na 'chi'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lha yang mgo dang rked pa bcad na 'chi'o zhes zer ro //
translated: According to other masters, the gods die through the sword, etc., when they are deprived of reason.

original: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the unwholesome paths of action.

original: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na //🔽rnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas //🔽brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams ni khams gsum po thams cad na /
analyzed: dge ba gsum ni thams cad na // rnyed dang mngon du gyur sgo nas // brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams ni khams gsum po thams cad na /
translated: The wholesome ones exist in all three realms.🔽The wholesome ones exist in all three realms.

original: 'gro ba lnga char du ni mngon du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga char du ni mngon du gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yod do //
translated: Non-covetousness, non-ill-will, right view exist in the five destinies of the realm of desire.

original: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can //🔽rnyed pa bdun yod /
analyzed: gzugs med 'du shes med sems can // rnyed pa bdun yod /
translated: They exist in the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, but not actualized there.🔽The wholesome paths of action exist in the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, but not actualized there.

original: @211a * // gzugs med pa dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag na ni lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun ldan pa'i sgo kho na nas yod de /
analyzed: @211a * // gzugs med pa dang 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag na ni lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun ldan pa'i sgo kho na nas yod de /
translated: The seven material wholesome paths of action exist in the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, but not actualized there.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i 'phags pa rnams la zag pa med pa'i sdom pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noble ones born in the formless realm possess past and future uncontaminated vows.🔽Beings devoid of discernment possess the absorption vows.

original: gzugs med pa dag na 'phags pas gang la brten pa can gyi zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims bskyed de 'gag pa ni 'das pa de dang ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na 'phags pas gang la brten pa can gyi zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims bskyed de 'gag pa ni 'das pa de dang ldan no //
translated: The noble ones born in the formless realm generate uncontaminated ethics dependent on the formless realm and possess past uncontaminated ethics when it has ceased.

original: sa lnga char la brten pa can dang ma 'das pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: sa lnga char la brten pa can dang ma 'das pa dang ldan no //
translated: They possess future uncontaminated ethics dependent on the five levels.

original: lhag par byas na mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang //
analyzed: lhag par byas na mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang //
translated: If one is superior, one possesses it through manifest action.

original: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
analyzed: dmyal bcas sgra mi snyan ma gtogs //
translated: Except for hell beings and beings of Uttarakuru.🔽The remainder are superior.

original: lhag mar byas pas na lhag byas te lhag mar byas pas ni khams sam 'gro ba gzhan gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mar byas pas na lhag byas te lhag mar byas pas ni khams sam 'gro ba gzhan gang yin pa'o //
translated: The remainder are superior to those who do not possess them.

original: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag ma gtogs pa de na ni dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po 'di dag mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
analyzed: dmyal ba dang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag ma gtogs pa de na ni dge ba'i las kyi lam bdun po 'di dag mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas kyang yod de /
translated: Except for the hells and Uttarakuru, these seven virtuous paths of action exist there through actual accomplishment.

original: de dag kyang dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi nang dag na ni sdom pas bsdus pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang dud 'gro dang yi dags kyi nang dag na ni sdom pas bsdus pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: In the animal and ghost realms, they are not included in the vows.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni sdom pas bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni sdom pas bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: In the form realm, they are included in the vows.

original: gzhan na ni gnyis ga yod do //
analyzed: gzhan na ni gnyis ga yod do //
translated: In other realms, they are both.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These ten virtuous and nonvirtuous paths of action🔽are asserted to produce a dominant result,

original: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad bdag po rgyu mthun dang // rnam smin 'bras bu 'byin par 'dod //
translated: a result that is a natural outflow,🔽and a ripened result.

original: re zhig mi dge ba kun du bstan pa dang goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pa thams cad kyis ni dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig mi dge ba kun du bstan pa dang goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pa thams cad kyis ni dmyal ba dag gi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: All nonvirtuous actions that are taught, cultivated, and frequently practiced cause birth in the hells.

original: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is their ripened result.

original: brgya la 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang srog gcod pas ni tshe thung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgya la 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang srog gcod pas ni tshe thung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they come here to the human realm, they will have a short life due to killing.

original: ma byin par len pas ni longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par len pas ni longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be poor due to stealing.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni dgra dang bcas pa'i chung ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have a wife with enemies due to sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun du smra bas ni skur ba mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas ni skur ba mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be much slandered due to lying.

original: phra mas ni de mdza' bo dang 'byed par 'gyur ro //🔽tshig rtsub pos ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni de mdza' bo dang 'byed par 'gyur ro // tshig rtsub pos ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be separated from their friends due to divisive speech.🔽They will hear unpleasant sounds due to harsh speech.

original: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro //🔽brnab sems kyis ni 'dod @211b chags shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal pas ni tshig gzung bar mi 'os par 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'dod @211b chags shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be untrustworthy due to idle chitchat.🔽They will have excessive desire due to covetousness.

original: gnod sems kyas ni zhe sdang shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyas ni zhe sdang shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have excessive anger due to malice.

original: log par lta bas ni gti mug shas che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par lta bas ni gti mug shas che bar 'gyur te /
translated: They will have excessive delusion due to wrong views.

original: de la ni gti mug mang po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni gti mug mang po'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is much delusion there.

original: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the natural outflow of these actions.

original: ma dag gi nang na tshe thung ba yang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin na de ji ltar srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma dag gi nang na tshe thung ba yang mi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yin na de ji ltar srog gcod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: But if a short life is the ripened effect of nonvirtuous action, how can it be the effect of the evolution of killing?

original: tshe de nyid de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid de'i 'bras bu yin no zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that this life is the effect of killing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: des tshe thung ngur 'gyur bas de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i phyir rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des tshe thung ngur 'gyur bas de'i phyir srog gcod pa ni tshe de'i bar chad byed pa'i phyir rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the cause of a short life because it is the cause of the obstacles to a longer life.

original: srog gcod pa ha cang kun du bsten pas ni phyi'i dngos po rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang char ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ha cang kun du bsten pas ni phyi'i dngos po rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur ro // ma byin par len pas ni ser ba dang char ba mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the excessive practice of killing, external things are of little vitality.🔽By stealing, there is hail and frost.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rngul gyis 'khrig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem pas ni rngul gyis 'khrig par 'gyur ro //
translated: By sexual misconduct, there is dust and dirt.

original: brdzun du smra bas ni dring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas ni dring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By lying, there is much deception.

original: phra mas ni mthon dman can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni mthon dman can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By malicious speech, there is high and low ground.🔽By frivolous speech, the seasons are reversed.

original: tshig rtsub pos ni sa tshva sgo can dang / dgon dung dang / tha chad dang / sdig pa can gyi sar 'gyur ro //🔽tshig kyal pas ni dus log pa can du 'gyur ro //🔽brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rtsub pos ni sa tshva sgo can dang / dgon dung dang / tha chad dang / sdig pa can gyi sar 'gyur ro // tshig kyal pas ni dus log pa can du 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: By harsh speech, a land with salty soil, a land of thorns, a land of misfortune, a land of sin.🔽By idle chatter, a land with untimely frosts.🔽By covetousness, small fruits.🔽

original: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu kha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By harsh speech, a land with salty and bitter soil, a land with much wind and heat, a land with much dust and sand, a land with much gravel and thorns, a land with much disease, a land with much crime, a land with much famine, a land with much fear, a land with much strife, a land with much contention, a land with much slander, a land with much harsh speech, a land with much idle chatter, a land with much sexual misconduct, a land with much false speech, a land with much malicious speech, a land with much harsh speech, a land with much frivolous speech, a land with much covetousness, a land with much ill will, a land with much wrong views.🔽By idle chatter, a land with untimely winds, untimely rains, untimely cold, untimely heat, untimely harvests, untimely fruits, untimely flowers, untimely leaves, untimely birds, untimely animals, untimely men, untimely speech, untimely action.🔽By covetousness, a land with small fruits.🔽By ill will, a land with bitter fruits.

original: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung ngu'am 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par lta bas ni 'bras bu chung ngu'am 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: By wrong views, a land with few fruits or without fruits.

original: 'di ni de dag gi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the dominant result of these actions.

original: ci las de kho nas de 'dir tshe thung ngur 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci las de kho nas de 'dir tshe thung ngur 'gyur ram /
translated: Is it by this action alone that a person has a short life?

original: 'on te gzhan zhig gis she na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig gis she na /
translated: Or by another?

original: kha cig na re de kho nas te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de kho nas te /
translated: Some say: By this action alone.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin la 'di ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yin la 'di ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the ripened result; the other is the result similar to the cause.

original: gzhan dag na re der ni sbyor bas yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re der ni sbyor bas yin la /
translated: Others say: In the first case, it is by the preparatory action;

original: 'dir ni dngos kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos kyis yin te /
translated: in the second case, it is by the principal action.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir srog gcod pas zhes gsungs par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa smos pa'i phyir srog gcod pas zhes gsungs par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: The expression “through killing” is stated in order to include the retinue of the action.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis po 'di las ni mi 'da'i /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur bshad pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dang gnyis po 'di las ni mi 'da'i /
translated: The result that is said to be a natural outflow is not beyond the two results: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: 'dra ba'i khyad par las de skad du bshad par zad do //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i khyad par las de skad du bshad par zad do //
translated: It is said to be a natural outflow from the point of view of its similarity.

original: yang ci'i phyir las kyi lam 'di dag gis 'bras bu rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub ce na /🔽re zhig srog gcod par byed pas ni gsad par bya ba sdug @212a * //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir las kyi lam 'di dag gis 'bras bu rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub ce na / re zhig srog gcod par byed pas ni gsad par bya ba sdug @212a * //
translated: Why do these karmic paths establish three results?🔽One who kills generates suffering in the object to be killed,

original: bsngal bskyed pa dang / gsad pa dang gzi byin med par bya bas yin te /
analyzed: bsngal bskyed pa dang / gsad pa dang gzi byin med par bya bas yin te /
translated: kills it, and robs it of its vitality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di /
translated: For that reason, this is stated:

original: sdug bsngal phyir dang gsad phyir dang // gzi byin med phyir 'bras rnam gsum //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir dang gsad phyir dang // gzi byin med phyir 'bras rnam gsum //
translated: Three results: suffering, killing, and vitality.

original: pha rol po sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol po sdug bsngal bar byas pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus dmyal ba dag tu sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As the result of evolution, one experiences suffering in the hells, because of causing suffering for others.

original: gsad pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe thung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsad pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bus tshe thung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: As the corresponding result, one has a short life, because of killing.

original: gzi byin med par byas pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bus phyi'i sman rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzi byin med par byas pa'i phyir bdag po'i 'bras bus phyi'i sman rnams gzi mthu chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: As the dominant result, external medicines have little potency, because of depriving others of their splendor.

original: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies to the other virtues and vices.

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi 'bras bu gsum yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi 'bras bu gsum yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The three results of the virtuous actions should be understood in the same way.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba kun tu bsten pa dang / goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pas ni lha dag gi nang du skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba kun tu bsten pa dang / goms par byas pa dang / lan mang du byas pas ni lha dag gi nang du skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By frequently, repeatedly, and continually abstaining from killing, one is reborn among the gods.

original: brgya la 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang tshe ring por 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgya la 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs na yang tshe ring por 'gyur te /
translated: If one comes here to the human state, one will have a long life.

original: thams cad mi dge ba las bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi dge ba las bzlog ste sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same method applies to the other virtues.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes gang gsungs pa de gnyis las gzhan pa'i log pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba zhes gang gsungs pa de gnyis las gzhan pa'i log pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is wrong livelihood that is different from wrong speech and wrong action?

original: 'di gzhan ni med kyi de nyid yin te /🔽lus dang ngag las chags las skyes //
analyzed: 'di gzhan ni med kyi de nyid yin te / lus dang ngag las chags las skyes //
translated: It is not different.🔽Wrong livelihood is by nature the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: log 'tsho // lus dang ngag gi las kyi mtha' zhe sdang las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa ni log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' yin no //🔽de ni sbyang dka'i phyir /
analyzed: log 'tsho // lus dang ngag gi las kyi mtha' zhe sdang las skyes pa dang / gti mug las skyes pa ni log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' yin no // de ni sbyang dka'i phyir /
translated: Wrong livelihood is by nature the three roots of nonvirtue, greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: de gnyis las logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis las logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: It is taught separately because it is difficult to purify.🔽It is taught separately from wrong speech and wrong action because it is difficult to purify.

original: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas des kun nas bslang ba'i las las sems bsrung bar sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pa'i chos ni 'phrog par byed pa yin pas des kun nas bslang ba'i las las sems bsrung bar sla ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not easy to guard the mind from actions motivated by greed, because greed is the dharma that steals.

original: de'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbyang dka' bas bsgrim par bya ba'i phyir de ni der logs shig tu bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbyang dka' bas bsgrim par bya ba'i phyir de ni der logs shig tu bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught separately as difficult to purify throughout life, because one must be diligent.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: rtag tu lta ba sna tshogs kyis //
analyzed: rtag tu lta ba sna tshogs kyis //
translated: It is difficult for householders

original: khyim pas lta ba sbyang bar dka' //🔽gzhan la 'tsho ba rag lus pa'i //
analyzed: khyim pas lta ba sbyang bar dka' // gzhan la 'tsho ba rag lus pa'i //
translated: to purify their view, since they always have various views.

original: dge slong gis ni 'tsho bar dka' //🔽gal te yo byad la /
analyzed: dge slong gis ni 'tsho bar dka' // gal te yo byad la /
translated: It is difficult for a monk to live🔽whose livelihood depends on others.

original: chags bslang / gang zhig 'tsho ba'i yo byad la //
analyzed: chags bslang / gang zhig 'tsho ba'i yo byad la //
translated: If one is attached to the requisites of life,🔽one’s physical and verbal actions are wrong livelihood.

original: chags pas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kho na log pa'i 'tsho ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chags pas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las kho na log pa'i 'tsho ba yin gyi /
translated: Only physical and verbal actions motivated by attachment to the requisites of life are wrong livelihood.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Other actions are not.

original: bdag @212b dga' bar bya ba'i ched du gar dang glu len pa la sogs pa ni log pa'i 'tsho ba yin par mi rigs so snyam du sems pa de ni /
analyzed: bdag @212b dga' bar bya ba'i ched du gar dang glu len pa la sogs pa ni log pa'i 'tsho ba yin par mi rigs so snyam du sems pa de ni /
translated: One might think that dancing, singing, and so on, for one’s own enjoyment are not wrong livelihood,

original: mdo dang 'gal phyir min /
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal phyir min /
translated: but this is not so, because it contradicts the sūtras.🔽The Buddha said in the Sūtra on the Aggregate of Ethics that watching elephant fights and so on is wrong livelihood.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdo las glang po che 'thab pa la lta ba la sogs pa la yang log pa'i 'tsho ba gzhag ste de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mdo las glang po che 'thab pa la lta ba la sogs pa la yang log pa'i 'tsho ba gzhag ste de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: log pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the complete enjoyment of an object of wrong livelihood.

original: 'di ni rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of wrong livelihood.

original: // / gong du 'bras bu lnga bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag las las gang zhig 'bras bu du zhig 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: // / gong du 'bras bu lnga bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag las las gang zhig 'bras bu du zhig 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of what action among the five results that have been explained?

original: drir bcas spong ba'i lam dag gis //
analyzed: drir bcas spong ba'i lam dag gis //
translated: The path of abandonment, with its object,

original: las ni lnga yi 'bras bur bcas //🔽spong ba'i phyir lam yin pa'am //
analyzed: las ni lnga yi 'bras bur bcas // spong ba'i phyir lam yin pa'am //
translated: has five results.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas spong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pas spong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path is the path of abandonment because it is the path of abandoning, or because it abandons through it.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam yin no //
translated: It is the uninterrupted path.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa de'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu lngas 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa de'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu lngas 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The action of this path, which is impure, is endowed with five results.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Its ripened result is the unpleasant ripened result pertaining to its level.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos 'dra ba phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos 'dra ba phyi ma rnams so //
translated: Its natural result is the future similar factors arisen from concentration.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bral ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni bral ba kho na yin te /
translated: Its result of disconnection is disconnection itself.

original: spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: It is the abandonment itself.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni des drang pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni des drang pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The human action result is the phenomena that it produces,🔽such as the liberated path and that which arises simultaneously with it,

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang de dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gang yang ma 'ongs pa thob pa dang / spangs pa de yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang de dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang / gang yang ma 'ongs pa thob pa dang / spangs pa de yang yin no //
translated: the obtainment of future states and the abandonment of objects to be abandoned.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni sngar byung ba rnams ma gtogs pa rang gi ngo bo las gzhan pa'i 'du byed thams cad do //
translated: The dominant result is all conditioned states other than itself that arise later.

original: dri med bzhi yis /
analyzed: dri med bzhi yis /
translated: Four are stainless.

original: spong ba'i lam zag pa med pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu bzhis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: spong ba'i lam zag pa med pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu bzhis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Any uncontaminated karma of the path of abandoning is accompanied by four results,

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the maturational result.

original: zag bcas gzhan /
analyzed: zag bcas gzhan /
translated: Other contaminated karma.

original: dge dang mi dge gang yin pa'ang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge gang yin pa'ang //
translated: Any virtuous or nonvirtuous

original: spong ba'i lam las gzhan pa'i las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu bzhis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: spong ba'i lam las gzhan pa'i las dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa dang / mi dge ba gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu bzhis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: karma other than the path of abandoning is accompanied by four results,

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of separation.

original: zag pa med pa lhag ma dang / lung stan min gang gsum gyis so //🔽spong pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i las zag pa med pa dang lung du ma @213a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa lhag ma dang / lung stan min gang gsum gyis so // spong pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i las zag pa med pa dang lung du ma @213a * //
translated: and the remaining pure actions and the indeterminate actions.

original: bstan pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu gsum gyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa'i las gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu gsum gyi 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Karma that is other than the path of abandonment, that is, pure and indeterminate karma, is associated with three results.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: It is not associated with the result of karmic maturation and the result of separation.

original: dge ba'i dge la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: dge ba'i dge la sogs pa ni //
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on

original: bzhi dang gnyis dang de bzhin gsum //
analyzed: bzhi dang gnyis dang de bzhin gsum //
translated: have four, two, and three results, respectively.

original: rim pa bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'chad do ;
analyzed: rim pa bzhin no zhes 'og nas 'chad do ;
translated: This will be explained later.

original: / las dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba ni bzhi ste /🔽rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: / las dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba ni bzhi ste / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: The virtuous dharmas that are the result of virtuous karma are four results:🔽the result of conscious effort, the dominant result, the result of natural outflow, and the result of separation.

original: mi dge ba gnyis te /🔽skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / lung du ma bstan pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba gnyis te / skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / lung du ma bstan pa gsum ste /
translated: The nonvirtuous dharmas that are the result of virtuous karma are two results:🔽the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.🔽The indeterminate dharmas that are the result of virtuous karma are three results:

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: the result of conscious effort, the dominant result, and the result of natural outflow.

original: mi dge'i dge sogs gnyis dang ni //
analyzed: mi dge'i dge sogs gnyis dang ni //
translated: The virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on

original: gsum dang bzhi ste rim pa bzhin //
analyzed: gsum dang bzhi ste rim pa bzhin //
translated: have two, three, and four results, respectively.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tsheg ste /
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tsheg ste /
translated: The suffix “-s” is added to the word “anukrama” in the sense of “in due order.”

original: las mi dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba gnyis te /
analyzed: las mi dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba gnyis te /
translated: The result of nonvirtuous action is two results:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: mi dge ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The result of neutral action is three results:

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of conscious effort and the result of natural outflow.🔽The result of neutral action is four results:

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni bzhi ste bral ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni bzhi ste bral ba ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of natural outflow.

original: lung du ma bstan pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag ni mi dge ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //🔽lung bstan min gyi dge la sogs //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag ni mi dge ba kun tu 'gro ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no // lung bstan min gyi dge la sogs //
translated: The two views of the transitory collection and the two views grasping an extreme are the homogeneous result of the nonvirtuous universal mental factors and the nonvirtuous factors abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de dag gnyis dang gsum dang gsum //
analyzed: de dag gnyis dang gsum dang gsum //
translated: The results of neutral action are two, three, and three.

original: las lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu chos dge ba gnyis te /
analyzed: las lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu chos dge ba gnyis te /
translated: The results of neutral action are two results:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: mi dge ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The result of neutral action is three results:🔽excluding the result of natural outflow and the result of separation.

original: bral ba dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bum gtogs so //
analyzed: bral ba dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bum gtogs so //
translated: The effect of disconnection and the effect of ripening are excluded.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i lta ba gnyis kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i lta ba gnyis kyi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The nonvirtuous factors abandoned by insight into the truths of suffering, etc., are the effect of human action of the two neutral views.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three neutral factors:

original: rgyu de dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de dag kho na yin no //
translated: These are the three causes.

original: 'das pa'i thams cad bzhi yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i thams cad bzhi yin no //
translated: All past factors are four effects of past action.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni dus gsum pa rnams te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni dus gsum pa rnams te /
translated: All means factors of the three time periods.

original: 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gsum pa'i chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gsum pa'i chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: The effect of past action is four effects of past factors.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //🔽bar ma yi ni ma 'ongs pa'ang //🔽da ltar byung ba'i las kyi 'bras bu chos ma 'ongs pa yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so // bar ma yi ni ma 'ongs pa'ang // da ltar byung ba'i las kyi 'bras bu chos ma 'ongs pa yang bzhi ste /
translated: The effect of disconnection is excluded.🔽The future effect of present action is also four effects.

original: de dag nyid do //🔽bar ma gnyis so //🔽da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu da ltar byung ba'i @213b chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag nyid do // bar ma gnyis so // da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu da ltar byung ba'i @213b chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The future effect of present action is also four effects.🔽The effect of human action and the effect of dominance are excluded.🔽The present effect of present action is two effects.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: The present effect of present action is two effects: the effect of human action and the effect of dominance.

original: ma skyes pa'i /🔽'bras bu ma 'ongs gsum yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i / 'bras bu ma 'ongs gsum yin no //
translated: 3. the effect of the unarisen.🔽The future effect is three effects.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: The future effect is three effects of future action.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: The effect of human action and the effect of disconnection are excluded.

original: rang gi sa pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa yin no //
translated: The effect of action of a certain stage is a factor of its own stage.

original: rang gi sa pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rang gi sa ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rang gi sa ba'i chos ni bzhi ste /
translated: The effect of action of a certain stage is four effects of a factor of its own stage.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //🔽gzhan gyi sa pa gsum dang gnyis //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so // gzhan gyi sa pa gsum dang gnyis //
translated: The effect of disconnection is excluded.🔽The effect of action of another stage is three or two effects.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sa pa'i chos zag pa med pa zhig yin na ni 'bras bu gsum ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sa pa'i chos zag pa med pa zhig yin na ni 'bras bu gsum ste /
translated: If the factor is pure, the effect of action of another stage is three effects.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: The ripened effect and the effect of disconnection are excluded.

original: khams gsum ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pure factor is not included in the three realms.

original: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin na ni gnyis te /
translated: If the factor is impure, the effect of action of another stage is two effects.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //🔽slob pa'i slob pa sogs pa gsum //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go // slob pa'i slob pa sogs pa gsum //
translated: The effect of human action and the effect of dominance.🔽The effect of action of a trainee, etc.

original: slob pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: The effect of action of a trainee is three effects of a factor of a trainee.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: Excluding the ripened effect and the effect of disconnection.

original: mi slob pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same for the action of the adept.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa yang gsum ste /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa yang gsum ste /
translated: The action of neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee is of three effects,

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the ripened effect and the effect of disconnection.

original: mi slob las kyi 'bras bu ni //🔽slob pa yi ni chos la sogs //
analyzed: mi slob las kyi 'bras bu ni // slob pa yi ni chos la sogs //
translated: The effect of the action of the adept

original: gcig dang gsum dang gnyis yin no //🔽mi slob pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: gcig dang gsum dang gnyis yin no // mi slob pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: is one effect, three effects, two effects,🔽of the factors of the trainee, etc.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //🔽mi slob pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu'o // mi slob pa ni gsum ste /
translated: The effect of the action of the adept is one effect, the dominant effect, with regard to the factors of the trainee.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //🔽slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so // slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis te /
translated: It is three effects, excluding the ripened effect and the effect of disconnection, with regard to the factors of the adept.

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: It is two effects, the effect of service and the dominant effect, with regard to the factors of neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: The other effects🔽are two, two, five effects,

original: slob sogs gnyis dang gnyis dang lnga //
analyzed: slob sogs gnyis dang gnyis dang lnga //
translated: of the action of the trainee, etc.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dag las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: The results of neither-learner-nor-nonlearner karma are the five results, excluding the result of separation.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gnyis te ;
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu slob pa'i chos ni gnyis te ;
translated: The results of learner karma are two results:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: mi slob pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
