original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni 'bras bu lnga char yin no //
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa ni 'bras bu lnga char yin no //
translated: The results of neither-learner-nor-nonlearner karma are the five results.

original: mthong bas spang bya'i de la sogs //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bya'i de la sogs //
translated: Karma to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: gsum dang bzhi dang gcig yin no //
analyzed: gsum dang bzhi dang gcig yin no //
translated: has three, four, and one result.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las @214a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las @214a * //
translated: The results of karma to be abandoned by the path of seeing

original: kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: are three results:

original: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of karmic maturation and the result of separation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: Karma to be abandoned by the path of meditation has four results:

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of separation.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gcig ste /
translated: Karma not to be abandoned has one result:

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the dominant result.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya las kyi //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya las kyi //
translated: The action to be abandoned by the path of cultivation

original: de dag gnyis dang bzhi dang gsum //
analyzed: de dag gnyis dang bzhi dang gsum //
translated: has two, four, and three results in that order.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The action to be abandoned by the path of cultivation has two results that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //
translated: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: It has four results that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation:

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the result of separation.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gsum ste /
translated: It has three results that are not to be abandoned:

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so //
translated: excluding the ripened result and the natural outflow result.

original: spang bya min pa'i de dag gcig //
analyzed: spang bya min pa'i de dag gcig //
translated: The action not to be abandoned

original: gnyis dang bzhi ste go rims bzhin //
analyzed: gnyis dang bzhi ste go rims bzhin //
translated: has one, two, and four results in that order.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gcig ste bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i las kyi 'bras bu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gcig ste bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The action not to be abandoned has one result that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing: the dominant result.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: It has two results that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation:

original: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa dang bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: It has four results that are not to be abandoned:

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: with the exception of the ripened effect.

original: yang go rims bzhin zhes smos pa ni dbus su yang thog ma dang tha ma bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang go rims bzhin zhes smos pa ni dbus su yang thog ma dang tha ma bzhin shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The author adds: “in due order,” in order to show that the middle stage is to be known as the beginning and the end.

original: de ni mthun par sbyor ba'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de ni mthun par sbyor ba'i chos yin no //
translated: This is the rule.

original: las bstan pa'i skabs su 'di yang yongs su bri bar bya ste /🔽bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: las bstan pa'i skabs su 'di yang yongs su bri bar bya ste / bstan bcos dag las /
translated: In the exposition of action, we must also examine the following points:🔽In the treatises, one speaks of action which is produced through non-knowledge, action which is produced through knowledge, action which is produced neither through knowledge nor through non-knowledge.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'i las zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'i las zhes gsungs pa de'i mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of these three actions?

original: rigs min bskyed pa nyon mongs can //
analyzed: rigs min bskyed pa nyon mongs can //
translated: Action produced through non-knowledge is defiled.

original: kha cig cho ga nyams pa zhe'o //🔽kha cig na re rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa ni las nyon mongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: kha cig cho ga nyams pa zhe'o // kha cig na re rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa ni las nyon mongs pa can yin te /
translated: Some say: through transgression of the rule.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid las byung ba las byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid las byung ba las byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Action produced through non-knowledge is defiled action, because it is produced through non-reflection and non-consideration.🔽Some say: Action produced through transgression of the rule is action which is done in excess of the rule, for example, the monk who, after having committed a transgression, continues to exercise his authority as a monk.

original: gzhan dag na re cho ga nyams pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re cho ga nyams pa yang yin te /
translated: Others say: It is also the degeneration of ritual.

original: gang gis ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba dang / bgo bar bya ba dang / de la sogs pa de gzhan du byed na de ni rigs pa ma yin pas byed @214b pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pas skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba dang / bgo bar bya ba dang / de la sogs pa de gzhan du byed na de ni rigs pa ma yin pas byed @214b pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin pas skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one acts in a way that is contrary to the way one should go, stay, eat, dress, and so on, then because one acts in a way that is contrary to what is correct, it is called generated by what is incorrect.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa ni las dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa ni las dge ba yin no //
translated: Correct generation is virtuous karma.

original: gzhan dag na re cho ga ma nyams pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re cho ga ma nyams pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is also the nondegeneration of ritual.

original: de gnyis las gzhan pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //🔽ci las gcig gis skye ba gcig kho na 'phen tam 'on te du ma yang 'phen /🔽de bzhin du las du mas kyang skye ba gcig 'phen tam /
analyzed: de gnyis las gzhan pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o // ci las gcig gis skye ba gcig kho na 'phen tam 'on te du ma yang 'phen / de bzhin du las du mas kyang skye ba gcig 'phen tam /
translated: That which is neither of those two is neither.🔽Do one or many karmas project one birth?🔽Similarly, do one or many karmas project many births?

original: 'on te du ma kho na zhig 'phen zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te du ma kho na zhig 'phen zhe na /
translated: Or do one or many karmas project one birth?

original: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' yin te /
translated: This is a tenet of the Vaibhasikas:

original: gcig gis skye ba gcig 'phen to //
analyzed: gcig gis skye ba gcig 'phen to //
translated: One projects one birth with one karma.

original: las gcig kho nas skye ba gcig kho na 'phen gyi du ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las gcig kho nas skye ba gcig kho na 'phen gyi du ma ni ma yin no //
translated: One single action projects only one single birth, not many.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa la bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa la bya ste /
translated: Birth is the homogeneous collection of components.

original: der phyin nas skye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: der phyin nas skye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Having arrived there, one is said to be born.

original: 'o na gnas brtan ma 'gags pas bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas lan bdun gyi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa nas da ltar sh'akya phyug po'i rigs su skyes pa'i bar du yin no zhes gang🔽smras pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnas brtan ma 'gags pas bdag ni bsod snyoms gcig po de'i rnam par smin pas lan bdun gyi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa nas da ltar sh'akya phyug po'i rigs su skyes pa'i bar du yin no zhes gang smras pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what about the elder Aniruddha who said, “By the evolution of that very single act of giving alms, I was born seven times among the Thirty-Three Gods and now I have been born into a wealthy family of the Śākyas”?

original: 'di des 'byor pa rnyed nas tshe rabs dran pa dang yang bsod nams gzhan byas pas de'i phyir slob pa ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di des 'byor pa rnyed nas tshe rabs dran pa dang yang bsod nams gzhan byas pas de'i phyir slob pa ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: He said this because he remembered his former lives after he had attained a certain stage of spiritual development, and because he had also performed other meritorious actions.

original: dper na mi zhig gis dong tse gcig gis stong du bsgyur te bdag ni dong tse gcig gis dbang phyug 'di thob par gyur to zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi zhig gis dong tse gcig gis stong du bsgyur te bdag ni dong tse gcig gis dbang phyug 'di thob par gyur to zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a man might turn a single coin into a thousand and say, “I have attained this lordship with a single coin.”

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: de bsod snyoms de la brten te sems pa rnams kyi rgyun mang po byung nas 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu 'ga' yongs su gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bsod snyoms de la brten te sems pa rnams kyi rgyun mang po byung nas 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu 'ga' yongs su gzung ba yin no //
translated: and the continuum of the mind of one who has eaten that alms increases, and the result of some of those minds is fully grasped.

original: ris mthun pa dum bur 'phen pa 'gyur du 'ongs bas du mas kyang gcig 'phen pa ma yin gyi las gcig gis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa la las yongs rdzogs byed pa du ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: ris mthun pa dum bur 'phen pa 'gyur du 'ongs bas du mas kyang gcig 'phen pa ma yin gyi las gcig gis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa la las yongs rdzogs byed pa du ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: Many minds do not project one rebirth, for it is possible that a single mind would project many rebirths of the same type. But it is asserted that many minds complete the karma that projects a rebirth of the same type.

original: dper na ri mo mkhan gyi ri lu gcig gis gzugs kyi sa bcad nas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na ri mo mkhan gyi ri lu gcig gis gzugs kyi sa bcad nas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: For example, it is like a painter who sketches an image and then others complete it.

analyzed: 'di ltar mir mtshungs mod kyi /
translated: In this way, although humans are similar,

original: kha cig dbang po dang yan lag dang nying lag thams cad tshang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: kha cig dbang po dang yan lag dang nying lag thams cad tshang bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: kha cig ni de dag las la lam tshang ba yin no //

analyzed: las 'ba' zhig tshe 'phen par byed pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa gzhan yang yin no//

original: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs shas chen ngan 'gro dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / sgra mi snyan sgrib gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: mtshams med pa yi las rnams dang // nyon mongs shas chen ngan 'gro dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / sgra mi snyan sgrib gsum du 'dod //
translated: the sentient beings without discrimination, and Uttarakuru.

original: mtshams med pa'i las rnams ni las kyi sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las rnams ni las kyi sgrib pa yin te /
translated: The five actions of immediate retribution are the obstruction of action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
translated: to kill one's father, to kill one's mother, to kill an arhat, to cause a schism in the Saṅgha, and to draw blood from a Tathāgata with an evil thought.

original: nyon mongs pa shas chen po ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shas chen po ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The great defilements are the obstruction of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of defilements:

original: nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang rno ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang rno ba'o //
translated: great and small.

original: de la shas che ba ni rgyun du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //🔽rno ba ni chen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la shas che ba ni rgyun du 'byung ba gang yin pa'o // rno ba ni chen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the great are those that are chronic,🔽and the small are those that are intense.

original: de la shas che ba gang yin pa de ni sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: de la shas che ba gang yin pa de ni sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Among them, the great are the obstructions,

original: dper na za ma la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na za ma la sogs pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: for example, like those of the eunuch, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa res 'ga' 'byung ba ni shugs drag kyang gzhom par nus kyis rgyun du 'byung ba ni dpal yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa res 'ga' 'byung ba ni shugs drag kyang gzhom par nus kyis rgyun du 'byung ba ni dpal yang ma yin te /
translated: The defilements which appear from time to time, even if they are strong, can be overcome. But those which are constant are not so easily overcome.

original: nyon mongs pa rgyun du 'byung ba ni de nges par gzhom pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i dus mi rnyed do //🔽de ni chung ngu la brten nas 'bring skye'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rgyun du 'byung ba ni de nges par gzhom pa'i phyir rtsol ba'i dus mi rnyed do // de ni chung ngu la brten nas 'bring skye'o //
translated: When the defilements are constant, one does not find the time to make an effort to overcome them.

original: 'bring la brten nas chen po skye ste /
analyzed: 'bring la brten nas chen po skye ste /
translated: The weak defilements, in fact, give rise to the medium ones, and the medium ones to the strong ones.

original: de lta bas na de nyid sgrib pa yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na de nyid sgrib pa yin no /
translated: Thus, they are obscurations.

original: ngan 'gro rnam pa gsum dang / bde 'gro'i phyogs byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnam pa gsum dang / bde 'gro'i phyogs byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: The three unfortunate destinies, the northern continent of Kuru, and the gods without ideation are obscurations consisting of retribution.

original: 'di dag gang la sgrib ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag gang la sgrib ce na /
translated: What do they obscure?

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la sgrib bo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang / 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la sgrib bo //
translated: They obscure the noble path and the roots of good which lead to the noble path.

original: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba dang / sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / @215b drod gsher las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med nyid du 'gyur ba dang / srid pa brgyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i las gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba dang / sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / @215b drod gsher las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med nyid du 'gyur ba dang / srid pa brgyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i las gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Other actions that are certain to lead to unfortunate rebirths, to rebirth from an egg, to rebirth from moisture, to rebirth as a woman, or to rebirth in the eighth existence should also be mentioned.

original: gang dag gzhi dang / 'bras bu dang / 'gro ba dang / skye ba dang / gang zag dang / rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing gdags par bya ba de dag kho na bshad kyis gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gzhi dang / 'bras bu dang / 'gro ba dang / skye ba dang / gang zag dang / rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing gdags par bya ba de dag kho na bshad kyis gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But only those actions that are easy to teach and designate by means of the five topics—basis, effect, realm, rebirth, and person—are explained, not others.

original: de dag las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni thams cad kyi tha shal yin no //
analyzed: de dag las nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni thams cad kyi tha shal yin no //
translated: Among them, the obscuration of affliction is the worst of all.

original: de'i 'og tu ni las kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni las kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: After that, there is the obscuration of action.

original: de gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma la yang gsor mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni tshe phyi ma la yang gsor mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By those two, one becomes incurable even in a future life.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re phyi ma phyi ma 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re phyi ma phyi ma 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: Because the latter is drawn by the former.

original: mtshams med pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ānantarya?

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'bras bu can gyi las dag gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod par mi nus pas mtshams med pa rnams te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi 'bras bu can gyi las dag gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i bar du gcod par mi nus pas mtshams med pa rnams te /
translated: They are ānantarya because they are incapable of being interrupted by the maturation of other actions that would produce results in other lives.

original: zil gyis mi gnon zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zil gyis mi gnon zhes bya pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term is that they are not overcome.

original: yang na de byed pa'i gang zag 'di nas shi 'phos pa dang dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba la bar chad med pas de ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de byed pa'i gang zag 'di nas shi 'phos pa dang dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba la bar chad med pas de ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: Or, the person who commits them is reborn in hell without interruption after death here.

original: de'i dngos po ni bar chad med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bar chad med pa nyid de /
translated: The state of being without interruption is ānantarya.

original: chos gang dang ldan pa'i phyir de bar chad med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gang dang ldan pa'i phyir de bar chad med pa yin te /
translated: It is an ānantarya because it possesses the quality of ānantarya.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul bzhin no //🔽yang sgrib pa 'di dag las gang zhig khams gang na yod par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul bzhin no // yang sgrib pa 'di dag las gang zhig khams gang na yod par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: It is like the term śrāmaṇya.🔽In which realms are the obstructions found?

original: re zhig gcig tu /
analyzed: re zhig gcig tu /
translated: The first two are found in the desire realm.

original: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod //
analyzed: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod //
translated: The heinous acts exist in the three continents.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'gro ba gzhan dag na yang med na khams gzhan na lta smos kyang ci dgos /🔽de dag na yang skyes pa dang bud med rnams kho na la yod kyi /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / 'gro ba gzhan dag na yang med na khams gzhan na lta smos kyang ci dgos / de dag na yang skyes pa dang bud med rnams kho na la yod kyi /
translated: They do not exist in Uttarakuru or in other destinies.

original: zam la sogs pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: zam la sogs pa mi 'dod do //
translated: They exist only for men and women, not for eunuchs and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the reasons for the absence of vows are the same.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / phan dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir //🔽pha ma dang de dag dang go rims bzhin te /🔽pha ma ni de dag gi lus ma tshangs ba'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byams pa chung pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phan dang ngo tsha chung ba'i phyir // pha ma dang de dag dang go rims bzhin te / pha ma ni de dag gi lus ma tshangs ba'i bdag por 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / byams pa chung pa'i phyir phan pa chung ba yin no //
translated: because they have little compassion and shame.🔽They have little compassion and shame, respectively.🔽Their parents are of little compassion because they are the lords of their incomplete bodies.

original: de dag kyang pha ma la gang dag med par byas pas mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i shas ches po nye bar mi gnas te /
analyzed: de dag kyang pha ma la gang dag med par byas pas mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i shas ches po nye bar mi gnas te /
translated: They have little shame because they do not have the shame and embarrassment that would prevent them from committing the heinous acts that would otherwise occur.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams la yang mi 'dod do @216a * //🔽zhes grag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams la yang mi 'dod do @216a * // zhes grag go //
translated: The same holds for hungry ghosts and animals.🔽This is the opinion of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: btsun pa na re blo gsal ba rnams la 'gyur te rta cang shes bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: btsun pa na re blo gsal ba rnams la 'gyur te rta cang shes bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The Bhadanta says: “The offense is mortal when the mind is clear, as in the case of the horse Aśvakaṭi.

original: mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa bsad na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa bsad na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ” If the parents of a human are non-human, there is no mortal sin.

original: las kyi sgrib pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained the obscurations that consist of actions.

original: lhag ma 'gro ba lnga dag na //
analyzed: lhag ma 'gro ba lnga dag na //
translated: The obscurations that consist of defilements and of retribution🔽are, respectively, the most active defilement and the most active retribution among humans.

original: lhag ma gang dag ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma gang dag ci yin zhe na /
translated: What are the remaining ones?

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The most active defilement and the most active retribution among humans.

original: mi dag gi nang na ni sgra mi snyan pa rnam par sman pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dag gi nang na ni sgra mi snyan pa rnam par sman pa'i sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Among humans, the most active defilement is lust; the most active retribution is the life of the Uttarakurus.

original: lha dag gi nang na ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: lha dag gi nang na ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: Among the gods, the most active defilement is lack of awareness; the most active retribution is the life of the gods without ideation.

original: mtshams med pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of the mortal transgressions?

original: bzhi ni lus kyi las yin la //
analyzed: bzhi ni lus kyi las yin la //
translated: Four are mortal transgressions by their intrinsic nature.

original: gcig ni ngag gi las yin te //
analyzed: gcig ni ngag gi las yin te //
translated: One is a mortal transgression by the effect.

original: gsum ni srog gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni srog gcod pa yin no //
translated: Three are mortal transgressions by their intrinsic nature.

original: gcig ni brdzun du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni brdzun du smra ba yin no //
translated: One is a mortal transgression by the effect.

original: gcig ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gcig ni srog gcod pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The first is the preparation for taking life.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nye bar mi brdzi ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nye bar mi brdzi ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: The Tathagatas are not to be killed.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa'am /
translated: The cause is designated as the effect.

original: 'dis 'byed par byed pas na dge 'dun gyi dbyen la mtshams med pa zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: 'dis 'byed par byed pas na dge 'dun gyi dbyen la mtshams med pa zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Or else, it is called an immediate because it is the schism of the Saṅgha, since it divides the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa'i //🔽rang bzhin ldan pas ma yin chos //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa'i // rang bzhin ldan pas ma yin chos //
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is not a mental factor.

original: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min lung bstan min //
translated: It is not associated with mind, nor is it neutral.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni mi 'phrod pa zhes bya ba sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de /
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is a nonassociated compositional factor called discord.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin na de ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin na de ji ltar mtshams med par 'gyur /
translated: If it is unobscured and neutral, how can it be an immediate?

original: de dang byed pa por yang mi ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dang byed pa por yang mi ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is not possessed by the agent.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽de dang dge 'dun yang dag ldan //🔽gang bye ba de dbyen dang ldan gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / de dang dge 'dun yang dag ldan // gang bye ba de dbyen dang ldan gyi /
translated: How is it possessed?🔽It is possessed by the Saṅgha that is divided.

original: 'byed pa po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byed pa po la ni ma yin no //
translated: The schismatic possesses the schism, but not the one who is divided.

original: 'o na 'byed pa po ci dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'byed pa po ci dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the schismatic?

original: de yi kha na ma tho brdzun //🔽de dang byed po yang dag ldan //🔽'byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi kha na ma tho ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: de yi kha na ma tho brdzun // de dang byed po yang dag ldan // 'byed pa po ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi kha na ma tho ba dang ldan te /

original: de ni brdzun yin no //🔽de yang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de ni brdzun yin no // de yang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ngag gi rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dag yin no //
translated: The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.

original: kha na ma tho ba de dang ldan pa'i byed pa po de ni /🔽bskal par mnar med par smin 'gyur //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba de dang ldan pa'i byed pa po de ni / bskal par mnar med par smin 'gyur //
translated: The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.

original: bar gyi bskal par mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por smin par 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan gyis ni mnar med par ma nges so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal par mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen por smin par 'gyur ro // gzhan gyis ni mnar med par ma nges so //
translated: The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.

original: yang gang zhig gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la /🔽de dag @216b bar chad med pa kho na smin par 'gyur na de la de dag gis ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig gis mtshams med pa mang po byas pa yin la /🔽de dag @216b bar chad med pa kho na smin par 'gyur na de la de dag gis ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.🔽The schismatic possesses the lie that is a grave offense.

original: lhag pas gnod pa lhag par 'gyur //
analyzed: lhag pas gnod pa lhag par 'gyur //
translated: The greater the excess, the greater the harm.

original: de mtshams med pa mang pos mnar med pa der gang gis na gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lngar 'gyur gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus chen po dang / shin tu gzhon sha can gyi lus 'thob cing /
analyzed: de mtshams med pa mang pos mnar med pa der gang gis na gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lngar 'gyur gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i lus chen po dang / shin tu gzhon sha can gyi lus 'thob cing /
translated: The schismatic obtains a body in the Avīci hell which is so large that it experiences the tortures of two, three, four, and five of the hells.

original: gnod pa yang rab tu mang ba dang shin tu mi bzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa yang rab tu mang ba dang shin tu mi bzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: His tortures are also multiplied and intensified.🔽Who is the schismatic?

original: dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa de su zhig yin zhe na /🔽dge slong dka' spyod tshul ldan pas //🔽'byed do // dge slong gis 'byed kyi khyim pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa de su zhig yin zhe na / dge slong dka' spyod tshul ldan pas // 'byed do // dge slong gis 'byed kyi khyim pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The schismatic is a bhikṣu,

original: dge slong ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: a bhikṣu divides, not a layman, not a bhikṣuṇī, etc.

original: de yang lta ba spyod pa kho nas 'byed kyi sred pa spyod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang lta ba spyod pa kho nas 'byed kyi sred pa spyod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He divides by means of views, not by means of craving.

original: tshul dang ldan pas 'byed kyi tshul nyams pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul dang ldan pas 'byed kyi tshul nyams pas ni ma yin te /
translated: He divides by means of morality, not by means of immorality,

original: de'i tshig mi btsan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshig mi btsan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for his word is not authoritative.

original: gang du 'byed ce na /
analyzed: gang du 'byed ce na /
translated: Where does the schism take place?

original: gang na bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du bzhugs pa de las /
analyzed: gang na bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du bzhugs pa de las /
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is impossible where the Bhagavat is,

original: gzhan du'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bzod par dka' ba'i phyir dang / bka' stsal ba'i phyir ston pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa nyid du dbye par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan du'o // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni bzod par dka' ba'i phyir dang / bka' stsal ba'i phyir ston pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa nyid du dbye par mi nus so //
translated: because the Tathāgatas are difficult to combat and because the word of the Teacher is not contradicted.

original: su dag cig 'byed ce na /
analyzed: su dag cig 'byed ce na /
translated: Who splits the Saṅgha?

original: byis pa rnams /
analyzed: byis pa rnams /
translated: The fools.

original: byis pa rnams kho na yin gyi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kho na yin gyi 'phags pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Only fools, not the noble ones,

original: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma is evident to them.

original: kha cig na re de dag las kyang bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re de dag las kyang bzod pa thob pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: According to one opinion, those who have obtained the results are not susceptible of being divided.

original: ji tsam gyis na dge 'dun bye ba yin zhe na /🔽ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na dge 'dun bye ba yin zhe na / ston dang lam gzhan la bzod pa //
translated: What is the Saṅgha divided?🔽When it consents to another master and another path.

original: bye ba'o // gang gi tshe de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i ston pa dang des bstan pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i lam la bzod na de tsam gyis dge 'dun bye ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bye ba'o // gang gi tshe de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan pa'i ston pa dang des bstan pa'i lam las gzhan pa'i lam la bzod na de tsam gyis dge 'dun bye ba zhes brjod do //
translated: When the Saṅgha consents to another master than the Tathāgata and to another path than the path preached by the Tathāgata, then it is divided.

original: bye nas dus ji srid du cig tu 'dug ce na /
analyzed: bye nas dus ji srid du cig tu 'dug ce na /
translated: How long does the schism last?

original: de nyid kyi nub gcig tu de ni mi gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nub gcig tu de ni mi gnas so //
translated: It does not last until dawn.

original: dge 'dun dbye na gdon mi za bar nam ma langs pa nyid du dge 'dun slar 'dum par 'gyur ro //🔽dge 'dun gyi dbyen du bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye na gdon mi za bar nam ma langs pa nyid du dge 'dun slar 'dum par 'gyur ro // dge 'dun gyi dbyen du bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: When the Saṅgha is split, the Saṅgha is certainly reconciled before dawn.

original: de ni 'khor lo'i dbyen du 'dod //🔽de'i tshe lam du 'jug pa'i bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang phye ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'khor lo'i dbyen du 'dod // de'i tshe lam du 'jug pa'i bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang phye ba yin te /
translated: The schism of the Saṅgha is the schism of the Wheel.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lo'i dbyen zhes kyang bya la /🔽dge 'dun @217a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor lo'i dbyen zhes kyang bya la / dge 'dun @217a * //
translated: At the moment when the schism of the Saṅgha takes place, there is also a schism of the Wheel of the Law, because the Wheel of the Law is then arrested.

original: gyi dbyen zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: gyi dbyen zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The schism of the Wheel is the schism of the Saṅgha.

original: 'khor lo'i dbyen yang gang na yod ce na /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbyen yang gang na yod ce na /
translated: Where does the schism of the Wheel take place?

original: 'dzam bu'i gling na'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling na'o //
translated: In Jambudvīpa.

original: gling gzhan dag na ni med do //
analyzed: gling gzhan dag na ni med do //
translated: It does not take place elsewhere.

original: dge slong du zhig gis she na /
analyzed: dge slong du zhig gis she na /
translated: By how many is the schism of the Saṅgha accomplished?

original: dgu sogs kyis dgu la sogs pa smos pas yan chad ni ma nges so //
analyzed: dgu sogs kyis dgu la sogs pa smos pas yan chad ni ma nges so //
translated: By nine and more. The expression and more shows that the schism is not accomplished with exactly nine monks.

original: dge slong brgyad ni dge 'dun yin no //
analyzed: dge slong brgyad ni dge 'dun yin no //
translated: Eight monks constitute a Saṅgha;

original: dgu pa ni 'byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: dgu pa ni 'byed pa po yin te /
translated: The ninth is the one who divides.

original: gdon mi za bar dge 'dun phyogs gnyis su gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni bye ba yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dge 'dun phyogs gnyis su gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni bye ba yin no //
translated: The schism is the fact of the division of the Saṅgha into two factions, which necessarily results from the schismatic act.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen gzhan ni las kyi dbyen las 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen gzhan ni las kyi dbyen las 'gyur te /
translated: Other schisms of the Saṅgha result from the schism of the rite.

original: gal te mtshams gcig gi nang du mi mthun pas las dag byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te mtshams gcig gi nang du mi mthun pas las dag byed na'o //
translated: When, in one territory, the monks divide themselves into two groups and perform the poṣadha rite separately, this is a schism of the rite.

original: las kyi dbyen ni gling gsum na yod de /
analyzed: las kyi dbyen ni gling gsum na yod de /
translated: The schism of the rite exists in the three continents.

original: gang dag na bstan pa yod pa kho na na'o //
analyzed: gang dag na bstan pa yod pa kho na na'o //
translated: It exists only where the teaching exists.

original: dge slong du zhig gis she na /
analyzed: dge slong du zhig gis she na /
translated: By how many monks is the schism of the Saṅgha accomplished?🔽The schism of the Saṅgha is accomplished by a group of at least nine, for it is impossible for a smaller group to entertain contradictory opinions.

original: de ni brgya da dag yan chad kyis 'khor lo'i dbye na ni dus drug dag tu mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni brgya da dag yan chad kyis 'khor lo'i dbye na ni dus drug dag tu mi 'byung ste /
translated: The schism of the Wheel is not accomplished in six circumstances.

original: gang dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag tu zhe na /
translated: In what six circumstances?🔽1. Before the first pair of disciples;

original: dang po mtha' skyon zung gcig gi //🔽snga rol thub pa nongs pa dang // mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang //
analyzed: dang po mtha' skyon zung gcig gi // snga rol thub pa nongs pa dang // mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang //
translated: 2. before the parinirvāṇa of the Master;🔽3. when the Master is in a state of absorption called saṃāpatti;🔽4. when the territory is not delimited;🔽5. when the territory is delimited but is not the one in which the schism should occur;

original: 'khor lo'i dbyen ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dbyen ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: 6. when the schism is not of the Wheel.

original: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas ring po ma lon pa dang / tha ma bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe dang / gnas skabs de gnyis su ni dge 'dun sha gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po chos kyi 'khor lo bskor nas ring po ma lon pa dang / tha ma bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshe dang / gnas skabs de gnyis su ni dge 'dun sha gcig ma yin no //
translated: The Saṅgha is not divided when the wheel of the Dharma is first set into motion, when the Blessed One is about to enter into nirvāṇa, and in the interval, as long as the two schismatic theses have not arisen.

original: bar du yang skyon ma byung ba'i sngon rol du 'byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bar du yang skyon ma byung ba'i sngon rol du 'byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The schism does not occur when the faults have not already appeared.

original: ji srid du bstan pa la tshul khrims kyi skyon dang / lta ba'i skyon ma byung gi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du bstan pa la tshul khrims kyi skyon dang / lta ba'i skyon ma byung gi bar du'o //
translated: As long as the faults of immorality and the faults of false speech have not appeared in the teaching.

original: zung gcig ma byung ba'i sngon rol du yang dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zung gcig ma byung ba'i sngon rol du yang dbye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The schism does not occur before the appearance of the pair.

original: ji srid du nyan thos kyi mchog zung gcig ma byung gi bar du ste /
analyzed: ji srid du nyan thos kyi mchog zung gcig ma byung gi bar du ste /
translated: As long as the pair of principal disciples has not appeared.

original: bye ba yongs su mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / des phyir sdum par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽thub pa nongs na yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: bye ba yongs su mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / des phyir sdum par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // thub pa nongs na yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: The schism does not occur when the pair is still in probation, for the schism cannot be definitive as long as the pair is in probation;

original: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das na 'gran zla med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das na 'gran zla med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the schism does not occur when the Muni has entered into nirvāṇa, for, in the absence of the Master, the schismatic doctrine would not be recognized as false.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang ste /
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa dag tu yang ste /
translated: The schism does not occur in a territory where the territory has not been delimited.

original: ji srid du mtshams ma bcad par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji srid du mtshams ma bcad par mi 'byung ste /
translated: It does not occur when the boundary has not been established.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang du phyogs gnyis su gnas pa'i phyir bye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang du phyogs gnyis su gnas pa'i phyir bye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called schism because it divides the Saṅgha into two factions within a single boundary.

original: de ltar na dus drug po de dag tu 'khor lo'i dbyen mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na dus drug po de dag tu 'khor lo'i dbyen mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the wheel of the Dharma is not divided in these six periods.

original: las la rag lus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor lo la yang dbyen mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: las la rag lus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor lo la yang dbyen mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Nor is the wheel of the Dharma of all the Buddhas divided, because that depends on karma.

original: ci'i phyir ma bsad pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhe @217b na ;🔽/ phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan zhing //🔽spangs dang med par byas phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma bsad pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhe @217b na ; / phan 'dogs pa dang yon tan zhing // spangs dang med par byas phyir ro //
translated: Why are matricide, etc. , heinous acts and not the others?🔽Because of the destruction of the field of benefits and the field of merit.

original: re zhig pa ma gsad pa ni phan 'dogs pa med par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig pa ma gsad pa ni phan 'dogs pa med par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the destruction of the field of benefits and the field of merit.🔽Matricide is the destruction of the field of benefits.

original: ji ltar de gnyis phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are these two fields of benefits?

original: de dag las lus skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las lus skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body is born from them.

original: de dag spangs ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de dag spangs ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they fields of merit?

original: yongs su bor ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bor ba'o //
translated: Because they are objects of worship.

original: yon tan gyi zhing yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa gsad pa la sogs pa yang mtshams med pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi zhing yin pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa gsad pa la sogs pa yang mtshams med pa yin no //
translated: Killing an arhat is also a transgression with an immediately successive retribution because the arhat is a field of qualities.

original: gal te pha'am ma mtshan gyur pa na yang lus gcig pa de la ni /🔽mtshan ni gzhan du gyur kyang 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te pha'am ma mtshan gyur pa na yang lus gcig pa de la ni / mtshan ni gzhan du gyur kyang 'gyur //
translated: If the father or mother changes sex,🔽the offense of matricide or patricide is not incurred.

original: de nyid kyi phyir pha yang ma yin dgra bcom pa yang ma yin pa'i skyes pa zhig bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /🔽yod de / ma mtshan gyur pas bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pha yang ma yin dgra bcom pa yang ma yin pa'i skyes pa zhig bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na / yod de / ma mtshan gyur pas bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the father or mother changes sex, is there a transgression with an immediately successive retribution if one kills him or her?🔽Yes, if one kills a mother whose sex has changed.

original: ma yang ma yin dgra bcom pa yang ma yin pa'i bud med gcig bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ma yang ma yin dgra bcom pa yang ma yin pa'i bud med gcig bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a transgression with an immediately successive retribution if one kills a woman who is neither one’s mother nor an arhat?

original: yod de / pha mtshan gyur pas bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yod de / pha mtshan gyur pas bsad na mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Yes, if one kills a father whose sex has changed.

original: bud med gzhan las nur nur po zags nas bud med gzhan gyi mang la du blugs na gang zhig bsad na mtshams med par 'gyur ba de'i ma gang yin zhe na /🔽gang gi zla mtshan las byung ma //
analyzed: bud med gzhan las nur nur po zags nas bud med gzhan gyi mang la du blugs na gang zhig bsad na mtshams med par 'gyur ba de'i ma gang yin zhe na / gang gi zla mtshan las byung ma //
translated: If the embryo falls from one woman and is placed in the womb of another woman, who is the mother whose murder constitutes a heinous act?🔽The mother is the one from whose blood one is born.

original: sems can de gang gi zla mtshan las byung ba de ni de'i ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can de gang gi zla mtshan las byung ba de ni de'i ma yin no //
translated: The mother is the one from whose blood one is born.

original: gnyis pa yang bya ba thams cad khu par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang bya ba thams cad khu par bya ba yin te /
translated: The second is the one who performs all the functions of a mother.

original: de ni nu zho ldud par byed pa dang / gso bar byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nu zho ldud par byed pa dang / gso bar byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: She is the one who gives birth, nourishes, and raises the child.

original: gal te ma la sbyor ba byas nas gzhan bsad na yang mtshams med par mi 'gyur la ma ma yin pa la sbyor ba byas nas ma bsad na yang mtshams med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma la sbyor ba byas nas gzhan bsad na yang mtshams med par mi 'gyur la ma ma yin pa la sbyor ba byas nas ma bsad na yang mtshams med par 'gyur te /
translated: If one commits the action of killing one’s mother but kills another, one does not commit a heinous act. If one commits the action of killing another but kills one’s mother, one does commit a heinous act.

original: ma khri'u 'i 'og na 'dug pa bsad pa dang / khrus pa'i bus sbrang bu la sbyor ba byas pas pha bsad pa dper bya'o //
analyzed: ma khri'u 'i 'og na 'dug pa bsad pa dang / khrus pa'i bus sbrang bu la sbyor ba byas pas pha bsad pa dper bya'o //
translated: This is like the example of the child of a wet nurse who was killed when the child’s father was killed, or the example of the child of a wet nurse who was killed when the child’s mother was killed.

original: mtshon thabs gcig gis ma dang gzhan zhig kyang bsad na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gnyis yin la /
analyzed: mtshon thabs gcig gis ma dang gzhan zhig kyang bsad na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni gnyis yin la /
translated: If one kills one’s mother and another woman by the same means, then there are two non-informative karmas.

original: rnam par rig byed ni mtshams med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni mtshams med pa kho na yin te /
translated: But there is only one informative karma,

original: las de stobs che ba'i phyir ro //🔽btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed @218a * //
analyzed: las de stobs che ba'i phyir ro // btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs na re rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed @218a * //
translated: because that karma is powerful.

original: kyang rnam pa gnyis so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kyang rnam pa gnyis so zhes zer ro //
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka says: Because it is an aggregation of subtle particles, informative karma also has two types.

original: dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis dgra bcom pa bsad na yang mtshams med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis dgra bcom pa bsad na yang mtshams med par 'gyur te /
translated: If one kills an arhat with the perception that it is someone other than an arhat, it is also a heinous act.

original: 'di gsad do snyam du rten nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gsad do snyam du rten nges par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis is definitely ascertained by thinking, “I will kill this one.”

original: gang zhig gis pha dgra bcom pa bsad na yang de la mtshams med pa ni gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gis pha dgra bcom pa bsad na yang de la mtshams med pa ni gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If one kills one’s father who is an arhat, there is only one heinous act.

original: rten gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the basis is the same.

original: song la skra can la khyod kyis ni mtshams med pa gnyis byas te /
analyzed: song la skra can la khyod kyis ni mtshams med pa gnyis byas te /
translated: Go and tell Keśa, “You have committed two heinous acts.

original: pha gsad pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang dgra bcom pa gsad pa'o zhes smros shig ces bya ba'i rtogs pa brjod pa 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: pha gsad pa gang yin pa dang / gang yang dgra bcom pa gsad pa'o zhes smros shig ces bya ba'i rtogs pa brjod pa 'di ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the story of the one who killed his father and the one who killed an arhat?

original: rgyu gnyis kyis zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is due to two causes.

original: yang na sgo gnyis nas spyos pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na sgo gnyis nas spyos pa yin no //
translated: Or it is due to two doors.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bas gdon mi za bar mtshams med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung bas gdon mi za bar mtshams med par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does one definitely commit a heinous act by drawing blood with evil intent toward a Tathagata?

original: bgrod par sems pa la ni 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bgrod par sems pa la ni 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one intends to kill him, one does.

original: sangs rgyas brdeg par sems pa la'ang min //🔽gal te dgra ma choms pa'i tshe bsnun la bsnun pa'i 'og tu dgra bcom par gyur na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas brdeg par sems pa la'ang min // gal te dgra ma choms pa'i tshe bsnun la bsnun pa'i 'og tu dgra bcom par gyur na /
translated: But not if one intends to strike the Buddha.

original: bsnun 'og dgra bcom pa la min //🔽mtshams med par 'gyur bzhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bsnun 'og dgra bcom pa la min // mtshams med par 'gyur bzhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If one strikes an arhat when he is not yet an arhat, but becomes an arhat after being struck,

original: des ni de la sbyor ba ma byas so //
analyzed: des ni de la sbyor ba ma byas so //
translated: one does not commit a heinous act.🔽One does not commit a heinous act if one does not apply oneself to the act.

original: ci mtshams med pa'i sbyor ba byas te /
analyzed: ci mtshams med pa'i sbyor ba byas te /
translated: What is the application of a heinous act?

original: de yang ma bzlog par 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /🔽mtshams med sbyor ba byas pa la //
analyzed: de yang ma bzlog par 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhe na / mtshams med sbyor ba byas pa la //
translated: then the result of separation from attachment

original: 'dod chags bral 'bras mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral 'bras mi srid do //
translated: is impossible for one who has prepared the act for a heinous act.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsam pa shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽las kyi lam gzhan gyi sbyor ba byas nas 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa la ni yang las kyi lam mi skye ste /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro // las kyi lam gzhan gyi sbyor ba byas nas 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa la ni yang las kyi lam mi skye ste /
translated: Because the intention is in complete contradiction.

original: rten de dang shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten de dang shin tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one who has prepared the act for another karmic path has generated the ārya path, the karmic path does not arise again because it is in complete contradiction to that basis.

original: mtshams med pa'i las 'di dag las thams cad kyi nang na kha na ma thob dang bcas pa chen po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las 'di dag las thams cad kyi nang na kha na ma thob dang bcas pa chen po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the greatest offense among all karmic paths?

original: dge 'dun dbye phyir brdzun smra ba //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye phyir brdzun smra ba //
translated: Lying for the purpose of dividing the Saṅgha

original: kha na ma tho bar cher 'dod //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bar cher 'dod //
translated: is asserted to be the greatest offense.

original: gang zhig chos dang chos ma yin pa shes bzhin du dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brdzun du smra na log par ston pa'i phyir nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi nang na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rab tu che ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chos dang chos ma yin pa shes bzhin du dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir brdzun du smra na log par ston pa'i phyir nyes par spyod pa thams cad kyi nang na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa rab tu che ba yin no //
translated: If one lies in order to divide the Saṅgha, knowing what is Dharma and what is not Dharma, then that is the most reprehensible of all misdeeds, because it is a false teaching.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku la bsnun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi mtho @218b ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku la bsnun pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten rnams kyi mtho @218b ris dang byang grol gyi lam gyi bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is an attack on the Dharma body of the Tathāgatas, and because it is an obstacle to the path of heaven and liberation for the world.

original: dge 'dun dbye na ji srid du slar ma dum gyi bar du 'jig rten nges pa la 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bag  pa zad par bya ba rnams la bgegs su gyur pa yin zhing /
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye na ji srid du slar ma dum gyi bar du 'jig rten nges pa la 'jug pa dang / 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bag  pa zad par bya ba rnams la bgegs su gyur pa yin zhing /
translated: When the Saṅgha is divided, as long as it is not reconciled, the world is obstructed from entering certainty, from attaining fruits, from becoming free from attachment, and from exhausting the contaminants.

original: bsam gtan dang klog pa dang kha ton dang sems pa'i las rnams kyang mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang klog pa dang kha ton dang sems pa'i las rnams kyang mi 'jug cing /
translated: And the activities of concentration, recitation, chanting, and reflection do not proceed.

original: lha dang klu dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro ba yang 'khrugs pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / rang dbang med pa dang / dran pa nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: lha dang klu dang mir bcas pa'i 'gro ba yang 'khrugs pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / rang dbang med pa dang / dran pa nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: humans, and asuras is disturbed, unhappy, powerless, and has lost its memory.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i rnam par smin pa yang bskal pa gcig tu mnar med par skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i rnam par smin pa yang bskal pa gcig tu mnar med par skye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, its karmic maturation is to be born in Avīci for one eon.

original: mtshams med pa lhag ma rnams las ni go rims bzhin du lnga ba dang gsum pa dang dang po rnams ches lci ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lhag ma rnams las ni go rims bzhin du lnga ba dang gsum pa dang dang po rnams ches lci ba yin te /
translated: The remaining heinous actions are respectively the fifth, third, and first heaviest.

original: pha gsod pa ni thams cad kyi nang na yang ba yin no //
analyzed: pha gsod pa ni thams cad kyi nang na yang ba yin no //
translated: Killing one’s mother is the lightest of all.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa gsum gyi nang na yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por gsungs pa dang / yang log par lta ba ni kha na ma tho ba dam pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa gsum gyi nang na yid kyi nyes pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por gsungs pa dang / yang log par lta ba ni kha na ma tho ba dam pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, why did the Bhagavān state that of the three types of faults, mental faults are the most serious, and also that wrong view is the most serious of all faults?

original: mtshams med pa rnams nges par mdzad nas ni dge 'dun gyi dbye na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por gsungs la /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams nges par mdzad nas ni dge 'dun gyi dbye na kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa chen por gsungs la /
translated: Having determined the heinous acts, he declared the schism of the Saṅgha to be the most heinous sin.

original: las gsum nges par mdzad nas ni yid kyi nyes pa gsungs /
analyzed: las gsum nges par mdzad nas ni yid kyi nyes pa gsungs /
translated: Having determined the three karmas, he declared mental faults to be the most heinous.

original: lta ba rnams nges par mdzad nas ni log par lta ba gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: lta ba rnams nges par mdzad nas ni log par lta ba gsungs pa'am /
translated: Having determined the views, he declared wrong view to be the most heinous.

original: yang na rnam par smin pa rgya che ba dang / skye bo phal po che 'chi ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du gcod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na rnam par smin pa rgya che ba dang / skye bo phal po che 'chi ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du gcod pa'i dbang du mdzad nas go rims bzhin du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or, respectively, they are stated from the perspective of the most extensive karmic maturation, the death of many people, and the severence of the root of virtue.

original: legs par spyad pa rnams las 'bras bu rab tu che ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa rnams las 'bras bu rab tu che ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What action has the greatest result among the good actions?

original: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dge ba la /
translated: Among mundane good actions,

original: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che //
analyzed: srid rtse'i sems pa 'bras rab che //
translated: the intention of the summit of existence has the greatest result.

original: las dge ba la ni thams cad kyi nang na srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems pa 'bras bu rab tu che ba yin te /
analyzed: las dge ba la ni thams cad kyi nang na srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems pa 'bras bu rab tu che ba yin te /
translated: Among virtuous actions, the intention of the summit of existence bhavagraha has the greatest result.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa ni bskal pa brgyad khrir rab tu zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa ni bskal pa brgyad khrir rab tu zhi ba yin no //
translated: Its karmic maturation is the peace of 80,000 eons.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas de skad bshad kyi /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas de skad bshad kyi /
translated: This is said from the point of view of the ripened effect.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas ni thams cad kyi nang na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems pa 'bras bu che ba yin te /
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas nas ni thams cad kyi nang na rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sems pa 'bras bu che ba yin te /
translated: From the point of view of the effect of separation, the volition of the vajra-like concentration has the greatest effect among all the volitions,

original: kun du sbyor ba thams cad gtan du gtugs pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de @219a * //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba thams cad gtan du gtugs pa 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro // de @219a * //
translated: because it is the effect of the definitive separation from all the bonds.

original: nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pa'i zhes bshad do //
translated: That is why it is said that it is mundane.

original: ci mtshams med pa rnams kho nas dmyal ba dag tu gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci mtshams med pa rnams kho nas dmyal ba dag tu gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Do beings necessarily take birth in hell due to the five heinous actions?

original: 'on te gzhan dag gis kyang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dag gis kyang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or do they take birth there due to other actions as well?

original: mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ba rnams kyis kyang gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ba rnams kyis kyang gdon mi za bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Beings necessarily take birth in hell due to actions similar to the heinous actions.

original: gzhan dag na re bar chad med pa kho nar ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bar chad med pa kho nar ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Not necessarily.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those actions?

original: smras pa / ma dgra bcom ma sun byas dang // byang chub sems dpa' des  gnas dang // slob pa gsod dang dge 'dun gyi //
analyzed: smras pa / ma dgra bcom ma sun byas dang // byang chub sems dpa' des  gnas dang // slob pa gsod dang dge 'dun gyi //
translated: It is said:

original: 'du ba'i sgo ni 'phrogs pa dag / mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ste //
analyzed: 'du ba'i sgo ni 'phrogs pa dag / mtshams med pa dang cha 'dra ste //
translated: The five heinous acts are like the heinous acts.

original: lnga pa mchod rten 'jig pa yin //
analyzed: lnga pa mchod rten 'jig pa yin //
translated: The fifth is the destruction of a stupa.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mtshams med pa lnga dang cha 'dra pa yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mtshams med pa lnga dang cha 'dra pa yin te /
translated: These five are like the five heinous acts in order.

original: gal te mi tshangs par spyod pas ma dgra bcom ma sun par byed pa dang / nges par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zhal du 'du pa'i sgo 'phrogs pa dang / mchod rten 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mi tshangs par spyod pas ma dgra bcom ma sun par byed pa dang / nges par rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gsod pa dang / slob pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zhal du 'du pa'i sgo 'phrogs pa dang / mchod rten 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: If one causes a nun to break her chastity, if one kills a bodhisattva who has attained certainty, if one kills one who is learning, if one steals what belongs to the Sangha, and if one destroys a stupa.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i las gzhan yang dus gsum po dag tu shin tu bgegs byed de /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i las gzhan yang dus gsum po dag tu shin tu bgegs byed de /
translated: Other karma that has ripening also obstructs in the three times.

original: gsum po gang dag tu zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang dag tu zhe na /
translated: In what three times?

original: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom //
analyzed: bzod dang phyir mi 'ong dgra bcom //
translated: In the times of acceptance, nonreturn, and arhat.

original: 'thob pa las bgegs shin tu byed //
analyzed: 'thob pa las bgegs shin tu byed //
translated: The karma of the lower realms is an obstacle to the attainment of the summit.

original: rtse mo las bzod pa thob pa la ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ngan song ba'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: rtse mo las bzod pa thob pa la ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ngan song ba'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
translated: The karma of the lower realms is an obstacle to the attainment of the summit, because it causes one to pass beyond the stage of the ripening of that karma.

original: dper na mi zhig yul 'dor bar byed pa la bu lon pa dag ldang ba bzhin no //🔽de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la ni /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig yul 'dor bar byed pa la bu lon pa dag ldang ba bzhin no // de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa la ni /
translated: For example, when a man is about to leave the country, his creditors rise up against him.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas te /
translated: Similarly, the karma of the desire realm is an obstacle to the attainment of the fruit of nonreturn.

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The karma to be experienced in the present life is an exception.🔽Similarly, the karma of the form and formless realms is an obstacle to the attainment of the fruit of arhatship.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa la ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so //🔽byang chub sems dpa' gsad pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa la ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i las rnams bgegs bya ba'i phyir nye bar gnas so // byang chub sems dpa' gsad pa zhes bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The karma of the lower realms is an obstacle to the attainment of the summit.

original: gang nas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
analyzed: gang nas byang chub sems dpa' yin //
translated: From what point is one a bodhisattva?

original: gang na gzung ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: gang na gzung ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod par bya /
translated: Where should one be designated as a bodhisattva?

original: gang nas mtshan gyi las byed pa gang phan chad nas mtshan rnam par smin par @219b 'gyur ba'i las rnams byed par rtsom ba de'i tshe nges par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang nas mtshan gyi las byed pa gang phan chad nas mtshan rnam par smin par @219b 'gyur ba'i las rnams byed par rtsom ba de'i tshe nges par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: From the moment when he begins to produce actions which will ripen in the marks, he is certain of becoming a bodhisattva.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de ni dus de phan chad rtag tu yang //
analyzed: de ni dus de phan chad rtag tu yang //
translated: From that time on, he is always in the happy realms,

original: bde 'gror rigs mthor skye dbang tshang //
analyzed: bde 'gror rigs mthor skye dbang tshang //
translated: in high castes, with complete faculties,

original: phor 'gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog / pa yin no //
analyzed: phor 'gyur tshe rabs dran mi ldog / pa yin no //
translated: a male, remembering his former lives, never regressing.

original: 'di'i 'gro ba rab tu bsngags pa yin pas na bde 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'di'i 'gro ba rab tu bsngags pa yin pas na bde 'gro ste /
translated: He is in the happy realms, because his destiny is highly praised.

original: lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is reborn among gods and humans.

original: 'gro ba de dag tu yang rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba yin gyi rigs dma' bar ni mi skye'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dag tu yang rgyal rigs dang bram ze dang khyim bdag gi rigs shing s'a la chen po lta bur skye ba yin gyi rigs dma' bar ni mi skye'o //
translated: In these destinies, he is reborn in the great castes, the great families of nobles, brahmans and householders, like a great sāla tree, not in the low castes.

original: 'di'i dbang po rnams ma tshang bas na dbang po ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dbang po rnams ma tshang bas na dbang po ma tshang ba'o //
translated: He has complete faculties, because his faculties are not deficient.

original: dbang po tshang bas na dbang po tshang ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po tshang bas na dbang po tshang ba ste /
translated: He has complete faculties, thus he has complete faculties.

original: dbang po ma tshang ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he does not have incomplete faculties.

original: pho kho nar 'gyur gyi mor yang mi 'gyur na za ma la sogs par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: pho kho nar 'gyur gyi mor yang mi 'gyur na za ma la sogs par lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: He is only male, not female, much less is he a eunuch, etc.

original: skye ba thams cad du yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro //🔽nur bas na ldog pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba thams cad du yang tshe rabs dran par 'gyur ro // nur bas na ldog pa'o //
translated: And he remembers all his rebirths.🔽He turns away from the world, thus he turns away.

original: nur ba med pas na mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: nur ba med pas na mi ldog pa ste /
translated: He does not turn away, thus he does not turn away.

original: ldog pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ldog pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that he does not turn away.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i don du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad dang / log par sgrub pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i don du sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad dang / log par sgrub pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not discouraged by any kind of suffering or any kind of ingratitude, for the sake of helping all living beings.

original: 'jig rten na zong gis ma nyos pa'i bran zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na zong gis ma nyos pa'i bran zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' de dag yin te /
translated: Those who are called in the world “unbought slaves” are those bodhisattvas.

original: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni ;
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni ;
translated: Those great beings

original: /'byor pa'i mchog khyad par can thams cad brnyas kyang thugs rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi drung du khyi dang 'dra bar nga rgyal med par gnas te /
analyzed: /'byor pa'i mchog khyad par can thams cad brnyas kyang thugs rje'i gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa'i phyir bdag nyid sems can thams cad kyi drung du khyi dang 'dra bar nga rgyal med par gnas te /
translated: Even though he is despised, he is like a dog in the presence of all sentient beings, humble and without pride, because he is under the control of others through his great compassion.

original: sems can thams cad kyis brnyas gnod byas pa thams cad bzod cing ngal ba dang mnags pa thams cad kyang nyams su len pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis brnyas gnod byas pa thams cad bzod cing ngal ba dang mnags pa thams cad kyang nyams su len pa yin no //
translated: He endures all the contempt and harm of sentient beings and undertakes all the hardships and fatigue.

original: mtshan rnam par smin pa can gyi las su bshad pa gang yin pa /🔽de ni 'dzam gling phor gyur nyid //🔽mngon sum sangs rgyas la sems pa //🔽bsams pa las byung bskal pa brgya //
analyzed: mtshan rnam par smin pa can gyi las su bshad pa gang yin pa / de ni 'dzam gling phor gyur nyid // mngon sum sangs rgyas la sems pa // bsams pa las byung bskal pa brgya //
translated: The karma that is explained as having the marks as its ripened effect

original: lus pa dag tu 'phen par byed //
analyzed: lus pa dag tu 'phen par byed //
translated: is projected in the desire realm, by men, not by women.🔽The karma that is explained as having the marks as its ripened effect is projected by men, not by women.🔽It is projected in the desire realm, not in the higher realms, because the higher realms are not a basis for the marks.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dzam bu gling kho nar mtshan rnam par smin pa can gyi las 'phen par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dzam bu gling kho nar mtshan rnam par smin pa can gyi las 'phen par byed kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is projected in Jambudvīpa, not elsewhere,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams blo rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams blo rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the people of Jambudvīpa are sharp-witted.

original: pho lo nas 'phen gyi mos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pho lo nas 'phen gyi mos ni ma yin no //
translated: The lifespan of the Teacher was not projected by that action,

original: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i @220a * //
analyzed: ston pa mngon sum du gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i @220a * //
translated: but rather by the intention of the Buddha himself, which is the cause of the lifespan.🔽The intention of the Buddha himself projected the lifespan of one hundred years when one hundred years remained to the lifespan of beings.

original: sems pa kho nas bskal pa brgya lus pa'i tshe 'phen gyi mang po lus pa'i tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems pa kho nas bskal pa brgya lus pa'i tshe 'phen gyi mang po lus pa'i tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: It did not project it when many years remained.

original: las de yang bsams pa las byung ba yin gyi thos pa las byung ba yang ma yin la bsgoms pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: las de yang bsams pa las byung ba yin gyi thos pa las byung ba yang ma yin la bsgoms pa las byung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: This action is also intentional, not arisen from hearing or from meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas ni brtson 'grus spyad pas bskal pa dgu bsdums te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas ni brtson 'grus spyad pas bskal pa dgu bsdums te /
translated: The Blessed One Śākyamuni reduced the period of his austerities by nine eons.

original: bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig lus pa'i tshe 'phangs so //
analyzed: bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig lus pa'i tshe 'phangs so //
translated: He projected his lifespan when ninety-one eons remained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grong dpon ngas 'di nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grong dpon ngas 'di nas bzung ste /
translated: For this reason, the Blessed One said to the village overseer:

original: bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig gi bar du yang dag par rjes su dran te /
analyzed: bskal pa dgu bcu rtsa gcig gi bar du yang dag par rjes su dran te /
translated: “Upāli, I remember ninety-one eons,

original: zas smin pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir khyim 'ga' la yang mi 'di ba 'am /
analyzed: zas smin pa ster bar bya ba'i phyir khyim 'ga' la yang mi 'di ba 'am /
translated: and I do not recall any family that was destroyed because of giving cooked food.

original: gnod par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par mi mkhyen to zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnod par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par mi mkhyen to zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Buddha does not know the harm that is to come.

original: de tshun chad rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tshun chad rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has remembered his lives naturally since then.
