original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re bskal pa dang po tshar phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kho nas skyon bzhi po 'di dag ni bzlog par byed pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re bskal pa dang po tshar phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kho nas skyon bzhi po 'di dag ni bzlog par byed pa /
translated: Former masters say: Only bodhisattvas who have completed the first eon reverse these four faults

original: yon tan gnyis po ni 'thab bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yon tan gnyis po ni 'thab bo zhes zer ro //
translated: and acquire the two qualities.

original: mtshan de dag kyang re re 'ang bsod nams brgya las skyes /
analyzed: mtshan de dag kyang re re 'ang bsod nams brgya las skyes /
translated: Each of those marks arises from one hundred merits.

original: bsod nams kyi ni tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi ni tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of merit?

original: kha cig na re byang chub sems dpa' nye ba ma gtogs pa sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can ji snyed pa de tsam mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re byang chub sems dpa' nye ba ma gtogs pa sems can thams cad kyi longs spyod kyi 'bras bu can ji snyed pa de tsam mo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is the amount of merit that is the result of enjoyment of all sentient beings, except for bodhisattvas near enlightenment.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis stong gsum 'chags pa ji snyed tsam mo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can thams cad kyi las kyi dbang gis stong gsum 'chags pa ji snyed tsam mo zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is the amount of merit that creates a trichiliocosm through the power of the karma of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan dag na re de'i tshad ni sangs rgyas kho nas mkhyen par zad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de'i tshad ni sangs rgyas kho nas mkhyen par zad do zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, the Buddha alone knows the measure of the life expectancy of beings in the realm of desire.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas she na /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na sangs rgyas ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas she na /
translated: How many Buddhas did the Bodhisattva, the Blessed One, honor when he was a Bodhisattva?

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la ni sangs rgyas bdun khri lnga stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang po la ni sangs rgyas bdun khri lnga stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: In the first innumerable eon, he honored seventy-five thousand Buddhas;

original: gnyis pa la ni bdun khri drug stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni bdun khri drug stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: in the second, seventy-six thousand;

original: gsum pa la ni bdun khri bdun stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bdun khri bdun stong la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: in the third, seventy-seven thousand.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gang gi tha mar sangs rgyas gang zhig byung bar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gang gi tha mar sangs rgyas gang zhig byung bar gyur zhe na /
translated: What Buddhas appeared at the end of each of these three innumerable eons?

original: bzlog pa'i go rims kyis go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i go rims kyis go rims bzhin du /
translated: In the reverse order of their mention,

original: rnam gzigs mar me rin chen gtsug / grangs med gsum gyi tha mar byung //
analyzed: rnam gzigs mar me rin chen gtsug / grangs med gsum gyi tha mar byung //
translated: Vipaśyin, Dīpaṃkara, Ratnaśikhin appeared at the end of three innumerable eons.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen gtsug tor can gyi tshe ni bskal pa grangs med @220b pa dang po rdzogs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen gtsug tor can gyi tshe ni bskal pa grangs med @220b pa dang po rdzogs so //
translated: The first incalculable eon was completed during the lifetime of the Perfectly Awakened One Ratnaśikhin.

original: bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad kyi tshe ni gnyis pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad kyi tshe ni gnyis pa rdzogs so //
translated: The second was completed during the lifetime of the Blessed One Dīpaṃkara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs kyi tshe ni gsum pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs kyi tshe ni gsum pa rdzogs so //
translated: The third was completed during the lifetime of the Tathāgata Vipaśyin.

original: de dag thams cad kyi dang po sh'akya thub pa yin /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi dang po sh'akya thub pa yin /
translated: All of them had Śākyamuni as their first.

original: sngon sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe bdag kyang 'di 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho nar sangs rgyas par shog shig ces dang por smon lam btab pa byung ste /
analyzed: sngon sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe bdag kyang 'di 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho nar sangs rgyas par shog shig ces dang por smon lam btab pa byung ste /
translated: In the past, there was a Perfectly Awakened One named Śākyamuni, with regard to whom the Blessed One, when he was a bodhisattva, first made the vow, “May I too become a buddha just like him!”

original: de yang 'di bzhin du rtsod pa'i dus kho na la byung la /
analyzed: de yang 'di bzhin du rtsod pa'i dus kho na la byung la /
translated: And he also appeared at a time of strife.

original: de'i bstan pa yang la stong gi mtha'i bar du gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i bstan pa yang la stong gi mtha'i bar du gnas par gyur to //
translated: His teaching remained for a thousand years.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs gang dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa gang yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /🔽kun la thams cad snying rje yis //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' gnas skabs gang dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa gang yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na / kun la thams cad snying rje yis //
translated: In what states do the bodhisattvas perfect the transcendences?

original: sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa rdzogs //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa rdzogs //
translated: In all, the perfection of generosity is by giving with compassion.

original: gang gi cha gang la kun la ni mig gi bar dang rkang gi bar thams cad mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par la mi re bar snying rjes sbyin par byed na de tsam gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //🔽chags bcas yan lag bcad kyang ni //
analyzed: gang gi cha gang la kun la ni mig gi bar dang rkang gi bar thams cad mngon par mtho ba'i khyad par la mi re bar snying rjes sbyin par byed na de tsam gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no // chags bcas yan lag bcad kyang ni //
translated: In all states, from the first to the tenth stage, the perfection of generosity is by giving with compassion, without hope of any special exalted status.

original: mi 'khrug bzod dang tshul khrims kyi //
analyzed: mi 'khrug bzod dang tshul khrims kyi //
translated: The perfection of morality and patience is by not being upset even when a limb is cut off, though one still has attachment.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags dang ma bral bzhin du yan lag bcad kyang cung zad kyang mi 'khrug pa de'i tshe 'di'i tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags dang ma bral bzhin du yan lag bcad kyang cung zad kyang mi 'khrug pa de'i tshe 'di'i tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: When one is not free from attachment, but is not upset even when a limb is cut off, then at that time the transcendences of morality and patience are perfected.

original: skar rgyal bstod pas brtson 'grus kyi //
analyzed: skar rgyal bstod pas brtson 'grus kyi //
translated: The perfection of vigor is by the praise of Tiṣya.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa skar rgyal ri'i phug cig na me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs pa mthong nas rkang pa gcig gis 'grengs te zhag bdun gyi bar du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa skar rgyal ri'i phug cig na me'i khams la snyoms par zhugs pa mthong nas rkang pa gcig gis 'grengs te zhag bdun gyi bar du /
translated: and praised him with this verse:

original: skyes bu khyu mchog khyod 'dri'i dge sbyong chen po gzhan dag lha yul pa la med //
analyzed: skyes bu khyu mchog khyod 'dri'i dge sbyong chen po gzhan dag lha yul pa la med //
translated: “In the realm of the gods, there is no other great ascetic like you, best of men.

original: 'jig rten 'di na'ang yod pa ma yin rnam thos bu yi gnas na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di na'ang yod pa ma yin rnam thos bu yi gnas na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: There is none in this world, nor in the realm of Vaiśravaṇa,

original: lha yi pho brang gnas mchog dag na'ang yod min phyogs sam phyogs mtshams dag na'ang med //
analyzed: lha yi pho brang gnas mchog dag na'ang yod min phyogs sam phyogs mtshams dag na'ang med //
translated: nor in the celestial palaces, nor in the cardinal and intermediate directions.

original: ri dang nags su bcas pa'i sa steng rgyas par kun tu yul gcig ga la yod //
analyzed: ri dang nags su bcas pa'i sa steng rgyas par kun tu yul gcig ga la yod //
translated: How could there be a single place on the earth, with its mountains and forests, that is not pervaded by you?”

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstod pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs la /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstod pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su rdzogs la /
translated: When he praised with this one verse, at that time he perfected the perfection of diligence,

original: bskal pa dgu yang bsdums so zhes grag go @221a * //
analyzed: bskal pa dgu yang bsdums so zhes grag go @221a * //
translated: and it is said that he shortened nine eons.

original: de ma thag la ting nge 'dzin blo'i byang chub pa'i sngon rol gyi de ma thag rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin bdag yongs su rdzogs te /
analyzed: de ma thag la ting nge 'dzin blo'i byang chub pa'i sngon rol gyi de ma thag rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshe bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin bdag yongs su rdzogs te /
translated: Immediately before the enlightenment of Vajropamasamadhi, the perfection of concentration and the perfection of wisdom are complete.

original: rang rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi phun sum tshogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa dag yin no //
translated: They are perfections because they have gone to the other side of the perfection of their own individual excellence.🔽A sutra declares:🔽There are three bases of meritorious action:

original: mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi dang bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gsum gsungs pa /
translated: the basis of meritorious action arisen from giving, the basis of meritorious action arisen from ethics, and the basis of meritorious action arisen from meditation.

original: ji ltar na gsum po 'di dag bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gsum po 'di dag bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yin zhe na /
translated: How are these three bases of meritorious action?🔽Three are meritorious action and its basis,

original: gsum po bsod nams bya ba dang // de'i gzhi dper na las lam bzhin //
analyzed: gsum po bsod nams bya ba dang // de'i gzhi dper na las lam bzhin //
translated: like the four paths of action.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni ci rigs par bsod nams kyang yin /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni ci rigs par bsod nams kyang yin /
translated: These three are merit,

original: bya ba yang yin /
analyzed: bya ba yang yin /
translated: action, and basis, respectively.

original: gzhi yang yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi yang yin pas bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi ste /
translated: It is also a basis, thus it is a basis of merit.

original: dper na de dag ni las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin pa dang / las kyi lam kho na yin pas las kyi lam mo zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de dag ni las kyang yin la las kyi lam yang yin pa dang / las kyi lam kho na yin pas las kyi lam mo zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, they are karma and also a karmic path, and they are karmic paths alone.

original: de la re zhig sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi la lus dang ngag gi las ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi la lus dang ngag gi las ni rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: In this regard, the basis of merit that arises from giving is karma and also a karmic path, since it is both physical and verbal karma.

original: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
translated: The intention that motivates it is merit and also action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
translated: The phenomena that arise simultaneously with it are merit alone.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba ni lus dang ngag gi las kho na yin pas rnam pa gsum char yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba ni lus dang ngag gi las kho na yin pas rnam pa gsum char yin no //
translated: That arising from morality is karma and also a karmic path, since it is only physical and verbal karma.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba la byas pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yang yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba la byas pa ni bsod nams kyang yin la bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi yang yin te /
translated: That arising from meditation is merit and also a basis of merit.

original: byams pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa'i sgo nas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the intention associated with loving-kindness that instigates the action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa dang / tshul khrims ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems pa dang / tshul khrims ni bsod nams kyang yin la bya ba yang yin no //
translated: The intention and morality that coexist with loving-kindness are both merit and action.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzhan ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gzhan ni bsod nams kho na yin no //
translated: The other factors that coexist with loving-kindness are only merit.

original: yang na bsod nams byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsod nams byed pa ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, the action of merit is the action that produces merit;

original: sbyor ba'o // 'di dag sgrub pa'i ched du bsod nams kyi 'byor ba rtsom pa'i phyir gsum po 'di dag ni de'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'o // 'di dag sgrub pa'i ched du bsod nams kyi 'byor ba rtsom pa'i phyir gsum po 'di dag ni de'i gzhi yin no //
translated: these three are the basis of merit because they are undertaken for the purpose of acquiring merit.

original: gzhan dag na re bsod nams bya ba ni don dam par na sems pa dge ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsod nams bya ba ni don dam par na sems pa dge ba yin la /
translated: According to another opinion, the action of merit is the wholesome intention in the ultimate sense;

original: 'di dag ni de'i gzhi yin no zhes @221b zer ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni de'i gzhi yin no zhes @221b zer ro //
translated: these three are the basis of merit.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na /🔽gang sbyin par bya ba de yang sbyin pa yin mod kyi 'dir ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhe na / gang sbyin par bya ba de yang sbyin pa yin mod kyi 'dir ni /
translated: What is giving?🔽The object given is giving, but here

original: gang gis sbyin byed de sbyin pa //
analyzed: gang gis sbyin byed de sbyin pa //
translated: giving is that by which one gives.

original: 'jigs pa dang / lan la re ba dang / 'dod chags pa la sogs pas kyang sbyin par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / lan la re ba dang / 'dod chags pa la sogs pas kyang sbyin par byed mod kyi /
translated: One gives out of fear, in the hope of a return, out of attachment, etc.

original: de ni 'dir mi 'dod pas de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i phyir /🔽mchod dang phan gdags 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: de ni 'dir mi 'dod pas de'i phyir khyad par du bya ba'i phyir / mchod dang phan gdags 'dod pa yis //
translated: But that is not what is meant here. Therefore, in order to specify,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the author says,🔽Out of a desire to worship and to help.

original: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang / phan gdags par 'dod pa dag gis sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dag la mchod pa dang / phan gdags par 'dod pa dag gis sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: One gives out of a desire to worship and to help others.

original: gang gis sbyin par byed pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin par byed pa de yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is it that gives?

original: lus dang ngag la slong dang bcas //
analyzed: lus dang ngag la slong dang bcas //
translated: Body and speech, with the intention to give.

original: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: slong ba yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the intention to give?

original: tshogs gang gis de slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs gang gis de slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the collection of thoughts that give rise to the giving.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang tshe skyes bu dge yid kyis //
analyzed: gang tshe skyes bu dge yid kyis //
translated: When a virtuous person, with a virtuous mind,

original: rang gi rdzas ngag sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas ngag sbyin byed pa //
translated: gives his own property with his own hand,

original: de tshe dge ba'i phung po rnams //
analyzed: de tshe dge ba'i phung po rnams //
translated: then the aggregates of virtue

original: sbyin pa zhes ni brjod pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes ni brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are called giving.

original: de 'bras longs spyod chen po can //
analyzed: de 'bras longs spyod chen po can //
translated: It has the result of great enjoyments.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po yin no //
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of giving has as its effect great enjoyment.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The word “arising” should be understood as meaning “nature.”

original: dper na rtsa las byung ba'i khyim dang / lo ma las byung ba'i snod ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rtsa las byung ba'i khyim dang / lo ma las byung ba'i snod ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a house made of grass is called a “grass house,” and a vessel made of leaves is called a “leaf vessel.”

original: yang sbyin pa de ni /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa de ni /
translated: Moreover, that giving is

original: bdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir //
analyzed: bdag gzhan don phyir gnyis don phyir //
translated: for the sake of self, for the sake of other, for the sake of both,

original: gnyi ga'i don du min phyir sbyin //🔽de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don du min phyir sbyin // de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
translated: and for the sake of neither.🔽In this regard, giving that is made to a stupa by one who is not free from desire or by an ordinary man who is not free from desire is giving for the sake of oneself alone, because it does not benefit another.

original: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral bas mchod rten la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa des pha rol po dag la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na'i don gyi phyir sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'dod chags dang ma bral bas mchod rten la sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa des pha rol po dag la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kho na'i don gyi phyir sbyin pa yin no //
translated: Giving that is made to a human being by one who is free from desire is giving for the sake of another alone, because it is not for the sake of oneself.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par des de dag la phan btags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yin gyi
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par des de dag la phan btags pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don gyi phyir yin gyi
translated: The generosity of free beings,🔽arhats who give to other sentient beings, is for the benefit of others,🔽except for generosity that is experienced in the present life.🔽

original: bdag gi don gyi phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi don gyi phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: The generosity of an ārya who is free from attachment that is, a nonreturner or an arhat is for the sake of others, not for the sake of the giver himself, because it benefits others, except for generosity that is experienced in the present life.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i sa las shin tu yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'am /
translated: Generosity that is given to other sentient beings by a non-ārya who is free from attachment or by an ārya who is not free from attachment is for the sake of both.

original: so so'i skye bo'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yin no //🔽'phags pa 'dod chags @222a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i 'dod chags dang bral bas sems can pha rol po dag la sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yin no //🔽'phags pa 'dod chags @222a * //
translated: Generosity that is given to other sentient beings by a non-ārya who is not free from attachment is for the sake of the giver himself, not for the sake of others.

original: dang bral bas mchod rten la 'bul bar byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yang ma yin te de ni bkur sti dang / byas pa gzo ba 'ba' zhig gis 'bul bar zad do //
analyzed: dang bral bas mchod rten la 'bul bar byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba ma gtogs par gnyi ga'i don gyi phyir yang ma yin te de ni bkur sti dang / byas pa gzo ba 'ba' zhig gis 'bul bar zad do //
translated: The generosity of one who makes offerings to a stupa is not for the sake of both, except for the experience of the present life. It is offered only out of respect and gratitude.

original: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po can zhes spyir bstan pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i 'bras bu longs spyod chen po can zhes spyir bstan pa /
translated: The result of generosity is great wealth.🔽Its distinctions are from the distinctions of the donor,

original: de'i khyad par sbyin bdag dang // dngos dang zhing gi khyad par las //
analyzed: de'i khyad par sbyin bdag dang // dngos dang zhing gi khyad par las //
translated: the thing given, and the field.🔽First,

original: de la re zhig / sbyin bdag khyad 'phags dad sogs kyis //
analyzed: de la re zhig / sbyin bdag khyad 'phags dad sogs kyis //
translated: the donor who is distinguished by faith and so on

original: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin bdag ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa dang tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin bdag ni khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: is distinguished by possessing the qualities of faith, ethics, learning and so on.

original: sbyin bdag de'i sbyin pa de ni sbyin bdag gi khyad par gyis 'bras bu 'byin pa la khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag de'i sbyin pa de ni sbyin bdag gi khyad par gyis 'bras bu 'byin pa la khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur te /
translated: That generosity of the donor is distinguished in terms of the result it yields due to the distinction of the donor.

original: sbyin bdag de lta bu de ni /
analyzed: sbyin bdag de lta bu de ni /
translated: Such a donor

original: gus pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed /
analyzed: gus pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed /
translated: One gives with respect, etc.

original: gus pa dang / rang gi lag dang / dus su dang / gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: gus pa dang / rang gi lag dang / dus su dang / gzhan la mi gnod par sbyin par byed de /
translated: One gives with respect, with one’s own hand, at the appropriate time, and without doing harm to others.🔽Therefore, the giver obtains great honor,

original: de phyir bkur sti rgya chen dang // dus dang bar chad med par rnyed //
analyzed: de phyir bkur sti rgya chen dang // dus dang bar chad med par rnyed //
translated: wealth at the appropriate time, and without obstacles.

original: de'i phyir sbyin bdag 'di'i sbyin pa de lta bur byin pas go rims bzhin du khyad par bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin bdag 'di'i sbyin pa de lta bur byin pas go rims bzhin du khyad par bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the giving of this giver, given in this way, becomes fourfold excellence, respectively.

original: bkur sti rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: bkur sti rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: One obtains honor.

original: longs spyod rgya chen po la dad pa rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod rgya chen po la dad pa rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: One obtains faith in great wealth.

original: longs spyod dus las mi yol bar dus su rnyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: longs spyod dus las mi yol bar dus su rnyed par 'gyur /
translated: One obtains wealth at the appropriate time, not after the time has passed.

original: longs spyod bar chad med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: longs spyod bar chad med par 'gyur te /
translated: One obtains wealth without obstacles.

original: 'di'i longs spyod gzhan dag gis bar du mi chod cing /
analyzed: 'di'i longs spyod gzhan dag gis bar du mi chod cing /
translated: One’s wealth is not interrupted by others.

original: me la sogs pas med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pas med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not destroyed by fire, etc.

original: ji ltar na sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa dang / de'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa'i khyad par yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa dang / de'i khyad par gyis sbyin pa'i khyad par yang bshad zin to //
translated: The excellence of the giver and the excellence of his giving have been explained.

original: ji ltar na dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
translated: The object is excellent when it is

original: kha dog la sogs phun sum dngos //🔽khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs phun sum dngos // khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: perfect in color, etc.🔽The object is excellent when it is perfect in color, smell, taste, and🔽touch.

original: gal te gang sbyin par bya ba de kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig gis phun sum tshogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gang sbyin par bya ba de kha dog dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig gis phun sum tshogs pa yin na /
translated: When the object to be given is perfect in one or another of these,

original: de lta bu ni dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni dngos po khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: color, etc., it is excellent.

original: dngos po de lta bu byin pas ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽rim pa bzhin du /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu byin pas ci ltar 'gyur zhe na / rim pa bzhin du /
translated: What is the result of giving such an object?🔽The result is a good figure, fame,

original: de las gzugs bzang grags ldan dang // dga' dang shin tu gzhon sha can //
analyzed: de las gzugs bzang grags ldan dang // dga' dang shin tu gzhon sha can //
translated: love, a tender body,

original: dus su reg na bde lus 'gyur //🔽reg bya phun sum tshogs @222b pa byin pas ni gzugs bzang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su reg na bde lus 'gyur // reg bya phun sum tshogs @222b pa byin pas ni gzugs bzang por 'gyur ro //
translated: and a timely sense of well-being.🔽By giving a perfect object to touch, one obtains a good figure.

original: dri phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni dri bzhin du grags pas phyogs su rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni dri bzhin du grags pas phyogs su rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving a perfect object to smell, one obtains fame that spreads in🔽all directions, like the smell of incense.

original: ro phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni ro zhim po bzhin du dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni ro zhim po bzhin du dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving perfect taste, one becomes as delightful as a delicious taste.

original: reg bya phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni lus shin tu gzhon sha can dang ; bud med rin po che ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i dus su reg na bde ba'i lus su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg bya phun sum tshogs pa byin pas ni lus shin tu gzhon sha can dang ; bud med rin po che ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i dus su reg na bde ba'i lus su 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving perfect touch, one obtains a body as soft and delicate as that of the precious woman, a body that is pleasant to touch.

original: yang ji ltar na zhing khyad du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na zhing khyad du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the field superior?

original: 'gro dang sdug bsngal phan 'dogs dang // yon tan rnams kyis zhing khyad 'phags //🔽re zhig 'gro ba'i khyad par gyis khyad du 'phags pa 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la sbyin pa byin na slar rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro dang sdug bsngal phan 'dogs dang // yon tan rnams kyis zhing khyad 'phags // re zhig 'gro ba'i khyad par gyis khyad du 'phags pa 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba la sbyin pa byin na slar rnam par smin pa brgya 'gyur du re bar bya'o //
translated: The field is superior by reason of the superiority of the living beings and of the suffering, of the help, and of the qualities.🔽The field is superior by reason of the superiority of the living beings. The Blessed One said: “If one gives to an animal, one will receive back a hundredfold; if one gives to an immoral human being, one will receive back a thousandfold.”

original: tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa'i mi la sbyin pa byin na stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal bar gyur pa'i mi la sbyin pa byin na stong 'gyur du re bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The field is superior by reason of the superiority of the suffering. The Blessed One said: “If one gives to a human being who is suffering, one will receive back a hundred thousandfold.”

original: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par du 'phags pa ni 'di ltar rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dag tu nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad g-yog la sbyin pa dang / grang ba la sogs pa la sbyin par gsungs nas /🔽rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po 'di bdun dang ldan pa'i dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi khyad par du 'phags pa ni 'di ltar rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dag tu nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad g-yog la sbyin pa dang / grang ba la sogs pa la sbyin par gsungs nas / rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po 'di bdun dang ldan pa'i dad pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The superiority of suffering is as follows: The seven material meritorious works are giving to the sick, giving to nurses, giving to the cold, etc.

original: rigs kyi bu mo'i bsod nams kyi tshad gzung bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'i bsod nams kyi tshad gzung bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The merit of a faithful son or daughter endowed with these seven material meritorious works cannot be measured.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par las ni 'di lta ste pha ma dang / phan 'dogs pa gzhan rnams la sbyin pa byin pa ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par las ni 'di lta ste pha ma dang / phan 'dogs pa gzhan rnams la sbyin pa byin pa ste /
translated: The superiority of benefit is as follows: giving to parents and other benefactors.

original: dom dang ri dvags la sogs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs dper bya'o //
analyzed: dom dang ri dvags la sogs pa'i skyes pa'i rabs dper bya'o //
translated: The Jataka tales of the bear, deer, etc. are examples.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The superiority of virtue is as follows: giving to the virtuous, such as the Three Jewels, the Sangha, etc.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la byin na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa la byin na rnam par smin pa 'bum 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: When one gives to someone who possesses morality, the maturation is a hundred thousand times greater.

original: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na //
analyzed: sbyin pa thams cad kyi nang na //
translated: Among all the gifts,

original: mchog ni grol bas grol ba la'ang //
analyzed: mchog ni grol bas grol ba la'ang //
translated: the best is that given by the liberated to the liberated.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba la byin pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas 'dod chags dang bral ba la byin pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zang zing gi sbyin pa rnams kyi nang nas mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said that the best of all material gifts is that given by someone free of attachment to someone else who is free of attachment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yis /🔽yang na byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni grol ba ma yin pas ma grol @223a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yis / yang na byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad la phan par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni grol ba ma yin pas ma grol @223a * //
translated: Or, the gift given by a bodhisattva🔽is the best, even if given to the unliberated.

original: ba rnams la yang byin na mchog yin no //
analyzed: ba rnams la yang byin na mchog yin no //
translated: Or else, the gift given by a bodhisattva for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings is the best, even if given to the unliberated, because it is given by someone who is liberated.

original: de ma gtogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag sbyin pa brgyad gsungs pa de dag gi nang na ni brgyad pa mchog yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gang dag sbyin pa brgyad gsungs pa de dag gi nang na ni brgyad pa mchog yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Except for that, the eighth is supreme among the eight types of generosity taught by the Bhagavān.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: nye ba la sbyin pa dang / 'jigs pas sbyin pa dang / bdag la byin pas sbyin pa dang / bdag la sbyin par 'gyur bas sbyin pa dang / sngon bdag gi pha dang mes po dag gis sbyin pa byin pas sbyin pa byin pa dang /
analyzed: nye ba la sbyin pa dang / 'jigs pas sbyin pa dang / bdag la byin pas sbyin pa dang / bdag la sbyin par 'gyur bas sbyin pa dang / sngon bdag gi pha dang mes po dag gis sbyin pa byin pas sbyin pa byin pa dang /
translated: Generosity out of fear, generosity because it was given to me, generosity because it will be given to me, generosity because my father and forefathers gave it,

original: mtho ris kyi don du sbyin pa dang / grags pa'i don du sbyin pa dang / sems kyi rgyan gyi don dang / sems kyi yo byad kyi don dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs kyi don dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi don du sbyin pa dang / grags pa'i don du sbyin pa dang / sems kyi rgyan gyi don dang / sems kyi yo byad kyi don dang / rnal 'byor gyi tshogs kyi don dang / don gyi mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa'o //
translated: generosity for the sake of heaven, generosity for the sake of fame, generosity for the sake of the ornament of the mind, generosity for the sake of the equipment of the mind, generosity for the sake of the accumulation of yoga, and generosity for the sake of attaining the supreme goal.

original: de la nye ba la sbyin pa ni snga ma dag na re nam nye bar gyur cing nye bar lhags pa dag la sbyin par byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de la nye ba la sbyin pa ni snga ma dag na re nam nye bar gyur cing nye bar lhags pa dag la sbyin par byed pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Giving to those nearby is giving to those who have come near and arrived.

original: 'jigs pas sbyin pa ni med par byed pa mngon sum du mthong nas dam pa sbyin no zhes sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pas sbyin pa ni med par byed pa mngon sum du mthong nas dam pa sbyin no zhes sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Giving out of fear is giving that one gives, thinking, I will give the best, having seen that the recipient is capable of harming.

original: lhag ma ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The remaining types are easy to understand and thus need not be explained.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa gzhal du med do //
analyzed: mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa la sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa gzhal du med do //
translated: If one gives to one who has entered the result of stream entry, the karmic maturation is immeasurable.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la byin na de bas kyang ches gzhal du med do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la byin na de bas kyang ches gzhal du med do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs mod kyi /
translated: If one gives to a stream enterer, it is even more immeasurable.🔽Even if they are not āryas, giving to one’s parents,

original: gzhan yang ; 'phags pa min yang pha ma dang // nad pa dang ni chos smra dang // skye mtha'i byang chub sems dpa' la //
analyzed: gzhan yang ; 'phags pa min yang pha ma dang // nad pa dang ni chos smra dang // skye mtha'i byang chub sems dpa' la //
translated: to the sick, to a Dharma teacher,🔽and to a bodhisattva in his final existence

original: yon ni gzhal du med pa yin //
analyzed: yon ni gzhal du med pa yin //
translated: is immeasurable.

original: lnga po 'di dag la ni so so'i skye bor gyur pa yin yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yon gzhal du med pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag la ni so so'i skye bor gyur pa yin yang 'bras bu'i sgo nas yon gzhal du med pa yin no //
translated: Although these five are ordinary persons, they are immeasurable in terms of their results.

original: de la skye ba tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni srid pa tha ma pa yin no //
analyzed: de la skye ba tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni srid pa tha ma pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva in his last birth is in his final existence.

original: chos smra ba zhing gi khyad par rnam pa bzhi po'i phyogs gang du gtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos smra ba zhing gi khyad par rnam pa bzhi po'i phyogs gang du gtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: In which of the four kinds of fields of qualities does the Dharma teacher belong?

original: phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs su gtogs te /
translated: He belongs to the category of benefactors.

original: de ni skye dgu ma rig pas ldongs pa rnams la shes rab kyi mig sbyin par byed pa dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rab tu ston par byed pa dang / chos kyi sku zag pa med pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de ni skye dgu ma rig pas ldongs pa rnams la shes rab kyi mig sbyin par byed pa dang / mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rab tu ston par byed pa dang / chos kyi sku zag pa med pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa dang /
translated: He is a great spiritual friend, for he gives the eye of wisdom to people blinded by nescience, he shows what is compatible and incompatible, he establishes the uncontaminated Dharma body,

original: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad byed pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po yin no //
analyzed: mdor na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad byed pa yin pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen chen po yin no //
translated: and in brief, he performs all the deeds of a Buddha.

original: las rnams kyi lci ba dang / yang ba nyid shes par 'dod pas mdor na rgyu drug @223b shes par bya ste /
analyzed: las rnams kyi lci ba dang / yang ba nyid shes par 'dod pas mdor na rgyu drug @223b shes par bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to understand the weight and lightness of actions should know in brief the six causes of weight and lightness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the six?

original: mjug dang zhing dang gzhi dang ni //
analyzed: mjug dang zhing dang gzhi dang ni //
translated: The conclusion, the field, the basis,

original: sbyor dang sems pa bsam pa ste //
analyzed: sbyor dang sems pa bsam pa ste //
translated: the application, the intention, and the attitude

original: de dag chung dang che ba las //
analyzed: de dag chung dang che ba las //
translated: are heavy or light

original: las kyang chung dang che ba nyid //
analyzed: las kyang chung dang che ba nyid //
translated: and so too are the actions.

original: mjug ces bya ba ni byas pa'i rjes la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mjug ces bya ba ni byas pa'i rjes la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is what is done after the action is completed.

original: zhing zhes bya ba ni gang du phan pa dang gnod pa dag byed pa'o gzhi ni las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: zhing zhes bya ba ni gang du phan pa dang gnod pa dag byed pa'o gzhi ni las kyi lam mo //
translated: The field is where benefit and harm are done. The basis is the karmic path.

original: sbyor ba ni de'i don du lus dang ngag gis las byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de'i don du lus dang ngag gis las byed pa'o //
translated: The application is the action of body and speech for that purpose.

original: sems pa ni gang gis las kyi lam mthar phyin par byed pa'o //🔽bsam pa ni de dag la de dang 'di lta bu zhig ni bya'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni gang gis las kyi lam mthar phyin par byed pa'o // bsam pa ni de dag la de dang 'di lta bu zhig ni bya'o //
translated: The intention is what brings the karmic path to completion.🔽The attitude is thinking, “I will do this and that,

original: de dang 'di lta bu zhig ni phyis bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'di lta bu zhig ni phyis bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: and later I will do this and that.”

original: la la'i mjug yongs su bzung ba kho na las de lci bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: la la'i mjug yongs su bzung ba kho na las de lci bar 'gyur te /
translated: For some, the conclusion alone makes the action heavy.

original: rnam par smin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽la la'i ni zhing gi dbang kho nas so //
analyzed: rnam par smin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro // la la'i ni zhing gi dbang kho nas so //
translated: because the retribution is certain.🔽For some, the gravity of the transgression is due to the field alone.

original: zhing de nyid la gzhi'i dbang gis lci bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhing de nyid la gzhi'i dbang gis lci bar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same field, the transgression is grave when the basis is grave, but not when it is light.

original: ji ltar pha dang ma la srog gcad pas lci bar 'gyur ba ltar ma byin par blangs pa la sogs pas ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar pha dang ma la srog gcad pas lci bar 'gyur ba ltar ma byin par blangs pa la sogs pas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: For example, killing one’s father and mother is a transgression of immediate retribution, but not the crime of him who is the father and mother of that person.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same for the other transgressions.

original: gang gi thams cad che ba yin pa de ni las kyang shin tu ches lci ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi thams cad che ba yin pa de ni las kyang shin tu ches lci ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The transgression is very grave when it is committed by one who is very good.

original: gang gi chung ngu yin pa de ni shin tu chung ba yin par rig par bya'o //🔽las byas pa dang bsags pa zhes bya ba ji ltar na las bsags pa yin zhe na /🔽bsams bzhin pa dang rdzogs pa dang // mi 'gyod gnyen po med pa dang // 'khor dang rnam par smin pa las //
analyzed: gang gi chung ngu yin pa de ni shin tu chung ba yin par rig par bya'o // las byas pa dang bsags pa zhes bya ba ji ltar na las bsags pa yin zhe na / bsams bzhin pa dang rdzogs pa dang // mi 'gyod gnyen po med pa dang // 'khor dang rnam par smin pa las //
translated: The transgression is very light when it is committed by one who is very bad.🔽What is a “stashed” action?🔽An action is stashed when it is premeditated, completed, without regret, without opposing purification.

original: bsags pa'i las zhes bya ba bzhin //
analyzed: bsags pa'i las zhes bya ba bzhin //
translated: An action is stashed when it is premeditated, completed, without regret, without opposing purification.

original: bsams bzhin pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsams bzhin pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like when it is intentional?

original: ched du bsams nas byas pa yin gyi blo sngon du ma btang ba yang ma yin la bab col du byas pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams nas byas pa yin gyi blo sngon du ma btang ba yang ma yin la bab col du byas pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is intentional when it is committed after reflection, not when it is committed without prior reflection or thoughtlessly.

original: rdzogs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rdzogs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like when it is complete?

original: kha cig ni nyes par spyad pa gcig gis ngan song du 'gro la /
analyzed: kha cig ni nyes par spyad pa gcig gis ngan song du 'gro la /
translated: Some go to the miserable realms through one unwholesome action,

original: kha cig ni gsum gyi bar gyis 'gro ba dang / kha cig ni las kyi lam gcig gis ngan song du 'gro la /
analyzed: kha cig ni gsum gyi bar gyis 'gro ba dang / kha cig ni las kyi lam gcig gis ngan song du 'gro la /
translated: some through three, some go to the miserable realms through one path of action,

original: kha cig ni bcu'i bar gyis 'gro ba de gang zhig gis ji tsam gyis der 'gro bar 'gyur ba rdzogs par ma byas na yang las de byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni bcu'i bar gyis 'gro ba de gang zhig gis ji tsam gyis der 'gro bar 'gyur ba rdzogs par ma byas na yang las de byas pa yin gyi bsags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: some through ten. If one does not complete the action to the extent that it would lead to the miserable realms, then the action is done but not accumulated.

original: rdzogs na ni bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs na ni bsags pa yin no //
translated: If it is complete, it is accumulated.

original: mi 'gyod pa dang / gnyen po med pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyod pa dang / gnyen po med pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like when there is no regret and no antidote?

original: las de la yid la gcags @224a * //
analyzed: las de la yid la gcags @224a * //
translated: The action is done without regret

original: pa med pa dang / gnyen po med pa yin no //
analyzed: pa med pa dang / gnyen po med pa yin no //
translated: and without an antidote.

original: 'khor las ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor las ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like when it is associated with a retinue?

original: mi dge ba la 'khor yang mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba la 'khor yang mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not unwholesome when one turns around to unwholesome.

original: rnam par smin pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it in regard to ripening?

original: rnam par smin pa 'byin par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'byin par nges pa yin no //
translated: It is certain that it will produce a ripened effect.

original: de bzhin du dge ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same holds for wholesome action.

original: de las gzhan du byas pa'i las ni ma bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan du byas pa'i las ni ma bsags pa yin no //
translated: Action that is other than these is not accumulated.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pas mchod rten la sbyin pa byin pa ni bdag gi don du'o zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pas mchod rten la sbyin pa byin pa ni bdag gi don du'o zhes bshad pa /
translated: It has been said that a gift given to a stupa is for one’s own benefit, since it is given by one who is attached to the idea of self.

original: de la longs spyod par byed pa med na ji ltar bsod nams su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la longs spyod par byed pa med na ji ltar bsod nams su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if there is no one to enjoy the gift, how can there be merit?

original: bsod nams ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni btang ba kho na las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ni rnam pa gnyis te / btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba ni btang ba kho na las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of merit:🔽merit that arises from giving, which arises from the mere giving;

original: yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyod pa las byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: and merit that arises from enjoyment, which arises from the enjoyment of the object given.

original: de la mchod rten la btang rgyus byung ba'i bsod nams yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: de la mchod rten la btang rgyus byung ba'i bsod nams yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no merit that arises from the cause of enjoying the merit that is given to the stupa.

original: de la len pa su yang med na ji ltar bsod nams yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la len pa su yang med na ji ltar bsod nams yin zhe na /
translated: If there is no one to receive it, how can there be merit?

original: len par byed pa yod na ni bsod nams su 'gyur la /
analyzed: len par byed pa yod na ni bsod nams su 'gyur la /
translated: If there is a receiver, there is merit.

original: med na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: med na ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la yang rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: If there is not, there is not. What is the reason for this?

original: su la yang phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: su la yang phan btags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no benefit to anyone.

original: 'di ni rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu ma yin te /
translated: This is not a reason.

original: gal te phan btags pa kho nas bsod nams su gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te phan btags pa kho nas bsod nams su gyur na ni /
translated: If merit were to arise only from benefitting others,

original: byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba bsgoms pa rnams bsod nams su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba bsgoms pa rnams bsod nams su mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the immeasurables of loving kindness, etc., and the cultivation of right view would not be merit.

original: de lta bas na mchod rten la yang bsod nams su 'dod par bya'o //🔽len med byams sogs bzhin /
analyzed: de lta bas na mchod rten la yang bsod nams su 'dod par bya'o // len med byams sogs bzhin /
translated: Therefore, merit should be accepted even in relation to a stupa.🔽Like the four immeasurables, loving kindness, etc.

original: ji ltar byams pa la sogs pa la len par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar byams pa la sogs pa la len par byed pa 'am /
translated: Just as there is no receiver of loving kindness, etc.,

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs par med kyang rang gi sems kyi mthus bsod nams su 'gyur ba de bzhin du yon tan dang ldan pa 'das kyang de la dad pa byas pa rang gi sems las bsod nams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs par med kyang rang gi sems kyi mthus bsod nams su 'gyur ba de bzhin du yon tan dang ldan pa 'das kyang de la dad pa byas pa rang gi sems las bsod nams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, merit arises from one's own mind through faith in those who possess good qualities even though they have passed away.

original: 'o na ni sbyin pa dang mchod par bya ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni sbyin pa dang mchod par bya ba don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then giving and worship would be pointless.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: They are not pointless,

original: las de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i dad pa ni ches mchog yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i dad pa ni ches mchog yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because faith that motivates that karma is supreme.

original: ji ltar dgra gsang pa'i bsam pa can des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las de shi bzhin du dgra'i 'du shes kyis byed na bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang du skye bar 'gyur gyi bsams pa @224b tsam gyis ni ma yin pa de bzhin
analyzed: ji ltar dgra gsang pa'i bsam pa can des kun nas bslang ba'i lus dang ngag gi las de shi bzhin du dgra'i 'du shes kyis byed na bsod nams ma yin pa ches mang du skye bar 'gyur gyi bsams pa @224b tsam gyis ni ma yin pa de bzhin
translated: Just as when one who intends to kill an enemy but kills someone else by mistake, he generates much more demerit than if he had killed the intended victim,🔽because the motivation is stronger.

original: du / ston pa 'das kyang de la dad pas kun nas bslang ba'i sbyin pa dang mchod pa'i bya ba byed na bsod nams ches mang du skye bar 'gyur gyi dad pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: du / ston pa 'das kyang de la dad pas kun nas bslang ba'i sbyin pa dang mchod pa'i bya ba byed na bsod nams ches mang du skye bar 'gyur gyi dad pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But if one performs the action of giving and worship motivated by faith in the Master even after his passing, one produces much more merit, not merely through faith.

original: gal te zhing bzang po la sbyin par bya ba'i sa bon 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba can yin no //
analyzed: gal te zhing bzang po la sbyin par bya ba'i sa bon 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba can yin no //
translated: If the seed to be sown in a good field is one that bears pleasant fruit.

original: 'o na zhing ngan pa la byin na 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zhing ngan pa la byin na 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one gives to a bad field, the fruit will be pleasant.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'khrul phyir //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'khrul phyir //
translated: Because the fruit is not confused with regard to its cause.

original: ngan pa'i zhing la'ang 'bras yid 'ong //
analyzed: ngan pa'i zhing la'ang 'bras yid 'ong //
translated: Even in a bad field, the fruit is not confused with its seed.

original: zhing ngan pa la yang sa bon las 'bras bu mi 'khrul ba mthong ste /🔽rgun 'brum gyi sa bon las ni rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu mngar ba kho na skye la ;
analyzed: zhing ngan pa la yang sa bon las 'bras bu mi 'khrul ba mthong ste / rgun 'brum gyi sa bon las ni rgun 'brum gyi 'bras bu mngar ba kho na skye la ;
translated: Even in a bad field, one sees that the fruit is not confused with its seed.🔽From a grape seed, only a sweet grape fruit is produced;

original: nim pa'i sa bon las ni nim pa'i 'bras bu kha ba kho na skye'o //
analyzed: nim pa'i sa bon las ni nim pa'i 'bras bu kha ba kho na skye'o //
translated: from a neem seed, only a bitter neem fruit is produced.

original: de bzhin du zhing ngan pa la yang gzhan la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa'i sbyin pa'i sa bon gyi 'bras bu yang yid du 'ong ba kho na 'grub kyi yid du mi 'ong ba ni ma yin no //🔽zhing gi skyon gyis ni sa bon de'i 'bras bu chung ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhing ngan pa la yang gzhan la phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la zhugs pa'i sbyin pa'i sa bon gyi 'bras bu yang yid du 'ong ba kho na 'grub kyi yid du mi 'ong ba ni ma yin no // zhing gi skyon gyis ni sa bon de'i 'bras bu chung ba 'am /
translated: Likewise, even with respect to a bad field, the fruit of the seed of generosity is only agreeable, not disagreeable, when one has engaged in the superior intention to benefit others.🔽But the fault of the field diminishes the fruit of the seed.

original: 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The fruit is small or nonexistent.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhar la 'ongs pa dang bcas te rdzogs so /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi zhar la 'ongs pa dang bcas te rdzogs so /
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of generosity, together with its offshoots, is completed.

original: // / tshul khrims las byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims las byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: The basis of meritorious action consisting of morality should be mentioned.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims mi dge'i gzugs //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims mi dge'i gzugs //
translated: Bad morality is nonvirtuous form.

original: de spang tshul khrims /
analyzed: de spang tshul khrims /
translated: Morality is the avoidance of that.

original: gzugs mi dge ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi dge ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous form is called bad morality.

original: de spong ba ni tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: de spong ba ni tshul khrims yin no //
translated: Morality is the avoidance of that.

original: spong ba de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: spong ba de yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: That avoidance is twofold.

original: rnam par rig byed gang gis spong bar byed pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed gang gis spong bar byed pa dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The morality that is the avoidance of that which is to be abandoned is twofold: the avoidance of that which is to be abandoned by the informative action and the avoidance of that which is to be abandoned by the non-informative action.

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las spong ba 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims las spong ba 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin no //
translated: Morality is not only the avoidance of immorality.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni bcad pa yang //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / sangs rgyas kyis ni bcad pa yang //
translated: What then?🔽The Buddha has prohibited what is not immoral by nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims ma yin yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcad pa dus ma yin pa'i zas la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag spong ba rnam pa gnyis kyang tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims ma yin yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcad pa dus ma yin pa'i zas la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag spong ba rnam pa gnyis kyang tshul khrims yin te /
translated: The avoidance of the two, eating at improper times, etc., which are not immoral by nature but have been prohibited by the Lord Buddha, is also morality.

original: slab pa mnos pas de dag spyad na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slab pa mnos pas de dag spyad na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who has accepted the precepts transgresses them, it is immorality.

original: tshul khrims mdor bshad zin to //🔽rnam dag yon tan bzhi ldan no //
analyzed: tshul khrims mdor bshad zin to // rnam dag yon tan bzhi ldan no //
translated: Morality has been explained in brief.🔽It is pure when endowed with four qualities.

original: yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims de ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims de ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Morality endowed with four qualities is pure.

original: @225a * // bzlog pa ni rnam par ma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: @225a * // bzlog pa ni rnam par ma dag pa yin no //
translated: The opposite is impure.

original: ji ltar na yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yon tan bzhi dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is morality endowed with four qualities?

original: tshul khrims de rgyus 'phen ma byung //
analyzed: tshul khrims de rgyus 'phen ma byung //
translated: It is not defiled by transgression,🔽it is not defiled by the cause of transgression,🔽it is based on the antidote to transgression,

original: de yi gnyen po zhi la brten //
analyzed: de yi gnyen po zhi la brten //
translated: it is based on tranquility.

original: re zhig 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis 'phen ma byung ba ni ji skad du bshad pas 'phen ma byung ba yin no ;
analyzed: re zhig 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis 'phen ma byung ba ni ji skad du bshad pas 'phen ma byung ba yin no ;
translated: It is not defiled by transgression, because it is not transgressed as explained above.

original: /'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyus 'phen ma byung ba ni chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'phen ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi rgyus 'phen ma byung ba ni chags pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis 'phen ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not defiled by the cause of transgression, because it is not defiled by the passions and secondary passions such as attachment, etc.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po la brten pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi gnyen po la brten pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is based on the antidote to transgression, because it is based on the applications of mindfulness.

original: zhi ba la brten pa ni skye ba'i khyad par la mi brten gyi mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba la brten pa ni skye ba'i khyad par la mi brten gyi mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is based on tranquility, because it is not based on the distinction of birth, but is dedicated to nirvana.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyu lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyu lnga ste /
translated: According to others, there are five causes:

original: las kyi lam dngos kyis rnam par dag pa yin pa dang / nyer bsdogs dag gis rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'phen ma byung ba dang ; dran pas yongs su bzung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: las kyi lam dngos kyis rnam par dag pa yin pa dang / nyer bsdogs dag gis rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis 'phen ma byung ba dang ; dran pas yongs su bzung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is pure in its basis, in its guarding, in its mastery, in its sovereignty, in its purification, in its path, in its method, in its non-inferiority, in its non-confusion, and in its non-attachment.

original: gzhan dag na re tshul khrims ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re tshul khrims ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Others say that morality is of four types:

original: 'jigs pa'i tshul khrims ni 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang chad pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs nas srung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i tshul khrims ni 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang chad pa dang / ngan 'gros 'jigs nas srung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: 1) the morality of fear is that which is observed out of fear of the lack of livelihood, of a bad reputation, of punishment, and of bad destinies;

original: legs su smon pa'i tshul khrims ni srid pa dang / longs spyod dang / bkur sti la chags nas srung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: legs su smon pa'i tshul khrims ni srid pa dang / longs spyod dang / bkur sti la chags nas srung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: 2) the morality of aspiration is that which is observed out of attachment to existence, to enjoyments, and to honors;

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi rjes su mthun pa'i tshul khrims ni yang dag pa'i lta ba can rnams thar pa'i don du srung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi rjes su mthun pa'i tshul khrims ni yang dag pa'i lta ba can rnams thar pa'i don du srung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: 3) the morality of conformity to the factors that contribute to enlightenment is that which is observed by those who have right views for the sake of liberation;🔽4) the morality of aspiration for the result is that which is observed by those who aspire to the result of Stream-enterer, etc.

original: yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni dri ma med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni dri ma med pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Pure morality is morality free from impurity, i.e., uncontaminated morality.

original: tshul khrims rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshul khrims rdzogs so /
translated: Morality is completed.

original: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i dge ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: The wholesome of meditative development is meditation.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is this that is called meditative concentration?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dang / de dang lhan cig 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nature of meditative concentration and whatever is concomitant with it.

original: 'di ci'i phyir bsgom pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir bsgom pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called meditation?

original: sems la sgo phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la sgo phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cultivation of the mind.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba de ni rgyud yon tan rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du byed pa'i phyir sems la shin tu sgo bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba de ni rgyud yon tan rnams kyis de'i bdag nyid du byed pa'i phyir sems la shin tu sgo bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The wholesome of non-concentration is the cultivation of the mind because it makes the mind's nature the same as the virtues.

original: me tog rnams @225b kyis til la bsgos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: me tog rnams @225b kyis til la bsgos pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like sesame seeds that are permeated by the fragrance of flowers.

original: re zhig sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro zhes bshad na /
analyzed: re zhig sbyin pas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro zhes bshad na /
translated: It has been said that one becomes wealthy through generosity.

original: yang na tshul khrims dang bsgom pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dang bsgom pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But what happens through morality and meditation?

original: mtho ris don du tshul khrims dang // 'bral ba'i don du bsgom gtso'i phyir //
analyzed: mtho ris don du tshul khrims dang // 'bral ba'i don du bsgom gtso'i phyir //
translated: and meditation is for the sake of separation.

original: sbyin pa yang mtho ris kyi don du ni 'gyur mod kyi tshul khrims ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang mtho ris kyi don du ni 'gyur mod kyi tshul khrims ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giving is also for the sake of the higher realms, but morality is primary.

original: tshul khrims kyis kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur mod kyi bsgom pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis kyang 'bral bar mi 'gyur mod kyi bsgom pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Morality is also not for the sake of separation, but meditation is primary.🔽A sutra declares:

original: mdo las gang zag bzhi ni tshangs pa'i bsod nams skyed do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las gang zag bzhi ni tshangs pa'i bsod nams skyed do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Four persons generate the merit of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i bsod nams gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bsod nams gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the merit of Brahma?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say:

original: mtshan ma rnam par smin pa can gyi las kyi tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam par smin pa can gyi las kyi tshad shes par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa gang yin pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: It is explained for the purpose of knowing the measure of karma that has Brahma as its maturational result.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re /
translated: Former masters say:

original: bskal par mtho ris dag gnas phyir //
analyzed: bskal par mtho ris dag gnas phyir //
translated: Because they abide in the higher realms for an eon,

original: bzhi yi tshangs pa'i bsod nams yin //🔽zhes zer te /
analyzed: bzhi yi tshangs pa'i bsod nams yin //🔽zhes zer te /
translated: the four are the merit of Brahma.

original: bsod nams ji tsam gyis na bskal par mtho ris su dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni tshangs pa'i bsod nams yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams ji tsam gyis na bskal par mtho ris su dga' bar gnas par 'gyur ba 'di ni tshangs pa'i bsod nams yin te /
translated: How much merit is there for abiding in the higher realms for an eon?

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi tshe bskal par thub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi tshe bskal par thub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the merit of Brahma, because the life of the Brahmapurohita gods is one eon.

original: sde pa gzhan las kyang /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan las kyang /
translated: Also, in another school it is said:

original: tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa ni //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bsod nams bskyed pa ni //
translated: “The one who generates the merit of Brahma

original: bskal par mtho ris dga' bar gnas //
analyzed: bskal par mtho ris dga' bar gnas //
translated: abides in the higher realms for an eon.🔽”

original: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad de 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in verse.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa bshad zin to //
translated: The giving of material things has been explained.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The giving of Dharma should be mentioned.

original: des smras pa /🔽chos sbyin nyon mongs can min pas //
analyzed: des smras pa / chos sbyin nyon mongs can min pas //
translated: He says:

original: mdo sogs yang dag ji bzhin ston //
analyzed: mdo sogs yang dag ji bzhin ston //
translated: The giving of Dharma is the teaching of the sutras and so on,🔽without defilements, and in accordance with reality.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa ni mdo la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni mdo la sogs pa nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ston pa'o //
translated: The giving of Dharma is the teaching of the sutras and so on, without defilements, and in accordance with reality.

original: de'i phyir gang dag chos log par 'chad par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag chos log par 'chad par byed pa'am /
translated: Therefore, those who explain the Dharma incorrectly,

original: sems nyon mongs pa can rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / grags pa 'dod pas chad pa de dag ni bdag nyid kyi bsod nams chen po nyams par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs pa can rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / grags pa 'dod pas chad pa de dag ni bdag nyid kyi bsod nams chen po nyams par byed pa yin no //
translated: Those who are afflicted by the passions and who are attached to gain, honor, and fame, destroy their own great merit.

original: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir bye brag gis dge ba rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba'i gzhir bye brag gis dge ba rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
translated: The three kinds of virtue have been explained according to the three bases of merit.🔽Merit, liberation, and the virtues conducive to both

original: bsod nams mya ngan 'das pa dang // nges 'byed cha mthun dge rnams gsum //
analyzed: bsod nams mya ngan 'das pa dang // nges 'byed cha mthun dge rnams gsum //
translated: are the three kinds of merit.

original: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which has a pleasant karmic maturation is conducive to merit.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa @226a * //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa @226a * //
translated: That which is conducive to liberation

original: ni gang skyes na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su nam 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ni gang skyes na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos su nam 'gyur ba ste /
translated: is that by which one attains nirvana when it arises.

original: gang la 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang / bdag med pa dang / dmyal ba las 'das pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i gtam thos nas sgu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'khrug ces byed pa de la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la 'khor ba'i nyes dmigs dang / bdag med pa dang / dmyal ba las 'das pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i gtam thos nas sgu zing zhes byed pa dang / mchi ma 'khrug ces byed pa de la ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that those who are moved to tears and whose hair stands on end when they hear the teachings that describe the faults of cyclic existence, selflessness, and the benefits of passing beyond misery have the root of virtue that is conducive to liberation.

original: dbyar myu gu skye ba las na g-yul gyi gseb na sa bon yod par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyar myu gu skye ba las na g-yul gyi gseb na sa bon yod par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like knowing that seeds exist in the ground in the spring when sprouts arise.

original: des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: des par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight are the four aspects of heat and so on.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ngan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dag yin no //🔽dri med dge / gya nom /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / bsgribs pa dang / ngan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams kyi rnam grangs dag yin no // dri med dge / gya nom /

analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa med pa rnams kyi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The synonyms of pure factors are: stainless, good, excellent,

analyzed: ngan pa dang gya nom pa dag las gzhan pa ni bar ma zhes bya bar grub pa yin no // 'dus byas dge bsten bya /
translated: The factors that are neither reprehensible nor excellent are established as being middling.🔽The synonyms of conditioned factors are: to be practiced,

original: bsten par bya zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba rnams kyi rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: bsten par bya zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos dge ba rnams kyi rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The synonyms of conditioned factors are: to be practiced,

original: lhag ma rnams ni bsten par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bsten par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: The factors that are not to be practiced are established as being the remaining ones.

original: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas bsten par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas bsten par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the unconditioned not to be practiced?

original: goms par byar @226b mi rung ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i don du bsten par bya ba yin na 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms par byar @226b mi rung ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i don du bsten par bya ba yin na 'bras bu yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to be cultivated and because it is not a result, for the purpose of which one practices.

original: chos gzhan thams cad ni bla ma dang bcas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos gzhan thams cad ni bla ma dang bcas pa yin gyi /
translated: All other phenomena are inferior to the guru.

original: thar pa bla na med pa yin //
analyzed: thar pa bla na med pa yin //
translated: It is the unsurpassed liberation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las ches khyad par du 'phags pa ni med kyi /
translated: There is nothing superior to nirvana.

original: de ni dge ba dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang rtag pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad pas khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: It is virtuous and permanent, and thus it is superior to all.
