original: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa las las bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdzod kyi bshad pa las las bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter, on action, in the Treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: // / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //🔽zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: // / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes // zhes bshad pa /
translated: The world’s various things arise from action.

original: las de dag kyang phra rgyas kyi dbang gis bsags par 'gyur gyi ;
analyzed: las de dag kyang phra rgyas kyi dbang gis bsags par 'gyur gyi ;
translated: Action is accumulated through the force of the negative tendencies.

original: phra rgyas med par ni srid pa mngon par 'grub par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: phra rgyas med par ni srid pa mngon par 'grub par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: Without negative tendencies, it is impossible to establish existence.

original: srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtsa ba phra rgyas yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the root of existence is known to be the negative tendencies.

original: nyon mongs pa 'jug pa na bya ba bcu byed de /🔽rtsa ba brtan par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'jug pa na bya ba bcu byed de / rtsa ba brtan par byed do //
translated: When afflictions engage, they perform ten functions.🔽They stabilize the root.

original: rgyud gnas par byed do //
analyzed: rgyud gnas par byed do //
translated: They maintain the continuum.

original: zhing du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zhing du sgrub par byed do //
translated: They establish the field.

original: rgyu mthun par sgrub par byed do ;
analyzed: rgyu mthun par sgrub par byed do ;
translated: It causes the attainment of a similar effect.

original: / las kyi srid pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: / las kyi srid pa mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: It causes the actualization of the existence of karma.

original: rang gi tshogs yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It causes the acquisition of one's own group.

original: dmigs pa la kun du rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa la kun du rmongs par byed do //
translated: It causes confusion about the object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'khrid par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'khrid par byed do //
translated: It causes the continuation of consciousness.

original: dge ba'i phyogs las g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs las g-yo bar byed do //
translated: It causes wavering from the side of virtue.

original: khams las mi 'da' ba'i tshul gyis 'ching ba'i don du khyab par byed do //
analyzed: khams las mi 'da' ba'i tshul gyis 'ching ba'i don du khyab par byed do //
translated: It causes the pervasiveness of bondage by the method of not transcending the realms.

original: phra rgyas de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
analyzed: phra rgyas de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
translated: How many of these proclivities are there?

original: mdor bsdus na /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na /
translated: In brief,

original: drug drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug drug gang zhe na /
translated: there are six each.

original: 'dod chags de bzhin khong khro dang // nga rgyal ma rig lta ba dang // the tshom yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags de bzhin khong khro dang // nga rgyal ma rig lta ba dang // the tshom yin te /
translated: Desire, anger, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: de bzhin zhes smos pa ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis gzhan dag dmigs pa las rgyas par gyur pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes smos pa ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis gzhan dag dmigs pa las rgyas par gyur pa nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word “also” is used to show that the others increase through the power of desire.

original: de ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de drug kyang /
analyzed: de drug kyang /
translated: These six

original: 'dod chags dbye bas bdun du bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags dbye bas bdun du bshad //
translated: are explained as seven through the divisions of desire.

original: phra rgyas drug po de dag kyang mdo las 'dod chags phye nas bdun du bshad de /
analyzed: phra rgyas drug po de dag kyang mdo las 'dod chags phye nas bdun du bshad de /
translated: The sutras explain that there are seven negative tendencies by differentiating attachment.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: They are the negative tendency of attachment to the desire realm, the negative tendency of anger, the negative tendency of attachment to existence, the negative tendency of pride, the negative tendency of ignorance, the negative tendency of view and the negative tendency of doubt.

original: ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: How are they known?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin nam /🔽'on te 'dod @227a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin nam / 'on te 'dod @227a * //
translated: Are they the negative tendencies of attachment to the desire realm because attachment to the desire realm is a negative tendency?

original: pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin /
analyzed: pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin /
translated: Or are they the negative tendencies of attachment to the desire realm because they are the negative tendencies of attachment to the desire realm?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What is wrong with these?

original: gal te 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin na ni /
translated: If attachment to the desire realm is a negative tendency,

original: 'di na la las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyi las mang du mi gnas la /
analyzed: 'di na la las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa'i sems kyi las mang du mi gnas la /
translated: then some do not frequently abide with minds that are bound by attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa byung na yang phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa byung na yang phyis nges par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes shing /
translated: If the fetter of desire realm attachment arises, one should know the correct nature of renunciation.

original: de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa de'i mthus yang dag par shin tu kun nas 'joms shing phra rgyas dang bcas par spong bar byed do zhas gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo ;
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis kun nas dkris pa de'i mthus yang dag par shin tu kun nas 'joms shing phra rgyas dang bcas par spong bar byed do zhas gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo ;
translated: Through the power of that fetter of desire realm attachment, one should completely destroy it and abandon it along with its latent states.🔽If it is a latent state of desire realm attachment, it would follow that it would not possess latent states.

original: / gal te de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin na ni phra rgyas ldan par ma yin par thal bar 'gyur bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni dbang po gsum dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhas 'byung ba'i chos mngon pa dang 'gal
analyzed: / gal te de 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin na ni phra rgyas ldan par ma yin par thal bar 'gyur bas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni dbang po gsum dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhas 'byung ba'i chos mngon pa dang 'gal
translated: Therefore it is said that the latent states of desire realm attachment are concomitant with three faculties.🔽This contradicts the Abhidharma.

original: lo // bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin te /
analyzed: lo // bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid phra rgyas yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Desire realm attachment itself is a latent state.

original: the tshom nyid phra rgyas yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: the tshom nyid phra rgyas yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The same holds for the other anuśayas up to doubt.

original: de lta na mdo dang 'gal lo zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na mdo dang 'gal lo zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But has it not been said that this interpretation contradicts the Sūtra?

original: 'gal ba med de /🔽phra rgyas dang bcas pa ni rjes su 'bral ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'gal ba med de / phra rgyas dang bcas pa ni rjes su 'bral ba dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: There is no contradiction,🔽for the Sūtra means to say that the anuśayas are associated with the proclivities.

original: / yang na mdo las phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ni thob pa la nye bar btags pa yin te /
analyzed: / yang na mdo las phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ni thob pa la nye bar btags pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the word anuśaya in the Sūtra should be understood as a designation for the possession of the anuśayas.

original: dper na me sdug bsngal zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me sdug bsngal zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the Sūtra says: “The fire of the defilements burns the living beings.”

original: chos mngon pa las phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa kho na la mtshan nyid pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa kho na la mtshan nyid pa yin te /
translated: In the Abhidharma, the word anuśaya is reserved for the defilements themselves, for the anuśayas in and of themselves.

original: de lta bas na phra rgyas rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phra rgyas rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus the anuśayas are only associated.

original: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that?

original: phra rgyas rnams ni /
analyzed: phra rgyas rnams ni /
translated: The Sūtra says:🔽“The anuśayas are the root, the source, the origin, the expositor, the cause, the condition of the proclivities.”

original: sems ni nyon mongs byed phyir dang // sgrib phyir dge dang 'gal phyir dang // gang gi phyir phra rgyas rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / sngon med pa'i dge ba mi skye ba dang / skyes pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ni nyon mongs byed phyir dang // sgrib phyir dge dang 'gal phyir dang // gang gi phyir phra rgyas rnams kyi sems nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / sngon med pa'i dge ba mi skye ba dang / skyes pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they afflict the mind, because they obscure it, because they oppose the virtues, and because they are subtle, the proclivities are not nonassociated compositional factors.

original: 'on te ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang de ltar 'gyur na ni de dag rtag tu nye ba'i phyir dge ba nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs te /
analyzed: 'on te ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang de ltar 'gyur na ni de dag rtag tu nye ba'i phyir dge ba nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs te /
translated: If nonassociated compositional factors were to act in that way, then virtue would never be observed, because they would always be near.

original: de lta bas na dge ba 'ang dmigs pa'i phyir na 'dir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge ba 'ang dmigs pa'i phyir na 'dir /
translated: But since virtue is observed, therefore,

original: phra @227b rgyas ldan pa ma yin min //
analyzed: phra @227b rgyas ldan pa ma yin min //
translated: The proclivities are not nonassociated compositional factors.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ste /
translated: This is not a valid reason.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin par 'dod pa de yang 'di thams cad phra rgyas kyis byas par ni mi 'dod kyi nyon mongs pas byas pa kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin par 'dod pa de yang 'di thams cad phra rgyas kyis byas par ni mi 'dod kyi nyon mongs pas byas pa kho nar 'dod do //
translated: Thus, even those who assert that the proclivities are not concomitant with the mind do not assert that all of them are produced by the proclivities, but that they are produced by the defilements.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de lta bu ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta ba de lta bu ni legs pa yin no //
translated: The Sautrantikas are correct.

original: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams kyi ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the Sautrantika position?

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin la /🔽de rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas yin la / de rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The proclivity of attachment to pleasure is the proclivity of attachment to pleasure.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is not a different substance, the proclivity is neither concomitant nor nonconcomitant.

original: nyon mongs pa nyal ba la ni phra rgyas zhes bya la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyal ba la ni phra rgyas zhes bya la /
translated: The proclivity is called latent because it is dormant.

original: sang pa la ni kun nas dkris pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sang pa la ni kun nas dkris pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The proclivity is called an envelopment because it is manifest.

original: de la nyal ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyal ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is dormant?

original: mngon sum du ma gyur par sa bon gyi dngos pos rjes su 'brel lo //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur par sa bon gyi dngos pos rjes su 'brel lo //
translated: It is associated with the seeds, not with the manifest.

original: sad pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is manifest?

original: mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The latent proclivity is the seed of the defilement.

original: sa bon gyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /🔽lus kyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na / lus kyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yin te /
translated: What is the nature of the seed?

original: dper na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las skyes pa dran pa bskyed pa'i mthu dang / yang dper na myu gu la sogs pa s'a lu'i 'bras bu las bskyed pa'i mthu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las skyes pa dran pa bskyed pa'i mthu dang / yang dper na myu gu la sogs pa s'a lu'i 'bras bu las bskyed pa'i mthu dang 'dra'o //
translated: The seed is the power that the defilement possesses to produce the defilement, a power that is born with the defilement itself, just as the seed of the rice plant is the power that the rice grain possesses to produce the rice plant.🔽If you do not accept this definition of the seed, you will have to say what, according to you, is the meaning of the expression “seed of the defilements.”

original: gang zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi don du phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin pa don gzhan du rtog par byed pa des na dran pa'i sa bon yang don gzhan du brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa bon gyi don du phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin pa don gzhan du rtog par byed pa des na dran pa'i sa bon yang don gzhan du brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that the seed is a proclivity that is not associated with the mind, you will have to say what, according to you, is the meaning of the expression “seed of memory.”

original: 'o na mdo las nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu ste /
translated: But, in the sūtra, the defilements themselves are designated as proclivities.

original: drug tshan drug pa las 'di'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags de bde ba'i tshor ba la rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: drug tshan drug pa las 'di'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags de bde ba'i tshor ba la rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Ṣaṭkoṭṭhikasūtra, the Blessed One said: “What is the proclivity of lust? It is the lust itself, the lust that has not been abandoned and destroyed.

original: rgyas par gsungs so she na /
analyzed: rgyas par gsungs so she na /
translated: What is the proclivity of hostility? It is the hostility that has not been abandoned and destroyed.”

original: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The Sūtra says: “The defilements are the fetters, the bonds, the latent defilements, the bad factors, the factors that are not the roots of merit.

original: de kho na ni phra rgyas ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na ni phra rgyas ma yin no //
translated: The defilements are not the proclivities.

original: 'o na nam 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nam 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When are they proclivities?

original: gang gi tshe nyal ba na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyal ba na 'gyur ro //
translated: They are proclivities when one is asleep.

original: yang na 'di ni rgyu las de nye bar btags pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rgyu las de nye bar btags pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the name of the cause is figuratively designated to the effect.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa bzhag nas bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa bzhag nas bstan bcos la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Having discussed what is extraneous to the subject, let us return to our proper subject.

original: mdo las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes 'dod chags che ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: mdo las 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes 'dod chags che ba gang yin pa /
translated: The Sūtra speaks of two types of attachment: attachment to pleasure and attachment to existence.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is attachment to existence?

original: khams gnyis las skyes srid 'dod chags //🔽gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams @228a * //
analyzed: khams gnyis las skyes srid 'dod chags // gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams @228a * //
translated: Attachment to existence is the attachment to the two higher realms.

original: las skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do //
analyzed: las skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do //
translated: Attachment to the realm of fine-materiality and attachment to the realm of immateriality are called attachment to existence.

original: ci'i phyir de skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de skad du bshad ce na /
translated: Why is this?

original: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der //
analyzed: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der //
translated: Because, in these two realms, the mind is turned within.

original: thar ba'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
analyzed: thar ba'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
translated: The Sūtra says that attachment to existence is taught in order to counteract the idea that the higher realms are deliverance.

original: de dag ni phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'dod chags pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'dod chags pa yin la /
translated: They are attached to meditative attainment,

original: de yang kha nang du bltas pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang kha nang du bltas pa yin te /
translated: and they are also inverted since they are directed internally.

original: de lta bas na kha cig khams de gnyis las thar pa yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes bzlog pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do zhes grag go //
analyzed: de lta bas na kha cig khams de gnyis las thar pa yin no snyam pa'i 'du shes bzlog pa'i phyir srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do zhes grag go //
translated: Therefore it is said that they are attachment to existence since they are the antidote to the conception that liberation is freedom from those two realms.

original: lus kho na srid pa yin la sems can de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa rten dang bcas pa ro myong bar byed pa na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir lus kho na ro myong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kho na srid pa yin la sems can de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa rten dang bcas pa ro myong bar byed pa na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir lus kho na ro myong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Existence is the body alone, and when sentient beings experience meditative attainment together with its basis, they experience the body alone because they are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags de ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags de ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore attachment is explained as attachment to existence.

original: yang chos mngon pa las phra rgyas drug po de las bcur yang 'chad de /
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa las phra rgyas drug po de las bcur yang 'chad de /
translated: Again, the Abhidharma teaches that from among those six negative tendencies, there are ten.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this done?

original: lta ba lnga ste 'jig tshogs dang // log dang mthar 'dzin lta ba dang // lta ba dang ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin dang bcu //
analyzed: lta ba lnga ste 'jig tshogs dang // log dang mthar 'dzin lta ba dang // lta ba dang ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin dang bcu //
translated: overesteeming morality and asceticism,🔽and overesteeming mere faith, learning, conduct, and attainment.

original: phra rgyas drug las lta ba rnam pa lngar byas na bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: phra rgyas drug las lta ba rnam pa lngar byas na bcur 'gyur te /
translated: When the five types of views are distinguished from the six proclivities, there are ten.

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin lnga ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The five that are by nature views are the afflicted view of the self, the view of holding a view to be paramount, the view of holding morality and asceticism to be paramount, wrong view, and the view grasping an extreme.

original: lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa lnga ni 'dod chags dang // khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa lnga ni 'dod chags dang // khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: The five that are not by nature views are attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, and doubt.

original: yang chos mngon pa las phra rgyas bcu po de dag las 'dod pa na spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs na spyod pa sum cu rtsa gcig dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sum cu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: yang chos mngon pa las phra rgyas bcu po de dag las 'dod pa na spyod pa sum cu rtsa drug dang / gzugs na spyod pa sum cu rtsa gcig dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa sum cu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya explains that from among those ten proclivities, there are thirty-six in the desire realm, thirty-one in the form realm, and thirty-one in the formless realm.

original: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du yang 'chad do //
analyzed: dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du yang 'chad do //
translated: Thus, there are eighty-eight.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: phra rgyas de dag ni mdor bsdu na khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas de dag ni mdor bsdu na khams gsum pa'i mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: In brief, the proclivities are to be eliminated by the path of seeing or by the path of cultivation.

original: de la re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na spyod pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: First, in the desire realm, there are thirty-two to be eliminated by the path of seeing.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
analyzed: de dag bcu dang bdun bdun brgyad //
translated: Ten, seven, seven, and eight

original: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs par //🔽'dod na @228b sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
analyzed: lta ba gsum gnyis ma gtogs par // 'dod na @228b sdug bsngal la sogs pa //
translated: except for three views, two views are eliminated🔽in the desire realm by seeing

original: mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mthong bas rim bzhin spong bar byed //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: suffering and so on in order.

original: phra rgyas bcur bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni bcu yod do //
analyzed: phra rgyas bcur bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni bcu yod do //
translated: The ten proclivities that have been explained are the ten to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm.

original: de dag nyid la kun 'byung 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang ; 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te /
analyzed: de dag nyid la kun 'byung 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun dang ; 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te /
translated: The same ten are the seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and the seven to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs so //
translated: This is because the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and clinging to rules and ritual as supreme are excluded.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de /
translated: Eight are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma gtogs so //
translated: This is because the afflicted view of the self and extreme view are excluded.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gnyis so //🔽de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gnyis so // de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: Thus there are thirty two proclivities.

original: bden pa rnams mthong ba tsam gyis spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mthong ba tsam gyis spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing because they are abandoned by merely seeing the four truths.

original: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bya yin //
translated: Four are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang // den pa mthong bas phyis lam goms par byas pas spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang // den pa mthong bas phyis lam goms par byas pas spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are abandoned by seeing the truth of the path and by cultivating the path subsequent to the seeing of the truth.

original: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: Thus, the afflicted view of the self is of one type,

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: to be abandoned by seeing the truth of unsatisfactoriness.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The extreme view is also like this.

original: log par lta ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Wrong view is of four types,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: to be abandoned by seeing the truths of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin of unsatisfactoriness, of the cessation of unsatisfactoriness, and of the path.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices and doubt are also like this.

original: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mtshog tu 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mtshog tu 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices is of two types,

original: sdug bsngal dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: to be abandoned by seeing the truths of unsatisfactoriness and of the path.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnams ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Attachment, anger, pride and ignorance are of five types:

original: bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: to be abandoned by seeing the four noble truths and to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag ni ci lta bu yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag ni ci lta bu yin /
translated: What are those abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering?

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are those abandoned by cultivation?

original: gang dag gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la lhag ma ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Those that have as their object those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering are abandoned by seeing that truth. The rest are abandoned by cultivation.

original: de dag la lta ba ni bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de dag la lta ba ni bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: There are twelve views.

original: the tshom ni @229a * //
analyzed: the tshom ni @229a * //
translated: Doubt

original: bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bzhi yin no //
translated: is fourfold.🔽Attachment

original: 'dod chags ni lnga yin no //🔽khong khro ba ni lnga yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni lnga yin no // khong khro ba ni lnga yin no //
translated: is fivefold.🔽Anger

original: nga rgyal ni lnga yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni lnga yin no //
translated: is fivefold.🔽Pride🔽is fivefold.🔽Ignorance

original: ma rig pa rnams ni lnga yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa rnams ni lnga yin te /
translated: is fivefold.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin no //
translated: Thus there are thirty-six anuśayas in the realm of desire.

original: khod khrom gtogs de dag nyid //
analyzed: khod khrom gtogs de dag nyid //
translated: The same, except for anger.

original: gzugs khams / khong khro ba lnga bor nas gzugs na spyod pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig po de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs khams / khong khro ba lnga bor nas gzugs na spyod pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig po de dag nyid yin no //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are thirty-one anuśayas, the same as above, except for the five categories of anger.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa yang de dang 'dra /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa yang de dang 'dra /
translated: The same in the realm of immateriality.

original: phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig ste //
analyzed: phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig ste //
translated: There are thirty-one anuśayas in the realm of immateriality.

original: de ltar dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dod //
translated: Thus there are ninety-eight anuśayas.

original: de ltar na chos mngon pa dag na re phra rgyas drug po de dag rnam pa dang / bye brag dang khams kyi dbye pas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'dod do /
analyzed: de ltar na chos mngon pa dag na re phra rgyas drug po de dag rnam pa dang / bye brag dang khams kyi dbye pas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'dod do /
translated: Thus, according to the Abhidharma, there are ninety-eight anuśayas, by distinguishing their modes, their aspects, their objects, their stages, their realms.

original: ci mthong ste spang bar bya ba'i chos phra rgyas su bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag nges par mthong ba kho nas spong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mthong ste spang bar bya ba'i chos phra rgyas su bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag nges par mthong ba kho nas spong ngam zhe na /
translated: Are the dharmas to be abandoned by insight the only ones that are anuśayas?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: Objection: They are not.🔽

original: 'o na ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the other anuśayas?

original: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //
analyzed: srid rtse las skyes bzod pa yis //
translated: Those that arise from the summit of existence

original: gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: gzhom bya mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽Those negative tendencies that arise from the summit of existence bhavagraja are to be abandoned by the perseverance for subsequent knowledge anvayajnana ksanti.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa las skyes pa'i phra rgyas gang dag rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa las skyes pa'i phra rgyas gang dag rjes su shes pa'i bzod pas gzhom par bya ba de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone and not by the path of meditation.

original: lhag skyes mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis //🔽bzod pas gzhom par bya ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽sa lhag ma dag na chos dang rjes su shes pas bzod pa spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas yod pa rnams ni ci rigs par 'phags pa rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: lhag skyes mthong dang bsgom gnyis kyis // bzod pas gzhom par bya ba zhes bya bar sbyar te / sa lhag ma dag na chos dang rjes su shes pas bzod pa spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas yod pa rnams ni ci rigs par 'phags pa rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Those that arise from other levels are abandoned by both seeing and meditation.🔽Those that arise from other levels are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and by the path of meditation.🔽Those negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by perseverance for Dharma knowledge and perseverance for subsequent knowledge on the remaining levels are to be abandoned by the path of seeing darśanaheya alone for aryas.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no ;
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no ;
translated: Those that are to be abandoned by perseverance for Dharma knowledge and perseverance for subsequent knowledge on the remaining levels are to be abandoned by the path of meditation bhavanaheya alone for ordinary beings.

original: / bzod pas gzhom min bsgom kho nas //
analyzed: / bzod pas gzhom min bsgom kho nas //
translated: Those that are not to be abandoned by perseverance are abandoned by meditation alone.

original: sa thams cad na phra rgyas gang dag shes pas gzhom par bya ba yod pa de dag ni gnyi ga'i yang rtag tu bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa thams cad na phra rgyas gang dag shes pas gzhom par bya ba yod pa de dag ni gnyi ga'i yang rtag tu bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: On all the stages, the proclivities that are to be abandoned by the path of insight exist as the objects of the knowledge of the path of cultivation.

original: gzhan dag na re phyi rol pa rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni spong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phyi rol pa rnams kyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni spong ba kho na ste /
translated: Others say: The tirthikas abandon the proclivities that are to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: 'di ltar las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo dang sngon gyi mtha' las rtog pa spong ba rnams las rtag par smra pa rnams dang / la la rtag par smra ba rnams dang / rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung bar smra ba 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams las dmigs pa'i @229b lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar las rnam par 'byed pa chen po'i mdo dang sngon gyi mtha' las rtog pa spong ba rnams las rtag par smra pa rnams dang / la la rtag par smra ba rnams dang / rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung bar smra ba 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams las dmigs pa'i @229b lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in the Mahāvyutpatti and in the Pūrvāparakoṭīprahāṇa, it is said that the views that arise in the desire realm are for those who are free from attachment to the desire realm, for those who are eternalists, for those who are partial eternalists, and for those who are nihilists.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The defilements of the realm of form do not have the desire realm as their object.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa dang ldan pa de dag kho na ma spangs pe yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa dang ldan pa de dag kho na ma spangs pe yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus they are not abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag kyang lta ba bskyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de dag kyang lta ba bskyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: They also degenerate simultaneously with the generation of view,

original: lha sbyin bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like Devadatta.

original: lta ba lnga ming gi sgo nas bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma bstan pas 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba lnga ming gi sgo nas bstan gyi rang gi ngo bo'i sgo nas ni ma bstan pas 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na /
translated: The five views are taught by name but not by nature, therefore what is their nature?🔽The self, mine, permanence, annihilation,

original: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // me dang sman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi rtag chad dang // me dang sman la mchog lta dang // rgyu min lam min der lta ba //
translated: regarding fire and medicine as supreme,🔽and viewing what is not the path as the path.

original: de dag lta ba lnga yin no //🔽bdag gam bdag gir lta ba ni //
analyzed: de dag lta ba lnga yin no // bdag gam bdag gir lta ba ni //
translated: These are the five views.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the self and mine is the afflicted view of the🔽perishing aggregates.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig pa'o //
translated: It perishes, thus it is perishing.

original: bsags pas na tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsags pas na tshogs pa ste /
translated: It is an aggregation, thus it is an aggregate.

original: mang po dang phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang po dang phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for many and a heap.

original: 'di ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
translated: It is a perishing aggregate, thus it is the perishing aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: rtag par 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag par 'du shes pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the notion of permanence and the notion of a whole.

original: de skad du bshad de /
analyzed: de skad du bshad de /
translated: This is what is explained.

original: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: The belief in a self is preceded by these.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o//
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o//
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the view of the transitory collection.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad kyang 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin mod kyi /
translated: All that has outflows as its object is indeed the view of the transitory collection.

original: ci nas kyang 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'di ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin gyi /
translated: But in order to understand that this is the view of the transitory collection,

original: bdag gam bdag gi la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gam bdag gi la ni ma yin no //
translated: not the self or what belongs to the self,

original: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kho na 'jig tshogs ji lta bar bshad de /
analyzed: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir lta ba kho na 'jig tshogs ji lta bar bshad de /
translated: the view of the self and what belongs to the self is explained as the transitory collection, just as it is.🔽As it is said:

original: ji skad du dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Monks, a monk who is a trainee,

original: bram ze gang la la bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su lta ba na yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la lta ba kho nar zad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o
analyzed: bram ze gang la la bdag go snyam du yang dag par rjes su lta ba na yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag la lta ba kho nar zad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o
translated: Whatever brahmin thinks “I am” is only viewing the five appropriated aggregates.

original: // bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am /🔽chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
analyzed: // bdag tu mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po de nyid la rtag par lta ba'am / chad par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the extreme view that views the very thing that is asserted to be the self as permanent or as annihilated.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the extreme view because it is the view that grasps the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa yod na med do zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i bden pa yod na med do zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: Wrong view is the view that the four truths of suffering and so on do not exist when they do exist.

original: log par zhugs pa'i lta ba thams @230a * //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa'i lta ba thams @230a * //
translated: All views that engage their objects incorrectly are wrong views.

original: cad log par lta ba yin pa las mar drang ba bzhin du ha cang chabs chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig kho na bshad de /
analyzed: cad log par lta ba yin pa las mar drang ba bzhin du ha cang chabs chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig kho na bshad de /
translated: However, only one is explained because it is the most heinous, like drawing out the essence of butter.

original: 'di ni skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni skur pa 'debs par byed pa yin la /
translated: This is the denier.

original: gzhan dag ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The other views are overesteemings.

original: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view that holds as best what is inferior is a false view of superiority.

original: dman pa yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: dman pa yang ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is inferior?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad de /
translated: All that is impure,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the noble ones have rejected it.

original: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: To hold that as best is a false view of superiority.

original: lta ba la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod par bya ba'i rigs pa la sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes brjod par bya ba'i rigs pa la sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byed do //
translated: The word “etc.” should be understood as referring to the overesteeming of morality and ascetic practices.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brdul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba dang / lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brdul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The view that holds as a cause what is not a cause and the view that holds as a path what is not a path are overesteemings of morality and ascetic practices.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,🔽Maheśvara,

original: dbang phyug chen po'am /🔽skye dgu'i bdag po'am /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'am / skye dgu'i bdag po'am /
translated: Prajāpati,

original: gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: or any other.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyu ma yin na de la yang rgyur lta ba dang / me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pa mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin na de dag la yang rgyur lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam dang / grangs can dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa la sogs pa thar pa'i lam ma yin na de dag la yang lam du lta ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi rgyu ma yin na de la yang rgyur lta ba dang / me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pa mtho ris kyi rgyu ma yin na de dag la yang rgyur lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam dang / grangs can dang rnal 'byor gyi shes pa la sogs pa thar pa'i lam ma yin na de dag la yang lam du lta ba lta bu ste /
translated: If the world is not the cause of the self, then viewing it as the cause is also wrong view. If entering fire and water is not the cause of high rebirth, then viewing it as the cause is also wrong view. If mere discipline and ritual, Sāṃkhya, and the knowledge of yoga are not the path to liberation, then viewing them as the path is also wrong view.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes grag go //
translated: Here the term “and so on” is not explicitly stated, but it is well known that it is implied.

original: de ltar na de dag ni lta ba lnga yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni lta ba lnga yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus these should be known as the five views.

original: gal te rgyu yin pa las rgyur lta ba tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu yin pa las rgyur lta ba tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If viewing the cause of the self as the cause is clinging to rules and ritual as supreme,

original: ci'i phyir kun 'byung bas mthong bas spang bar bya pa ma yin zhe na /🔽gang la la dbang phyug gam /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun 'byung bas mthong bas spang bar bya pa ma yin zhe na /🔽gang la la dbang phyug gam /
translated: why is it not abandoned by the path of seeing that realizes the truth of origin?🔽Some say: It is not abandoned by the path of seeing because it is not a view that focuses on the desire realm.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po la rgyur lta ba de ni de la rtag pa gcig pu dang bdag dang byed pa por mngon par zhen nas lta ste /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po la rgyur lta ba de ni de la rtag pa gcig pu dang bdag dang byed pa por mngon par zhen nas lta ste /
translated: The view that the lord of creation is the cause is a view that is generated by the manifest clinging to the self as permanent, unitary, and independent.

original: de lta bas na 'di ltar /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ltar /
translated: Therefore,

original: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs rgyur mngon zhen pa /
translated: the manifest clinging to Īśvara and so on as the cause

original: de ni rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: de ni rtag bdag phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: is generated by the error of permanence and self.

original: rab tu 'jug pas de phyir de //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pas de phyir de //
translated: Therefore,

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya nyid //
translated: it is abandoned by seeing suffering.

original: de dag la rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa de gnyis ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag la rtag pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa de gnyis ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The two errors of permanence and self are abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering alone.

original: de lta bas na des byas pa rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na des byas pa rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the manifest clinging to what they create as the cause is also abandoned by that alone.

original: @230b 'o na gang me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pas mtho ris su skye ba'am /
analyzed: @230b 'o na gang me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pas mtho ris su skye ba'am /
translated: But what about the view that one is born in a higher realm by entering fire and water,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag par lta ba ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag par lta ba ji lta bu yin /
translated: or that one is purified by moral discipline and ascetic practice?

original: de yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: That is also abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: gang dag skyes bu gang zag gang zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims dang / rid gas kyi tshul khrims dang bya gag gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag skyes bu gang zag gang zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims dang / rid gas kyi tshul khrims dang bya gag gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who hold and say that any person or individual who takes up the ethics of cattle, the ethics of birds or the ethics of pigs

original: des dag par 'gyur /🔽grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des dag par 'gyur / grol bar 'gyur /
translated: will be purified,🔽will be liberated,

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: will be released,🔽will transcend pleasure and pain and🔽will attain the transcendence of pleasure and pain

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'da' bar 'gyur zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das pa yang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad du smra ba ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par yid ches pas
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'da' bar 'gyur zhing bde ba dang sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das pa yang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad du smra ba ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par yid ches pas
translated: are misapprehending a noncause to be a cause.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /🔽sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the overesteeming of inferior ethical practices.🔽It is to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin /
translated: Why is it to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it wrongly engages its object, suffering.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows, absurdly, that all that focuses on the contaminated wrongly engages suffering.

original: yang na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhig yong /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhig yong /
translated: Or else, what other view that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is there that is a form of the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices?

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o /
translated: It is that which focuses on that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de yang sdug bsngal la logs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la logs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: It is also that which wrongly engages suffering.

original: yang gang la lam la dmigs pa log par lta ba'am /
analyzed: yang gang la lam la dmigs pa log par lta ba'am /
translated: Moreover, how could one who has a view that focuses on the path or

original: the tshom yod pa de thar pa'i lam med do zhes lta ba'am /
analyzed: the tshom yod pa de thar pa'i lam med do zhes lta ba'am /
translated: doubt about it come to believe that there is no path to liberation?

original: the tshom za ba na ji ltar dpe dag par yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: the tshom za ba na ji ltar dpe dag par yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: Or, if one doubts whether there is a path to liberation, how could one come to believe that there is a pure example?

original: 'on te thar pa'i lam gzhan mchog tu bzung nas 'di ni thar pa yin gyi lam ni med do zhes smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thar pa'i lam gzhan mchog tu bzung nas 'di ni thar pa yin gyi lam ni med do zhes smra'o zhe na /
translated: Or, if one holds that there is another path to liberation that is superior, how could one come to believe that there is no path to liberation?

original: de yang gzhan de kho nas dag par yid ches kyi log par lta ba de ni ma yin pas de'i de yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de yang gzhan de kho nas dag par yid ches kyi log par lta ba de ni ma yin pas de'i de yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that one is convinced of the purity of the self by that wrong view itself. Therefore, it is not established that it focuses on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: yang gang zhig kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas yang dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba de yang /
analyzed: yang gang zhig kun 'byung dang 'gog pa mthong pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas yang dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba de yang /
translated: Moreover, one who is convinced of the purity of the self by wrong view that focuses on objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and cessation

original: ci'i phyir de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: why are those not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: de lta bas na don @231a * //🔽'di ni rtag par bya ba yin no //🔽bdag rtag phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: de lta bas na don @231a * // 'di ni rtag par bya ba yin no // bdag rtag phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: Therefore, this point should be understood as follows.🔽The self is permanent because it is the object of the view of the self.

original: zhes gang bshad pa /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa /
translated: This is what is explained in the line, “The self is permanent because it is the object of the view of the self.”

original: ci phyin ci log de gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci phyin ci log de gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are there only two types of error?

original: phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four errors:

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gcang ba la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde ba dang / mi gcang ba la gtsang ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa'o //
translated: error in regard to permanence in regard to impermanence, error in regard to pleasure in regard to pain, error in regard to purity in regard to impurity, and error in regard to the self in regard to selflessness.

original: yang phyin ci log bzhi chan 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang phyin ci log bzhi chan 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the four errors?

original: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan /🔽mthar 'dzin par lta ba las rtag par lta ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log / bzhi tshan / mthar 'dzin par lta ba las rtag par lta ba ni /
translated: The four errors are the three views.

original: rtag par ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: rtag par ni phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of permanence is an error in regard to the view of the transitory collection.🔽The view of annihilation is an error in regard to the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa las ni bde ba dang gtsang bar phyin ci log go //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa las ni bde ba dang gtsang bar phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of the highest and the view of right conduct are errors in regard to the view of the self.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba las ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba las ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log go //
translated: The view of the self is an error in regard to the self.

original: gzhan dag na re thams cad yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thams cad yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that all are errors.

original: ci ltar na bdag gir lta ba phyin ci log ma yin /
analyzed: ci ltar na bdag gir lta ba phyin ci log ma yin /
translated: How can the view of mine be an error?

original: ci ltar na phyin ci log ma yin /
analyzed: ci ltar na phyin ci log ma yin /
translated: How can it not be an error?

original: phyin ci log gi mdo las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽de las ni bdag kho na dbang byed par lta ba na /🔽bdag gir lta bar 'gyur bar bshad pa yin pas /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mdo las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de las ni bdag kho na dbang byed par lta ba na / bdag gir lta bar 'gyur bar bshad pa yin pas /
translated: Because it is not mentioned in the sutra on error.🔽In that sutra, it is explained that when one views the self as the controller,🔽that is the view of mine.

original: bdag tu lta ba 'di nyid sgo gnyis pa can yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba 'di nyid sgo gnyis pa can yin no //
translated: Therefore, this view of the self has two doors.

original: 'on te bdag ces bya ba 'di las bdag gi zhes bya ba lta pa gzhan zhig yin na ni bdag gis zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bdag ces bya ba 'di las bdag gi zhes bya ba lta pa gzhan zhig yin na ni bdag gis zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the view of self is different from the view of mine, then the view of mine would be the view of self and the view of self would be the view of mine.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci log ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci log ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the other defilements not inverted views?

original: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyis rten phyin ci log rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gsum gyis rten phyin ci log rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: The basis is established as inverted by three causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: phyin ci log phyir dang / nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir //🔽dmigs pa la gcig tu phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang / nges par rtog pa'i phyir dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyin ci log phyir dang / nges rtog phyir dang sgro 'dogs phyir // dmigs pa la gcig tu phyin ci log pa'i phyir dang / nges par rtog pa'i phyir dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of inversion, because of ascertainment, and because of superimposition.

original: chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni med pa'i sgor zhugs pa'i phyir dang sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni med pa'i sgor zhugs pa'i phyir dang sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The view of annihilation and false view are not inverted views because they do not enter the door of nonexistence and do not superimpose.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni de tsam zhig gis /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni de tsam zhig gis /
translated: The esteeming of morality and asceticism does not superimpose.

original: 'dag par dmigs pa'i phyir gcig tu phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dag par dmigs pa'i phyir gcig tu phyin ci log pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not completely erroneous because it is the object of purification.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni des par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas de'i phyir phyin ci log dag ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni des par rtog par byed pa ma yin pas de'i phyir phyin ci log dag ma yin no //
translated: The other defilements are not completely erroneous because they do not grasp their object as being what they take it to be.

original: 'o na mdo las mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa @231b dang ; lta ba phyin ci log pa zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo las mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa @231b dang ; lta ba phyin ci log pa zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But in the sutra, it is said: “The ideation that the impermanent is permanent, the view that is erroneous, the thought that is erroneous, the cognition that is erroneous.”

original: 'dir ni lta ba kho na phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni lta ba kho na phyin ci log yin la /
translated: Here, only the view is erroneous.

original: sems dang 'du shes de'i dbang gis lta ba phyin ci log gi dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log tu bshad do //
analyzed: sems dang 'du shes de'i dbang gis lta ba phyin ci log gi dbang gis de dang mtshungs par ldan pa 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log tu bshad do //
translated: The ideation and thought are said to be erroneous because they are associated with the erroneous view.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na /
translated: Why are sensation and the other aggregates not mentioned?

original: 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are well known in the world.

original: 'jig rten na ni 'du shes phyin ci log / sems phyin ci log ces grags kyi tshor ba phyin ci log ces ni ma grags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni 'du shes phyin ci log / sems phyin ci log ces grags kyi tshor ba phyin ci log ces ni ma grags so //
translated: In the world, it is said that there is a perversion of ideation and a perversion of thought, but not a perversion of sensation.

original: phyin ci log de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: phyin ci log de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: All of these perversions

original: rgyun du zhugs pas spang ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas spang ba yin te /
translated: are abandoned by the stream-enterer,

original: lta ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the afflicted view, together with what is associated with it, is abandoned by the path of insight.

original: sde pa gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa'i 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci log gsum nas de bzhin du bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa'i bar gsum ste /🔽phyin ci log ni bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: sde pa gzhan dag na re mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam pa'i 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci log gsum nas de bzhin du bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa'i bar gsum ste / phyin ci log ni bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: According to another school, there are twelve perversions: three perversions of ideation, of thought and of view, with regard to the impermanent considered as permanent, and so on.

original: de la brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Eight of these twelve perversions are abandoned by the path of insight.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba la 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log pa bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba la 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log pa bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Four perversions of ideation, of thought and of view, with regard to what is painful, to what is impure, are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de lta ma yin na bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i 'du shes dag mid par ji ltar na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i 'du shes dag mid par ji ltar na /
translated: If it were otherwise, how could the notional attachment to pleasure and purity occur in one who is free of attachment?

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyes par 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyes par 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: How could attachment to sense-desire arise in an ārya who is not free of attachment?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod de gal te 'phags pa la bde ba dang gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / sems kun du 'byung ba dang / de dag gi phyin ci log dag tu 'dod na ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod de gal te 'phags pa la bde ba dang gtsang ba'i 'du shes dang / sems kun du 'byung ba dang / de dag gi phyin ci log dag tu 'dod na ni /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not accept this explanation. If the notional attachment to pleasure and purity and the occurrence of the mind and mental factors are asserted to be the error of those two,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes dang / sems kun du 'byung bas de dag gi phyin ci log dag tu yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes dang / sems kun du 'byung bas de dag gi phyin ci log dag tu yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: why are the notional attachment to sentient beings and the occurrence of the mind and mental factors not asserted to be the error of those two?

original: bud med dang bdag la sems can du 'du shes pa med par mi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bud med dang bdag la sems can du 'du shes pa med par mi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical that attachment to sense-desire arises in a woman or a man who do not have the notion of sentient beings in relation to themselves.

original: mdo las kyang 'di ltar 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mdo las kyang 'di ltar 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The noble disciple who possesses learning perfectly understands that “this is the noble truth of suffering.”

original: de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de @232a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log pa dang / sems phyin ci log pa dang / lta ba phyin ci log pa gang yin pa de @232a * //
translated: At that time, he abandons the mistaken ideation, the mistaken mind, and the mistaken view that impermanence is permanent.

original: spong bar byed do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: spong bar byed do zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said in detail.

original: de lta bas na lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i 'du shes dang / sems kho na phyin ci log yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na lta bas kun nas bslang ba'i 'du shes dang / sems kho na phyin ci log yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, only ideation and mind that are motivated by view are mistaken, not the others,

original: de'i dus su 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / ri mo'i gnod sbyin la 'khrul pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i dus su 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / ri mo'i gnod sbyin la 'khrul pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because they are merely delusion at that time, like the delusion of a circle of firebrand or a painted demon.🔽Others say:

original: gzhan dag na re 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bos /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bos /
translated: If that is so, then how does the elder Ananda

original: 'phags pa ngag gi dbang phyug gi dbang du byas nas /🔽'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa ngag gi dbang phyug gi dbang du byas nas / 'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: says:🔽Your mind is tormented

original: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdung //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdung //
translated: by distorted discernment.

original: zhes gang smras pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa ji lta bu /
translated: How is that?

original: de'i phyir slob pas 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log brgyad po thams cad ma spangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob pas 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log brgyad po thams cad ma spangs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, learners have not abandoned all eight distorted discernments and minds.

original: de dag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pas spang bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pas spang bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: They are abandoned by knowing the four noble truths as they are🔽and not by not knowing them.

original: de med par ni ma yin no zhes thabs yang dag par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //🔽yang ji lta ba'i phra rgyas kho na la dbye ba yod kyi gzhan la med dam zhe na /🔽nga rgyal la yang yod de /
analyzed: de med par ni ma yin no zhes thabs yang dag par bstan pa yin pa'i phyir mdo dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro // yang ji lta ba'i phra rgyas kho na la dbye ba yod kyi gzhan la med dam zhe na / nga rgyal la yang yod de /
translated: Therefore, since this sutra correctly teaches the method for abandoning them, it is not contradictory to the sutra.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽nga rgyal bdun /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / nga rgyal bdun /
translated: Do only the views to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path possess the four types of abandonment?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They do not.🔽The four views to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path do not possess the four types of abandonment.🔽The four views to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path do not possess the four types of abandonment.

original: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: bye brag med par sems khengs pa la nga rgyal zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bye brag med par sems khengs pa la nga rgyal zhes bshad do //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind in its entirety.

original: de la 'jug pa'i bye brag las ni rnam pa bdun yin te /🔽chung ngu bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i bye brag las ni rnam pa bdun yin te / chung ngu bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa'am /
translated: It is of seven types, according to its basis.

original: mnyam pa dang mnyam mo snyam du sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mnyam mo snyam du sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind that thinks, 'I am superior' or 'I am equal' in relation to an inferior or an equal.

original: mnyam pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mnyam pa bas bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni lhag pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Excesive pride is the swelling up of the mind that thinks, 'I am superior' in relation to an equal.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa bas kyang bdag khyad par du 'phags so snyam pa ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride that thinks 'I am' is the swelling up of the mind that thinks, 'I am' in relation to the five appropriated aggregates that are grasped as 'I' and 'mine'.🔽Arrogance is the swelling up of the mind that thinks, 'I am' in relation to the qualities of an exalted being that one has not obtained.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gam bdag gis sems pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gam bdag gis sems pa ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am” is the conceit of thinking “I” or “mine” in regard to the five aggregates of clinging.

original: khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob po snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am superior” is the conceit of thinking “I am superior” in regard to those who are not superior.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am a little inferior” is the conceit of thinking “I am a little inferior” to those who are very superior.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no @232b snyam pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no @232b snyam pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking “I am endowed with good qualities” is the conceit of thinking “I am endowed with good qualities” in regard to those who are not endowed with good qualities.

original: 'o na bstan bcos las nga rgyal rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'o na bstan bcos las nga rgyal rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: If that is so, then why does the treatise declaration of equipoise state that there are nine types of pride?
