original: bdag mchog yin no snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang bdag pas mchog yod do //🔽bdag dang mnyam pa yod do //🔽bdag pas dman pa yod do //
analyzed: bdag mchog yin no snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang / bdag dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa dang bdag pas mchog yod do //🔽bdag dang mnyam pa yod do //🔽bdag pas dman pa yod do //
translated: It says, “There are nine types of pride: the aspect of pride thinking I am superior, the aspect of pride thinking I am equal, the aspect of pride thinking I am inferior, the aspect of pride thinking I am superior to those who are not superior, the aspect of pride thinking I am equal to those who are equal, the aspect of pride thinking I am inferior to those who are superior, the aspect of pride thinking I am superior to those who are equal, the aspect of pride thinking I am equal to those who are inferior and the aspect of pride thinking I am inferior to those who are inferior.”

original: bdag pas mchog med do //🔽bdag dang mnyam pa med do //
analyzed: bdag pas mchog med do // bdag dang mnyam pa med do //
translated: There is no one superior to me.🔽There is no one equal to me.

original: bdag pas dman pa med do snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes gang bshad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bdag pas dman pa med do snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes gang bshad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: There is no one inferior to me.

original: rnam pa dgu pa de dag ni gsum po 'di dag nyid las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa de dag ni gsum po 'di dag nyid las byung ba ste /
translated: These are the nine types of pride.

original: gsum gang las she na /
analyzed: gsum gang las she na /
translated: From what three?

original: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag las so //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag las so //
translated: From pride, excessive pride, and slight pride.

original: de la dang po'i gsum ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i gsum ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gsum ste /
translated: The first three are the three types of pride based on views:

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //🔽gnyis pa'i gsum ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams so // gnyis pa'i gsum ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
translated: excessive pride, pride, and slight pride.🔽The second three are slight pride, pride, and excessive pride.

original: gsum pa'i gsum ni nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa'i gsum ni nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
translated: The third three are pride, excessive pride, and slight pride.

original: re zhig ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni sems khengs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal du rigs na /
analyzed: re zhig ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis dman no snyam pa ni sems khengs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal du rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable that slight pride is the thought i am slightly inferior to those who are very superior, since this is a basis for mental inflation.

original: bdag pas dman pa med do snyam pa 'di la go khengs pa'i gnas ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: bdag pas dman pa med do snyam pa 'di la go khengs pa'i gnas ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: But what basis is there for the thought i am not inferior to those who are inferior?

original: gang zhig mngon par 'dod pa'i sems can gyi tshogs dam pa'i nang na bdag nyid dman yang tha gi'o snyam du sems pa de lta bu de yod do //
analyzed: gang zhig mngon par 'dod pa'i sems can gyi tshogs dam pa'i nang na bdag nyid dman yang tha gi'o snyam du sems pa de lta bu de yod do //
translated: There is a basis, since there are those who think i am the best in the assembly of sentient beings who are not as good as me.

original: gzhan yang 'di ni ye shes la 'jug pa las bshad pa'i lugs yin gyi rab tu byed pa las bstan pa yongs su bzung ste /🔽bdag mchog yin no snyam pa 'di ni dman pa dang / mnyam pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa la ltos nas nga rgyal yang yin la /🔽lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ni ye shes la 'jug pa las bshad pa'i lugs yin gyi rab tu byed pa las bstan pa yongs su bzung ste / bdag mchog yin no snyam pa 'di ni dman pa dang / mnyam pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa la ltos nas nga rgyal yang yin la / lhag pa'i nga rgyal yang yin /
translated: Moreover, this is the system explained in the attainment of knowledge, but it is not the system of the treatise on the levels.🔽The thought i am supreme is pride when it is in relation to those who are inferior, equal or superior.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal yang yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal yang yin no //
translated: It is excessive pride when it is in relation to those who are superior.🔽It is the pride of the proud when it is in relation to those who are equal.

original: yang na nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /🔽smras pa / mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
analyzed: yang na nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na / smras pa / mthong dang bsgom pas zad bya ba //
translated: Or, by what are these seven types of pride abandoned?🔽They are abandoned by seeing and by cultivation.

original: de dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag gis zad par bya ba ste /🔽de nas 'di skad du thams cad @233a * //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa dag gis zad par bya ba ste / de nas 'di skad du thams cad @233a * //
translated: They are abandoned by both seeing and cultivation.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then it would follow that all are abandoned by seeing and cultivation.

original: ci 'phags pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa de kun du spyod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'phags pa rnams bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa gang yin pa de kun du spyod dam zhe na /
translated: Do noble ones who have not abandoned objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation employ them?

original: nges pa med de 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni /🔽gsod sogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa med de 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni / gsod sogs kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: There is no certainty because objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation🔽are the afflicted states of killing and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa gang gi ched du bsams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris pa gang gi ched du bsams te /
translated: Afflicted states are those that are contemplated for the sake of killing and so on.

original: srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed pha nas brdzun du smra bar byed pa'i bar de ni bsgos pas spang bar bya ba yin te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags kyi srog gcod par byed pha nas brdzun du smra bar byed pa'i bar de ni bsgos pas spang bar bya ba yin te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From killing to lying, these are abandoned by cultivation because they focus on objects abandoned by cultivation.

original: de bzhin 'jig sred /
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig sred /
translated: So too, craving for nonexistence.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Craving for nonexistence is also abandoned by cultivation.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba'i chos 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this phenomenon called craving for nonexistence?

original: khams gsum pa'i mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mi rtag pa ste /
translated: It is impermanence of the three realms.

original: de la don du gnyer ba ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o //🔽de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skye ba'i sred pa'i phyogs bdag ni glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bur gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'o // de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras ni skye ba'i sred pa'i phyogs bdag ni glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bur gyur kyang ci ma rung zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: Craving for nonexistence is the pursuit of that.🔽The word so too indicates that craving for existence is also abandoned by cultivation.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams kyang yod do zhes bshad la /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams kyang yod do zhes bshad la /
translated: It is explained that the aspects of pride exist.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang yod mod kyi /
translated: The pride thinking I also exists.

original: 'phags pa la /
analyzed: 'phags pa la /
translated: In the case of the noble ones,

original: rnam sogs pa'o snyam mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam sogs pa'o snyam mi 'byung //
translated: the thought “I am” does not occur.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'i bar du bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'jig pa'i sred pa'i bar du bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the root text refers to the craving for annihilation.

original: ci'i phyir de dag ma spangs kyang mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag ma spangs kyang mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Why do these not occur in the noble ones even though they have not yet abandoned them?

original: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bas rgyas par 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: Because they are nourished by the views.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa rnams dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The forms of pride and the pride thinking “I am” are nourished by the afflicted view of the self.

original: de'i phyir rked pa bcag pa'i phyir yang ldan par mi nus so //🔽gsod pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni log par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rked pa bcag pa'i phyir yang ldan par mi nus so // gsod pa la sogs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni log par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they cannot be possessed by the noble ones, because their backs have been broken.🔽The entanglements of killing and so on are nourished by wrong view.

original: 'jig pa'i sred pa ni chad par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i sred pa ni chad par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The craving for annihilation is nourished by the view of annihilation.

original: skye ba'i srid pa'i phyogs ni rtag par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa'i phyogs ni rtag par lta bas rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The craving for existence is nourished by the view of permanence.

original: mi dge ba'i 'gyod pa'am ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'gyod pa'am ma yin no //
translated: They do not have nonvirtuous regret.

original: 'gyod pa mi dge ba yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin na 'phags pa la ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa mi dge ba yang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin na 'phags pa la ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: If regret were an object to be abandoned by the path of meditation, it would not occur in aryas,

original: de the tshom gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni kun du 'gro ba dag yin //
analyzed: de the tshom gyis kun nas bslang ba yin pa'i phyir ro // yang phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni kun du 'gro ba dag yin //
translated: because it is motivated by doubt.

original: du ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: du ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin zhe na / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong spang bya ba //
translated: From among those ninety eight negative tendencies, how many are pervasive sarvatraga and how many are not pervasive asarvatraga?

original: lta dang de @233b bzhin the tshom dang / gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
analyzed: lta dang de @233b bzhin the tshom dang / gang de lhan cig ma 'dres pa'i //
translated: Those views and doubts abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin🔽and the ignorance concomitant with them and the unmixed ignorance

original: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
analyzed: ma rig gang yin kun du 'gro //
translated: are pervasive.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba rnams dang / the tshom dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa ma 'dres pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lta ba rnams dang / the tshom dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa ma 'dres pa kho na ste /
translated: Those views and doubts abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin, the ignorance concomitant with them and the unmixed ignorance that is abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin alone are pervasive.

original: de ltar na lta ba bdun dang / the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa gnyis dang / phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na lta ba bdun dang / the tshom gnyis dang / ma rig pa gnyis dang / phra rgyas bcu gcig po de dag ni rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the seven views, the two doubts, the two ignorances, and the eleven negative tendencies focus on their own realm in its entirety.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: They are called negative tendencies that focus on the same realm because they focus on the same realm.🔽Do they focus on the entire realm all at once or in stages?

original: ci re zhig rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yang dmigs gal te rim gyis na ni gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro //🔽'on te cig car ro zhe na ni /🔽su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ci re zhig rim gyis sam 'on te cig car yang dmigs gal te rim gyis na ni gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ro // 'on te cig car ro zhe na ni / su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If they focus on the entire realm in stages, then it follows that they would also focus on other realms.🔽If they focus on the entire realm all at once,🔽who would believe that the entire desire realm is pure?

original: mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa las rgyur yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa las rgyur yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: Or who would believe that the entire realm is a cause when it is not a cause?

original: mtha' dag la ni cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: mtha' dag la ni cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: We do not say that the entire realm is focused on all at once.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang cig car du dmigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang cig car du dmigs so //
translated: However, all five aspects are focused on all at once.

original: de lta na yang gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la bdag la sred pa yod la /
translated: If that is so, then craving for the self exists for those who possess the view of the self.

original: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod cing /
analyzed: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod cing /
translated: Those who view something as supreme or pure strive for it.

original: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur bas sred pa dang nga rgyal dag kyang rung kun du 'gro ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur bas sred pa dang nga rgyal dag kyang rung kun du 'gro ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they also become proud, craving and pride would also be pervasive.

original: de lta yin na de gnyi ga mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na de gnyi ga mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, since they focus on objects to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation, by what are they abandoned?

original: 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they focus on mixed objects.

original: yang na lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcu pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcu pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Or they are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing because they possess the tenth because they are generated by the power of view.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa spyi pa 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa spyi pa 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: These two afflictions are specific, not general afflictions.

original: de lta bas na kun tu 'gro ba dag ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun tu 'gro ba dag ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they are not pervasive.

original: yang skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag tu phra rgyas bcu gcig bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag las dgu gang du dmigs /
analyzed: yang skal ba mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag tu phra rgyas bcu gcig bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag las dgu gang du dmigs /
translated: Again, the eleven negative tendencies that are explained as pervasive negative tendencies of the same realm are objects of nine negative tendencies.

original: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis po ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the two views.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba las ma gtogs pa phra rgyas gzhan dgu ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin no //🔽res @234a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba las ma gtogs pa phra rgyas gzhan dgu ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba dag yin no // res @234a * //
translated: Except for the afflicted view of the self and extreme view, the other nine negative tendencies are pervasive negative tendencies of different realms.

original: 'ga' ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
analyzed: 'ga' ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes they focus on one realm of a different type.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis la dmigs te /🔽'dod pa dang ldan pa gzugs dang ldan pa la dmigs pa rnams la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis la dmigs te / 'dod pa dang ldan pa gzugs dang ldan pa la dmigs pa rnams la /
translated: Sometimes they focus on two.🔽The Abhidharmakosa states,🔽Those possessing desire realm objects focus on those possessing form realm objects.🔽Those possessing formless realm objects focus on those possessing desire realm objects.

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa gzugs med pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa gzugs med pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those possessing desire realm objects focus on those possessing formless realm objects.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta bskal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba dang / rtag par lta ba skyed par byed pa de'i tshe ji ltar 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta bskal pa mi mnyam pa'i khams la dmigs pa dag ma yin zhe na /
translated: When beings in the desire realm generate the afflicted view of the self and the view of permanence with respect to Brahma, how could the afflicted view of the self and extreme view not focus on realms of different eons?

original: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / mthar 'dzin par lta pa yang des kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / mthar 'dzin par lta pa yang des kun nas bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not focus on the self and mine, and extreme view is motivated by that.

original: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di lta ba gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What view is it?

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re 'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re 'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Abhidharmikas say: This is not a view but a wrong knowledge.

original: yang de la dmigs pa gzhan dag ni lta ba yin gyi 'di ni lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: yang de la dmigs pa gzhan dag ni lta ba yin gyi 'di ni lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that other views that focus on Brahma are views but this is not?

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni tshad mar bya dgos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni tshad mar bya dgos so //
translated: You must accept our tenet.

original: yang ci phra rgyas kho na kun du 'gro ba dag yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci phra rgyas kho na kun du 'gro ba dag yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are only the negative tendencies pervasive?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: He responds: No.

original: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
translated: Those that arise together with them

original: 'byung de 'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'byung de 'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
translated: are omnipresent, except for obtainment.

original: chos gzhan phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / lhan cig 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams dang / lhan cig 'byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag kyang kun du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those other phenomena that arise together with the omnipresent negative tendencies are also omnipresent.

original: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu du ma'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu du ma'i phyir de lta ma yin no //
translated: Obtainment is not like that because it has many results.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba dag yin la phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin pa dag kyang yod ces bya ba mu bzhir bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba dag yin la phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus rgyu ma yin pa dag kyang yod ces bya ba mu bzhir bya ste /
translated: Therefore four possibilities exist: negative tendencies that are omnipresent but not causes of omnipresent negative tendencies through being causes,

original: mu dang po 'di ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: mu dang po 'di ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The first possibility is future omnipresent negative tendencies.

original: gnyis pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The second is those that arise simultaneously with past and present negative tendencies.

original: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag ni sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag ni sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The third and fourth should be applied.

original: phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa dag yin no //
translated: Among these ninety-eight proclivities, how many have impure objects?

original: du ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: How many have pure objects?🔽Those to be abandoned by seeing

original: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya ba //
analyzed: 'gog dang lam mthong spang bya ba //
translated: cessation and the path,

original: log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig pa //
analyzed: log lta the tshom de dag dang // ldan dang 'ba' zhig ma rig pa //
translated: false views, doubt, and the ignorance associated with them and independent ignorance,

original: drug ni zag med spyod yul @234b can ;
analyzed: drug ni zag med spyod yul @234b can ;
translated: six proclivities have pure objects.🔽Three proclivities are to be abandoned by seeing cessation: false views, doubt, and the ignorance associated with them.

original: /'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas gsum po log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dag dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gsum po de dag nyid de /
analyzed: /'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas gsum po log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dag dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gsum po de dag nyid de /
translated: Three proclivities are to be abandoned by seeing the path: false views, doubt, and the ignorance associated with them.

original: de ltar na drug po de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na drug po de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag yin no //
translated: Thus, these six proclivities have pure objects.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The remaining proclivities have impure objects.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas //🔽sa drug sa dgu'i lam ni de'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa dang // lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas // sa drug sa dgu'i lam ni de'o //
translated: The cessation and path of one’s level are the objects of the minds of beings of other levels.

original: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: spyod yul can gyi yul yin no //
translated: The path of the six levels is the object of the knowledge of the truth of the path of the nine levels.🔽The cessation of the six levels is the object of the knowledge of the truth of cessation of the nine levels.🔽The object of the view of annihilation that focuses on cessation is the cessation of its own level.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ni rang gi sa pa'i 'gog pa kho na yin te /
translated: The object of the view of annihilation that focuses on the path is the path of its own level.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi kho na yin la /
translated: The object of the view of annihilation that focuses on the desire realm is the cessation of the desire realm.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i pa rnams kyi bar du yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i kho na yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i pa rnams kyi bar du yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i kho na yin no //
translated: The object of the view of annihilation that focuses on the summit of existence is the cessation of the summit of existence.🔽The object of the view of annihilation that focuses on the path of the desire realm is the path of the six levels.

original: lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa drug gi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
analyzed: lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni sa drug gi chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
translated: It is the path that is compatible with the knowledge of the truth of Dharma of the six levels.

original: gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yang yin no //
translated: It is also the antidote of the form and formless realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pas brgyad po rnams kyi dmigs pa yangs dgu pa'i rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pas brgyad po rnams kyi dmigs pa yangs dgu pa'i rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam thams cad yin te /
translated: The nine remaining objects of the eight that are the focal objects of the formless realm are all the path compatible with the class of subsequent knowledge.

original: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path is the mutual cause of each other.

original: gal te chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dag kyang phan tshun rgyu yin mod kyi rjes su shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ni ma yin pas lam la dmigs pas 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gal te chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dag kyang phan tshun rgyu yin mod kyi rjes su shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ni ma yin pas lam la dmigs pas 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la ni mi dmigs so //
translated: Though Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are the mutual cause of each other, since subsequent knowledge is not the antidote of the desire realm, the desire realm does not focus on the path compatible with the class of subsequent knowledge that focuses on the path.

original: 'o na ni chos shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyi phyir lam la dmigs pa de'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni chos shes pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin pa nyid kyi phyir lam la dmigs pa de'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then since Dharma knowledge is the antidote of the form and formless realms, it would be the focal object of those of its level that focus on the path.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag de dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir dang mtha' dag kyang gnyen po ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag de dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir dang mtha' dag kyang gnyen po ma yin la /
translated: Because the Dharma knowledges of the truths of suffering and origin are not antidotes to those two truths, they do not focus on all of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa mtha' dag gi yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa mtha' dag gi yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not antidotes to all of the truths of suffering and origin of the form and formless realms, because they are not antidotes to objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de lta bas na dang po med pa'i phyir dang / dang po rnams kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin no //🔽yang @235a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na dang po med pa'i phyir dang / dang po rnams kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin no // yang @235a * //
translated: Therefore they do not focus on the first truth, nor do they focus on all of the first truth.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag tu mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dag zag pa med pa la dmigs pa dag tu mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why are attachment, anger, pride, holding a view to be paramount, and holding ethics and vows to be paramount not asserted to focus on uncontaminated states?

original: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: They are not attachment because they are objects to be abandoned.

original: 'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na go spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni spang bar bya ba yin na gal te zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin na go spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If attachment is to be abandoned, then if it has uncontaminated objects, it would not be to be abandoned.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa bzhin no //
translated: Like aspiration for virtuous dharmas.

original: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
analyzed: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
translated: It is not aversion, because it does not harm.

original: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la ni khong khro ba skye na 'gog pa dang lam dang ni de lta ma yin no //🔽zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po la ni khong khro ba skye na 'gog pa dang lam dang ni de lta ma yin no // zhi dang dag dang mchog gyur phyir //
translated: Aversion arises toward objects that harm, but cessation and the path are not like that.

original: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
analyzed: nga rgyal ma yin mchog 'dzin min //
translated: It is not pride, because it is supreme.🔽It is not grasping at what is supreme, because it is pure.

original: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis khengs par 'gyur ba 'ongs ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam dag ni zhi ba yin pa'i phyir de dag gis khengs par 'gyur ba 'ongs ba yang ma yin la /
translated: Since cessation and the path are supreme, it is not the case that one becomes proud of them.

original: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir de gnyis la dag par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin pa'i phyir de gnyis la dag par 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And since they are pure in reality, grasping at those two as pure is not grasping at what is supreme as pure.🔽It is not doubt, because it is definite.

original: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te /
analyzed: dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin na de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te /
translated: If one regards the inferior as superior, it is the overesteeming of inferior ethics and so on as superior.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi dmigs pa zag pa med pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gi dmigs pa zag pa med pa yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is illogical that their focal object is uncontaminated.

original: phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ;
analyzed: phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ;
translated: From among those ninety eight negative tendencies, how many are increased through their object field?

original: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How many are increased through being concomitant?🔽The pervasive negative tendencies

original: phra rgyas kun du 'gro rnams ni //
analyzed: phra rgyas kun du 'gro rnams ni //
translated: are increased with respect to all five aspects

original: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa //🔽thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa // thams cad du ni rgyas par 'gyur //
translated: of their level through their object field.

original: kun 'gro ma yin rang ris so //
analyzed: kun 'gro ma yin rang ris so //
translated: The nonpervasive with respect to their class.

original: phra rgyas gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa pa'i rnam pa lnga po thams cad la yang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sa pa'i rnam pa lnga po thams cad la yang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The pervasive negative tendencies are increased with respect to all five aspects of their level through their object field.

original: thams cad du ni 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sar rang gi ris kho na la rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thams cad du ni 'gro ba ma yin pa rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rang gi sar rang gi ris kho na la rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Those that do not pervade all levels increase in their own type in their own level by means of focal object, but not in others.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris kho na la rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris kho na la rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering increase in their own type that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na la rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na la rgyas pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Similarly, those to be abandoned by the path of meditation increase in their own type that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not increase in other types.

original: spyir btang bar byas nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de /🔽zag med gong ma'i yul @235b can min //
analyzed: spyir btang bar byas nas dmigs kyis ston par byed de / zag med gong ma'i yul @235b can min //
translated: Having made a general statement, he specifies:🔽Those that focus on uncontaminated states do not increase.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par mi 'gyur ba kho na yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas rnams ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par mi 'gyur ba kho na yin la /
translated: Negative tendencies that focus on uncontaminated states do not increase through the focal object.

original: sa gong ma la dmigs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma la dmigs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor do those that focus on higher levels increase.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po ni /
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa'i dngos po ni /
translated: The things that are their objects

original: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas gnyen po'i phyir //
translated: are not appropriated, because they are antidotes.

original: dngos po gang zhig bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa de la phra rgyas gzhan dag kyang rgyas par 'gyur bar nus te /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig bdag tu lta ba dang sred pa dag gis bdag gir byas pa de la phra rgyas gzhan dag kyang rgyas par 'gyur bar nus te /
translated: Any thing that is appropriated by the view of self and craving can also be extended by other negative tendencies.

original: snam bu gsher ba la rdul chags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snam bu gsher ba la rdul chags pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like dust that adheres to a wet cloth.

original: zag pa med pa yang de lta ma yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang de lta ma yin la /
translated: But that is not the case for uncontaminated states,

original: sa 'og ma la yang ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa rnams ni de dag la rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la yang ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag la dmigs pa rnams ni de dag la rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor for lower levels. Therefore negative tendencies do not extend to those objects.

original: gang zhig 'di na gnas pa las de don du gnyer bar byed pa de ni mi dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di na gnas pa las de don du gnyer bar byed pa de ni mi dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: Those who strive for those things that are not present here have a desire for nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam ni de dag la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang lam ni de dag la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa yin la /
translated: Nirvana and the path are antidotes to the afflictions that focus on those things.

original: sa gong ma yang 'og ma rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas de'i phyir yang de dag tu gnas mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sa gong ma yang 'og ma rnams kyi gnyen po yin pas de'i phyir yang de dag tu gnas mi mthong ste /
translated: And higher levels are antidotes to lower levels. Therefore one does not see them as objects to be observed.

original: rdo bsreg pa la rkang mthil dag gi gnas mi mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo bsreg pa la rkang mthil dag gi gnas mi mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the soles of the feet not seeing the place where they are located.

original: gzhan dag na re phra rgyas kyi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin de dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re phra rgyas kyi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin de dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: Others say: The meaning of negative tendency is concordance. They are not concordant with those.

original: rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub po rgyas par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub po rgyas par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like rough food not nourishing someone with a wind disorder.

original: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bshad zin to //
translated: That which increases through the focal object has already been explained.

original: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa //🔽de ni der mtshungs ldan sgo nas //
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs ldan pa // de ni der mtshungs ldan sgo nas //
translated: That which is concomitant with what

original: rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: increases through concomitance.🔽That which is concomitant with what increases through concomitance.

original: phra rgyas gang zhig chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni der mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas gang zhig chos gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni der mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is concomitant with what increases through concomitance.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji srid du ma spangs ba zhes bya ba khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ji srid du ma spangs ba zhes bya ba khyad par du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “only” is for the purpose of distinguishing that it increases as long as it is not abandoned.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag kyang ma yin skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag kyang ma yin skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun tu 'gro ba dag kyang ma yin la /
translated: They are not focal objects of uncontaminated states, nor are they pervasive negative tendencies focusing on different realms.

original: phra rgyas de dag kyang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa'i phra rgyas dag lta yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: phra rgyas de dag kyang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin pa'i phra rgyas dag lta yod dam zhe na /
translated: Are there negative tendencies that increase through concomitance but not through the focal object?

original: yod de / skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa la kun du 'gro ba'i phra rgyas rnams so /🔽phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin /
analyzed: yod de / skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa la kun du 'gro ba'i phra rgyas rnams so / phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po de dag las du ni mi dge ba yin /
translated: Yes, pervasive negative tendencies focusing on different realms.

original: du ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni lung du ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: From among those ninety-eight negative tendencies, how many are nonvirtuous and how many are neutral?

original: @236a * // gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
analyzed: @236a * // gong ma thams cad lung ma bstan //
translated: All higher realms are neutral.

original: re zhig gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: All those that occur in the form and formless realms are neutral alone.

original: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal yin na de yang de gnyis na med de /
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni sdug bsngal yin na de yang de gnyis na med de /
translated: The karmic maturation of afflicted phenomena is suffering, but that does not exist in those two realms.

original: pha rol po la yang gnod pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
analyzed: pha rol po la yang gnod pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // 'dod na 'jig tshogs lta ba dang // mthar 'dzin lhan cig ma rig pa //
translated: because the other person has no cause for harming.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the realm of desire, the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and ignorance associated with them are neutral.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'jig rten pha rol du bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sbyin par byed //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'jig rten pha rol du bde bar 'gyur bar bya'o zhes sbyin par byed //
translated: Because they do not conflict with generosity, etc., and because one gives, thinking, “May I be happy in the next world!”

original: tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims srung bar byed do //
translated: One guards morality.

original: chad par lta ba yang thar ba'i rjes su mthun pa dag yin te /
analyzed: chad par lta ba yang thar ba'i rjes su mthun pa dag yin te /
translated: The afflicted view of annihilation is favorable to liberation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One said:

original: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Among the non-Buddhist views, this is the best, namely:

original: bdag med par gyur cig / bdag gi med par gyur cig / bdag 'byung bar ma gyur cig / bdag gi 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i lta ba 'di mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med par gyur cig / bdag gi med par gyur cig / bdag 'byung bar ma gyur cig / bdag gi 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba'i lta ba 'di mchog yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The view that may I not exist, may I not be, may I not arise is the worst of views.

original: gzhan yang lta ba 'di gnyis ni rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang lta ba 'di gnyis ni rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, these two views are not included among the ten fetters because they are not the root of cyclic existence, because they are not the root of the afflicted view of the self, because they do not directly grasp the self, because they are not the cause of the other views, because they are not the cause of the fetters, and because they are not the cause of the root of cyclic existence.

original: mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, craving for higher rebirth and pride thinking i would follow as a consequence.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re /
translated: Former masters say:

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri dags dang bya rnams la yang yod pa gang yin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The innate afflicted view of the self that exists in animals and birds is neutral.

original: rnam par brtag pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par brtag pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The imputed afflicted view of the self is nonvirtuous.

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba'o //
translated: The remaining views are nonvirtuous here.

original: phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi dge ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams na mi dge ba dag yin no //
translated: The other proclivities are unwholesome in the realm of desire.

original: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin //
analyzed: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin //
translated: How many are roots of non-good?

original: du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not?

original: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //🔽'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags thams cad dang / khong khro ba thams cad dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i rmongs pa thams cad ni go rims bzhin du mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum pa chags @236b pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin // 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags thams cad dang / khong khro ba thams cad dang / 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i rmongs pa thams cad ni go rims bzhin du mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum pa chags @236b pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: In the realm of desire, attachment, anger and delusion are roots of non-good.

original: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /
translated: In the realm of desire, all attachment, all anger and all delusion, except for the delusion which is associated with the afflicted view of self and the extreme, are respectively the root of non-good which is attachment, the root of non-good which is anger, the root of non-good which is delusion.

original: gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa de kho na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa de kho na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: That which is non-good and is also a root of non-good is considered to be a root of non-good.

original: phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The other proclivities are not roots of non-good.

original: du ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag yin /
analyzed: du ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dag yin /
translated: How many are roots of the indeterminate?

original: du ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not?

original: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
translated: Three are roots of the indeterminate.

original: gsum po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gsum po gang dag ce na /
translated: Which three?

original: de ni sred dang ma rig blo //
analyzed: de ni sred dang ma rig blo //
translated: Craving, ignorance, and view.

original: de zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin par ston te /
translated: The word “that” refers to the indeterminate.

original: kha che ba rnams na re sred pa dang ma rig pa dang shes rab tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re sred pa dang ma rig pa dang shes rab tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas of Kaśmīr say: Craving, ignorance, and the wisdom that is part of the three views, even when it is the wisdom resulting from the ripening cause, are roots of the indeterminate.

original: gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa de rtsa ba dag kyang yin no zhes zer ro //🔽rnam gnyis mthor 'jug phyir de las //
analyzed: gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa de thams cad ni lung du ma bstan pa de rtsa ba dag kyang yin no zhes zer ro // rnam gnyis mthor 'jug phyir de las //
translated: Whatever is indeterminate is rooted in the indeterminate.🔽Doubt is not a root, because it engages two aspects.

original: gzhan min / the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa bar 'ong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan min / the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa bar 'ong ba ma yin te /
translated: Doubt is not a root, because it engages two aspects.

original: g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unstable.

original: nga rgyal ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: nga rgyal ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: Pride is not a root because it is not elevated by the definition of being inflated.

original: rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a root because it is not similar to a root.

original: 'jig rten na rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang / 'og na gnas pa dag yin par mthong ngo zhes grag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang / 'og na gnas pa dag yin par mthong ngo zhes grag go //
translated: In the world, it is well known that roots are firm and grow downward.

original: bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa /
analyzed: bzhi zhes nyi 'og pa /
translated: Four, say the Aparāntakas.

original: nyi 'og pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhir 'dod de /
analyzed: nyi 'og pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhir 'dod de /
translated: The Aparāntakas assert that there are four neutral roots.

original: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
analyzed: de dag sred lta nga rgyal rmongs //
translated: Craving, view, pride, and ignorance are neutral.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dag ces bya bar ston te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa dag ces bya bar ston te /
translated: The word “those” teaches that they are neutral.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: They are neutral craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: ci'i phyir de dag kho na lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnams su 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag kho na lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba rnams su 'dod ce na /
translated: Why are only those asserted to be neutral roots?

original: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa gsum ma rig las //
translated: Because the three contemplatives are born from ignorance.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three contemplatives.

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dag yin la /
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dag yin la /
translated: They are contemplatives who are dominated by craving, by views, or by pride.

original: de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro //
translated: And these are due to the power of ignorance.

original: mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin nam /
analyzed: mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin nam /
translated: In the sutras, fourteen indeterminate questions are mentioned. Are they indeterminate because they are not declared?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i dri ba la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad do //
translated: The indeterminate is explained as a question to be set aside.

original: 'dri ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dri ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of questions:

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba dang / rnam par phye nas lung bstan par bya ba @237a * //
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba dang / rnam par phye nas lung bstan par bya ba @237a * //
translated: those to be answered categorically, those to be answered by distinguishing,

original: dang ; dris nas lung bstan par bya ba dang gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang ; dris nas lung bstan par bya ba dang gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: those to be answered by a question, and those to be set aside.

original: de la go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de la go rims bzhin du /
translated: The four answers are, respectively:🔽Categorical, distinguishing,

original: mgo gcig dang ni rnam phye dang // dri dang gzhag par lung bstan pa //
analyzed: mgo gcig dang ni rnam phye dang // dri dang gzhag par lung bstan pa //
translated: Questioning, and setting aside.

original: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
translated: Death, birth, superiority,

original: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
translated: Self, other, etc. are like that.

original: bar rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: bar rig par bya ste ;
translated: The middle is to be known.

original: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Will all sentient beings die?”

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should answer categorically, “They will die.”

original: ci sems can thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ci sems can thams cad skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Will all sentient beings be born?”

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should answer having distinguished, “Those with afflictions will be born, but those without afflictions will not.”

original: ci mi 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ci mi 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin nam dman pa yin zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, “Is this person superior or inferior?”

original: gang las ltos te 'dri zhes dris nas lung bstan par bya ste /🔽gal te lha rnams la ltos te'o zhes zer na ni dman no zhes lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang las ltos te 'dri zhes dris nas lung bstan par bya ste / gal te lha rnams la ltos te'o zhes zer na ni dman no zhes lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should answer having asked, “In relation to what are you asking?”🔽If one says, “In relation to the gods,” one should answer, “He is inferior.”

original: 'on te ngan song rnams las ltos te'o zhes zer na ni khyad par du 'phags so zhes lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te ngan song rnams las ltos te'o zhes zer na ni khyad par du 'phags so zhes lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: If one says, “In relation to the lower realms,” one should answer, “He is superior.”

original: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks whether sentient beings are other than the aggregates or not other,

original: sems can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas med pa'i phyir gzhag par bya ste /
translated: one should not answer that they are other or not other,

original: mo gsham gyi bu sngo bsangs sam dkar sham zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu sngo bsangs sam dkar sham zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as one should not say that the son of a barren woman is blue or yellow.

original: 'di ji ltar na lung ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar na lung ma bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this not an indeterminate question?

original: de ni lung ma bstan no zhes de lta bur lung du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lung ma bstan no zhes de lta bur lung du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is indeterminate, it is indeterminate.🔽Others say that the question, “Will all beings be born?”

original: gzhan dag na re thams cad skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yang mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thams cad skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yang mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: is also to be answered categorically.🔽But if one asks, “Will those who die be born?”

original: gang zhig ci gang dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba de la ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ci gang dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag skye bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri ba de la ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: this is to be analyzed.

original: mi la yang dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnyi ga yod de /
analyzed: mi la yang dman pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa gnyi ga yod de /
translated: Humans are of two types: inferior and superior.

original: ltos pa yin pas mgo gcig tu gnyis kar lung bstan par bya dgos te /
analyzed: ltos pa yin pas mgo gcig tu gnyis kar lung bstan par bya dgos te /
translated: Since the question is relative, it must be answered categorically in both cases.

original: dper na rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, consciousness is both a cause and a result.

original: gcig tu 'dri ba la gcig tu lung bstan du mi rung bas rnam par phye ste lung bstan par rigs so //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dri ba la gcig tu lung bstan du mi rung bas rnam par phye ste lung bstan par rigs so //
translated: It is not suitable to answer a question that is asked in a single way in a single way.

original: phung po dag las sems can gzhan nam zhes 'dri ba 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: phung po dag las sems can gzhan nam zhes 'dri ba 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin te /
translated: The question, “Are sentient beings different from the aggregates?” is only indeterminate.

original: lung du ma @237b bstan pa kho na ni lung bstan par mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: lung du ma @237b bstan pa kho na ni lung bstan par mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is not suitable to answer an indeterminate question in a single way.

original: gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang yin pa gzhag par bya ba nyid du lung ston pa de ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa yin /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang yin pa gzhag par bya ba nyid du lung ston pa de ji ltar na lung du ma bstan pa yin /
translated: How could it be indeterminate to answer a question that should be set aside by saying that it should be set aside?

original: chos mngon pa rnams na re bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang ; de'i legs par bshad pa'i chos dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa dang / gzugs mi rtag pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa rnams na re bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang ; de'i legs par bshad pa'i chos dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun legs par zhugs pa dang / gzugs mi rtag pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar mi rtag pa dang /
translated: Abhidharmikas say: The Bhagavān, the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly enlightened buddha, his well-explained Dharma, the Saṅgha of his śrāvakas who are well entered, and the impermanence of form and so on up to consciousness,

original: sdug bsngal gdags pa nas lam gdags pa'i bar ni don dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gdags pa nas lam gdags pa'i bar ni don dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the designation of suffering up to the designation of the path are meaningful.

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore they should be explained definitively.

original: rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gal te 'ga' zhig chos dag smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gal te 'ga' zhig chos dag smros shig ces zer na /
translated: The explanation of the classification of questions is this: If someone asks, “Speak about the Dharmas,”

original: de la 'das pa dag dang / ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar byung ba dag dang / chos mang po zhig yod na gang dag smra bar bya zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'das pa dag dang / ma 'ongs pa dag dang / da ltar byung ba dag dang / chos mang po zhig yod na gang dag smra bar bya zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: then one should say, “There are many Dharmas, past, future, and present. Which should I speak about?”

original: gal te 'das pa dag smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dag smros shig ces zer na /
translated: If he says, “Speak about the past,”

original: de la 'das pa rnams la yang gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du mang du yod na zhes brjod par bya'o /
analyzed: de la 'das pa rnams la yang gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du mang du yod na zhes brjod par bya'o /
translated: If he says, “Speak about the past,” you should say, “There are many kinds of past things, from form to consciousness.”

original: 'on te gzugs smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs smros shig ces zer na /
translated: If he says, “Speak about form,”

original: gzugs la yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yod na zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la yang dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yod na zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: you should say, “There are three kinds of form: wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral.”

original: gal te dge ba smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te dge ba smros shig ces zer na /
translated: If he says, “Speak about the wholesome,”

original: de la yang srog gcod pa spong ba nas tshig kyal pa las spong ba'i bar du rnam pa bdun yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang srog gcod pa spong ba nas tshig kyal pa las spong ba'i bar du rnam pa bdun yod do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: you should say, “There are seven kinds of wholesome things, from the avoidance of killing to the avoidance of idle chatter.”

original: gal te srog gcod pa las spong ba smros shig zer na /
analyzed: gal te srog gcod pa las spong ba smros shig zer na /
translated: If he says, “Speak about the avoidance of killing,”🔽you should say, “There are many kinds of avoidance of killing.”

original: de la yang ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa dang rnam pa gsum yod la ma chags pa las skyes pa la yang rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par phye ste brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa las skyes pa dang rnam pa gsum yod la ma chags pa las skyes pa la yang rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yod na zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnam par phye ste brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: and that is threefold: arisen from nonattachment, nonaversion, and nonignorance. That arisen from nonattachment is twofold: either informative form or noninformative form.

original: g-yon can gyi 'dri ba la lung bstan pa yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: g-yon can gyi 'dri ba la lung bstan pa yang de nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the case with the prediction of a deceitful person.

original: de la ni chos mang po zhig yod na zhes brjod par bya'i rnam par dbye bar ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la ni chos mang po zhig yod na zhes brjod par bya'i rnam par dbye bar ni mi bya ste /
translated: In that case, one should say, “There are many phenomena,” but one should not analyze.

original: cang mi smra ba'am /
analyzed: cang mi smra ba'am /
translated: One should remain silent.

original: bdag nyid lung ston du gzhug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid lung ston du gzhug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: This means one should predict for oneself.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis cung zad kyang mi 'dra ba'i @238a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis cung zad kyang mi 'dra ba'i @238a * //
translated: When those two are not at all similar,

original: gsol ba 'debs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad la /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad la /
translated: it is only a request.

original: de gnyis la yang cung zad kyang lung mi ston gyi 'dri ba 'ba' zhig zad na de ji ltar na de gnyis kyi 'dri ba yin /
analyzed: de gnyis la yang cung zad kyang lung mi ston gyi 'dri ba 'ba' zhig zad na de ji ltar na de gnyis kyi 'dri ba yin /
translated: If the Buddha does not answer either of these two questions, how can they be called questions?

original: ji ltar na lung du ston pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lung du ston pa yin /
translated: How can they be called answers?

original: gang zhig lam smros shig ces zer na /
analyzed: gang zhig lam smros shig ces zer na /
translated: If someone asks, “Please teach the path,”

original: ci des lam ma dris pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci des lam ma dris pa yin nam /
translated: how could that not be a question about the path?

original: dri ba nyid kyis de lung bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar dris nas lung bstan pa ma yin /🔽gzhag par bya ba ni dper na 'jig rten mtha' yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dri ba nyid kyis de lung bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar dris nas lung bstan pa ma yin / gzhag par bya ba ni dper na 'jig rten mtha' yod pa zhig gam /
translated: Since the question itself is an answer, how can it not be an answer?

original: mtha' med pa zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' med pa zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Questions to be set aside are, for example, “Is the world finite or infinite?”

original: dri ba lung bstan pa rnams kyi mtshan 'di ni mdo kho na las blta bar bya ste /🔽btsun pa dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dri ba lung bstan pa rnams kyi mtshan 'di ni mdo kho na las blta bar bya ste / btsun pa dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni /
translated: The characteristics of questions to be answered should be understood from the sutras themselves.🔽Bhadanta Mahāsāṃgika says:

original: dri ba lung du bstan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: dri ba lung du bstan pa dag yin te /
translated: Bhikṣus, there are four questions to be answered.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung du bstan par bya ba'i dri ba yang yod /
analyzed: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung du bstan par bya ba'i dri ba yang yod /
translated: Bhikṣus, there are questions to be answered definitively.

original: gzhag par bya ba'i bar du yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'i bar du yang yod de /
translated: There is also a question that is to be answered by distinguishing.

original: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is a question that is to be answered categorically?

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa yin nam zhes 'dri ba 'di ni /
translated: If it is asked, “Are all conditioned things impermanent?”

original: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba yin no //🔽dge slong dag rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba yin no // dge slong dag rnam par phye ste /
translated: Monks, this is a question that is to be answered categorically.

original: lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is a question that is to be answered by distinguishing?

original: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ci zhig so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ched du bsam par bya ba'i las byas nas ci zhig so sor yang dag par myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Having committed an intentional act, what will I experience?”

original: 'dri ba 'di ni dge slong dag mgo rnam par phye ste /🔽lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dri ba 'di ni dge slong dag mgo rnam par phye ste / lung bstan par bya ba'i 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Monks, this is a question that is to be answered by distinguishing.

original: dge slong dag dris nas lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba gang zhe na /🔽'du shes skyes bu bdag nyid yin nam /🔽'on te 'du shes kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: dge slong dag dris nas lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba gang zhe na / 'du shes skyes bu bdag nyid yin nam / 'on te 'du shes kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: Monks, what is a question that is to be answered with a counter-question?

original: bdag kyang gzhan zhig yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: bdag kyang gzhan zhig yin zhes dris na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is the person the same as the perception, or is the person one thing and the perception another?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gang yin par yid ches zhes 'dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bdag gang yin par yid ches zhes 'dri bar bya'o //
translated: “Venerable, do you believe that you are the self?”

original: gal te 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis ni rig pa bdag yin par shes so zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa bdag gis ni rig pa bdag yin par shes so zhes zer na /
translated: If he says, “Venerable, I know that the self is the knower,”

original: de lta yin na 'di skad du 'du shes kyang gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na 'di skad du 'du shes kyang gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: then you should say, “In that case, you should say that the self is one thing and perception is another.

original: 'di ni dge slong dag dris nas lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong dag dris nas lung bstan par bya ba'i dri ba 'di yin no //
translated: This, monks, is the question that should be answered after asking a question in return.

original: dge slong dag gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba gang zhe na /
translated: “Monks, what is the question that should be set aside?

original: dper na 'jig rten rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dper na 'jig rten rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: For example, is the world eternal?

original: mi rtag pa zhig gam /🔽rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhig gam / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it not eternal?🔽Is it both eternal and not eternal?

original: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag @238b pa yang ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag @238b pa yang ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it neither eternal nor not eternal?

original: mtha' yod pa zhig gam /🔽mtha' yod pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: mtha' yod pa zhig gam / mtha' yod pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: Is the world finite?🔽Is it infinite?🔽Is it both finite and infinite?

original: mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it neither finite nor infinite?

original: mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not that it has an end, it is not that it does not have an end,🔽it is not that the Tathāgata exists after death,

original: de bzhin 'ongs pa shi nas yod pa zhig gam zhes bya ba nas srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhig gam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'ongs pa shi nas yod pa zhig gam zhes bya ba nas srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan zhig gam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'dri ba lta bu ste /
translated: it is not that the life force is one thing and the body is another,

original: 'di ni dge slong dag gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba yin no zhes 'don to /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong dag gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba yin no zhes 'don to /
translated: this is the question that should be set aside.
