original: gang zag gang gi phra rgyas gang zhig dmigs pa gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba 'di ni des de dang ldan pa yin no /
analyzed: gang zag gang gi phra rgyas gang zhig dmigs pa gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba 'di ni des de dang ldan pa yin no /
translated: The person who increases the specific negative tendency of a specific object possesses that negative tendency.

original: 'das pas ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung bas ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'das pas ni gang dang ldan pa zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung bas ni gang dang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that one possesses that which is past and so on,

original: mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa 'di gnyis te /
translated: but in brief, affliction is of two types:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams so //
translated: Afflictions that are specific characteristics are attachment, anger and pride.

original: nyon mongs pa spyi pa ni lta ba dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyi pa ni lta ba dang / the tshom dang ma rig pa rnams so //
translated: The general defilements are the afflicted views, doubt and ignorance.🔽As for these, attachment, anger and pride

original: de la re zhig /'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang // khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni //🔽gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i //
analyzed: de la re zhig /'das dang nyer gnas 'dod chags dang // khong khro nga rgyal dag gis ni // gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i //
translated: with regard to the past and the present

original: dngos po da dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: dngos po da dang ldan pa yin //
translated: are possessed in the present.

original: dngos po gang la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal rnams skyes la ma spangs pa de dag gi dngos po de dang ldan te /
analyzed: dngos po gang la 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal rnams skyes la ma spangs pa de dag gi dngos po de dang ldan te /
translated: One possesses the thing with regard to which attachment, anger and pride have arisen in the past and the present and have not been abandoned.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar thams cad la thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar thams cad la thams cad du 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: These are defilements that exist by their intrinsic nature; they do not necessarily occur in all realms and in all modes of birth.

original: nyid kyis de dag ma 'ongs pas //
analyzed: nyid kyis de dag ma 'ongs pas //
translated: As for the future ones,🔽one possesses them all.

original: kun dang / gang la ma spangs pa de dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: kun dang / gang la ma spangs pa de dag ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: One possesses all the defilements of the past and the future with regard to the thing with regard to which they have not been abandoned.

original: yid kyi sa pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ma 'ongs pa de dag nyid kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan te /
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ma 'ongs pa de dag nyid kyis dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan te /
translated: Future attachment, anger and pride of the mental consciousness are associated with all things of the three times.

original: yid dag gi yul ni dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dag gi yul ni dus gsum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the mental consciousness is the three times.

original: gzhan gyis rang dus pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang dus pa /
translated: Others are associated with their own time.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba gzhan dag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba gzhan dag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no //
translated: Other attachment and anger are associated only with future things.

original: gzhan yang gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: gang gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba ste /
translated: They are attachment and anger of the five consciousnesses.🔽This is so for those who possess the quality of being born.

original: skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can rnams kyi ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Those who do not possess the quality of being born

original: de dag nyid /
analyzed: de dag nyid /
translated: are associated with all things of the three times.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.

original: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang // mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @239a * //
analyzed: mi skye rnams kyis thams cad dang // mi skye ba'i chos can rnams kyis rnam par shes pa'i tshogs @239a * //
translated: Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of attachment and anger of the five collections of consciousness.🔽Those who do not possess the quality of being born are associated with all things of the three times by means of the five collections of consciousness.

original: lnga po dag gis kyang dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //🔽lhag ma kun gyi kun dang ldan //
analyzed: lnga po dag gis kyang dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan no //🔽lhag ma kun gyi kun dang ldan //
translated: Those who possess the quality of being born are associated with future things by means of

original: lhag ma yang gang dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhag ma yang gang dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the remaining ones?

original: lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams te /
analyzed: lta ba dang / the tshom dang / ma rig pa rnams te /
translated: The afflicted view, doubt, and ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa spyi dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dus gsum pa'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po thams cad ldan no /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyi dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir dus gsum pa'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po thams cad ldan no /
translated: They are associated with all things of the three times, because they are associated with all defilements.

original: ji srid du ma spangs pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du ma spangs pa zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa kho na yin no //
translated: The expression “as long as they are not abandoned” is also to be understood in the same way.

original: ci 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rdzas su yod dam /
analyzed: ci 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rdzas su yod dam /
translated: Do past and future things exist as real entities?

original: 'on te med /
analyzed: 'on te med /
translated: Or do they not exist?

original: gal te yod na ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist, conditioned factors would be permanent, because they would exist at all times.

original: 'on te med na ni ji ltar na de dang ngam /
analyzed: 'on te med na ni ji ltar na de dang ngam /
translated: But if they do not exist, how can one be bound to them?

original: des ldan pa'am bral ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: des ldan pa'am bral ba yin zhe na /
translated: Or how can one be liberated from them?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir 'dus byas rnams rtag pa nyid du dam mi 'cha'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas do not accept that conditioned factors are permanent because they possess the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: dus rnams kun du yod par ni gsal bar dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: dus rnams kun du yod par ni gsal bar dam 'cha'o //
translated: They do accept that they exist in all three times.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gsungs phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gsungs phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said, “Monks, if past form did not exist, then the noble śrāvaka who has heard much would not view past form.

original: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin no //🔽gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin no // gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But because past form exists, the noble śrāvaka who has heard much does not view past form.🔽If future form did not exist, then the noble śrāvaka who has heard much would not delight in future form.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: But because future form exists, the noble śrāvaka who has heard much does not delight in future form.

original: gnyis phyir / rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyis phyir / rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on two.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: mig dang gzugs rnams nas yid dang chos rnams kyi bar yin te /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams nas yid dang chos rnams kyi bar yin te /
translated: The six consciousnesses are the eye consciousness, etc.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag med na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the past and future did not exist, then the two consciousnesses that have them as objects would not be supported by the two.

original: re zhig lung las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa ni de lta bu yin no /
analyzed: re zhig lung las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa ni de lta bu yin no /
translated: This is how the existence of the past and future is known from the scriptures.

original: rigs pas kyang /
analyzed: rigs pas kyang /
translated: It is also known through reasoning.

original: yul yod phyir /
analyzed: yul yod phyir /
translated: Because the object exists.

original: yul yod na rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul yod na rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi med par ni ma yin no //
translated: Consciousness arises when the object exists, not when it does not exist.

original: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na ni dmigs pa med pa'i rnam @239b par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa med na ni dmigs pa med pa'i rnam @239b par 'gyur te /
translated: If the past and future did not exist, then consciousness would have no object.

original: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it would have no object, consciousness would not exist.🔽Because of the result.

original: 'bras phyir / gal te 'das pa zhag med na tshe phyi ma la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras phyir / gal te 'das pa zhag med na tshe phyi ma la las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If the past did not exist, how could the result of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions exist in the future?

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i tshe ni da ltar gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni med do ;
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i tshe ni da ltar gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni med do ;
translated: When the result is produced, the cause of the present ripening does not exist.

original: / de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: / de lta bas na bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore the Vaibhāṣikas say that the past and future exist.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba yin phan chad gdon mi za bar 'di khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes grags te /🔽'di ltar / de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba yin phan chad gdon mi za bar 'di khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes grags te / 'di ltar / de yod smra ba'i phyir thams cad //
translated: It is well known that if one is a Sarvāstivādin, one must accept this.🔽Thus:

original: yod par smra bar 'dod /
analyzed: yod par smra bar 'dod /
translated: Because they are Sarvāstivādins, they are called Sarvāstivādins.

original: gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba thams cad yod par smra ba de dag gi thams cad yod par smra ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba thams cad yod par smra ba de dag gi thams cad yod par smra ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who maintain that all past, future, and present things exist are Sarvāstivādins.

original: gang dag da ltar byung ba dang 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i las 'das pa gang yin pa cung zad cig ni yod /
analyzed: gang dag da ltar byung ba dang 'bras bu ma bskyed pa'i las 'das pa gang yin pa cung zad cig ni yod /
translated: Those who maintain that some past things exist, namely, those that have not yet yielded their results,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i 'das pa gang yin pa cung zad cig ni med do zhes rnam par phye ste smra ba de dag ni rnam par phye ste smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i 'das pa gang yin pa cung zad cig ni med do zhes rnam par phye ste smra ba de dag ni rnam par phye ste smra ba dag yin no //
translated: and that some past things do not exist, namely, those that have already yielded their results, and that future things do not exist, are called Vibhajyavādins.

original: thams cad yod par smra ba de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba de dag kyang du zhig ce na /
translated: How many are there among those who propound that all exists?🔽They are four: transformation of entity,🔽transformation of characteristics,

original: smras pa / de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya //🔽dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni /
analyzed: smras pa / de dag / rnam bzhi dngos dang mtshan nyid dang // gnas skabs gzhan gzhan 'gyur zhes bya // dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni /
translated: transformation of state, and transformation of another.

original: btsun pa chos skyob yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa chos skyob yin te /
translated: The transformation of entity is that of Bhadanta Dharmatrāta.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: He says that when a phenomenon moves from one time period to another, its entity transforms but its substance does not transform.

original: dper na gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byed pa na /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byed pa na /
translated: For example, when a golden pot is destroyed and made into something else,🔽its shape transforms but its color does not transform.🔽Also, for example, when milk becomes curd, its taste, potency, and result transform but its color does not.

original: dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur gyi kha dog gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa dang / yang dper na 'o ma zho nyid du 'gyur ba na ro dang mthu dang smin par byed pa dag / yongs su 'dor gyi kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'ongs pa na ma
analyzed: dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur gyi kha dog gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa dang / yang dper na 'o ma zho nyid du 'gyur ba na ro dang mthu dang smin par byed pa dag / yongs su 'dor gyi kha dog ni ma yin pa de bzhin du chos kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'ongs pa na ma
translated: In the same way, when a phenomenon moves from the future to the present, its entity transforms but its substance does not.

original: 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor gyi rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor gyi rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the entity of the present that is relinquished, not the substance.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba nas 'das pa'i dus su 'gro ba na da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba nas 'das pa'i dus su 'gro ba na da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor gyi /
translated: In the same way, when it goes from the present to the past, it is the entity of the present that is relinquished,

original: rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: but not the substance.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te /🔽de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa na @240a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs yin te / de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa na @240a * //
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka asserts that there is a transformation of characteristics.

original: 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: He says that when a phenomenon enters the times, it possesses the characteristic of the time in which it presently is, but it does not not possess the characteristics of past and future.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la 'das pa da ltar byung ba dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la 'das pa da ltar byung ba dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The future possesses the characteristic of the future, but it does not not possess the characteristics of the past and present.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dang mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The present also does not not possess the characteristics of the past and future.

original: dper na skyes bu bud med dag cig la chags pa lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bud med dag cig la chags pa lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: For example, a man is not free from attachment to other women when he is attached to one woman.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra asserts that it is transformation of state.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: He says: When phenomena engage the times, they are said to be different through the state of being in a different state, but not through being a different substance.

original: dper na ri lu gcig gcig gi shad mig tu gzhag na gcig ces bya /🔽brgya'i shod mig tu gzhag na brgya /
analyzed: dper na ri lu gcig gcig gi shad mig tu gzhag na gcig ces bya / brgya'i shod mig tu gzhag na brgya /
translated: For example, when a single die is placed in the first square, it is called one.🔽When it is placed in the hundredth square, it is called a hundred.

original: stong gi shod mig tu gzhag na stong zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: stong gi shod mig tu gzhag na stong zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: When it is placed in the thousandth square, it is called a thousand.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha yin te /
translated: Bhadanta Buddhadeva asserts that it is transformation into something else.

original: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod de /🔽dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang bya ;
analyzed: de na re chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod de / dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang bya ;
translated: They say that when a phenomenon engages its object, it is said to be different in dependence on what is prior and subsequent to it.🔽For example, a single woman is called a mother and also called a daughter.

original: bu mo zhes kyang bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
analyzed: bu mo zhes kyang bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro zhes grag ste /
translated: This is the opinion of the Vātsīputrīyas.

original: de ltar na bzhi po de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bzhi po de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus these four are called Proponents of Everything Exists.

original: de dag las dang po ni yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba'i phyir grangs can gyi phyogs la bslan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las dang po ni yongs su 'gyur bar smra ba'i phyir grangs can gyi phyogs la bslan par bya'o //
translated: The first of these should be refuted in the Sāṃkhya position because they propound transformation.

original: gnyis pa'i yang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir dus 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i yang thams cad la mtshan nyid thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir dus 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The second is also illogical because everything would possess all characteristics.

original: skyes bu zhig bud med la la la ni 'dod chags kun du 'byung la /
analyzed: skyes bu zhig bud med la la la ni 'dod chags kun du 'byung la /
translated: For example, a man has attachment for some women but only possesses it for others.

original: la la la ni ldan pa 'ba' zhig go zhes bya ba 'dir ci zhig mtshungs /
analyzed: la la la ni ldan pa 'ba' zhig go zhes bya ba 'dir ci zhig mtshungs /
translated: What is similar in these two cases?

original: bzhi pa'i yang dus gcig la dus gsum char du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i yang dus gcig la dus gsum char du 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth is also illogical because all three times would exist in a single moment.

original: 'das pa'i dus la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig ma dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: The past and future moments of the past are past and future.

original: dbus kyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus kyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The middle moment is present.

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na /
translated: Thus, all of these are included in the three times.

original: gsum pa bzang ste /
analyzed: gsum pa bzang ste /
translated: The third is the best.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the transformation of state.

original: de yis ni /
analyzed: de yis ni /
translated: By this,

original: bya ba yis /
analyzed: bya ba yis /
translated: by activity.

original: dus @240b rnams rnam gzhag gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: dus @240b rnams rnam gzhag gang gi tshe chos de bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: When a dharma does not perform its activity, it is future.

original: gang gi tshe byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byed pa de'i tshe ni da ltar byung ba yin /
translated: When it performs its activity, it is present.

original: gang gi tshe byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe ni 'das pa yin no zhes grag go //🔽de dag thams cad ni yongs su go na gal te 'das pa yang rdzas su yod la ma 'ongs pa yang rdzas su yod na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byas nas 'gags pa de'i tshe ni 'das pa yin no zhes grag go // de dag thams cad ni yongs su go na gal te 'das pa yang rdzas su yod la ma 'ongs pa yang rdzas su yod na /
translated: When it has performed its activity and has ceased, it is past.

original: ci'i phyir 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'das pa'am ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: If the past exists substantially and the future exists substantially, then why is it said that the past exists and the future exists?🔽It is said that they are called past and future because of activity.

original: bya ba yis /
analyzed: bya ba yis /
translated: By activity.

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag ces bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it explained that time is a classification of action?

original: gal te khyim de lta na da ltar byung ba'i mig de dang 'dra ba'i bya ba gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te khyim de lta na da ltar byung ba'i mig de dang 'dra ba'i bya ba gang zhig yin /
translated: If that is so, then what is the action of the present eye that is similar to it?

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is the action of producing and apprehending its result.

original: 'o na ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams kyang 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir bya ba'am bya ba byed du thal bar 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams kyang 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir bya ba'am bya ba byed du thal bar 'gyur bas mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But then, since past homogeneous causes and so on also produce results, it follows that they would have action or perform action. Therefore the definition would be confused.

original: 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'di yang brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: This must be stated:

original: gal te chos de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod na rtag tu bya ba byed pa la /
analyzed: gal te chos de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod na rtag tu bya ba byed pa la /
translated: If a phenomenon exists only in its own nature, it always performs its action.

original: bgegs su byed /
analyzed: bgegs su byed /
translated: What obstructs it?

original: gang gis na res 'ga' ni bya ba byed la res 'ga' ni ma yin zhes bya /
analyzed: gang gis na res 'ga' ni bya ba byed la res 'ga' ni ma yin zhes bya /
translated: By what is it sometimes made to perform its action and sometimes not?

original: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is the nonassembly of conditions,

original: mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi rung ste /
translated: that is unacceptable.

original: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted to always exist.

original: bya ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: bya ba 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa /
translated: What is called the past, future, and present

original: de yang ji ltar /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar /
translated: How is that?

original: bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam ci /
analyzed: bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam ci /
translated: Is there another action in the action?

original: 'on te de 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te de 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: Or is it not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin da ltar byung ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin da ltar byung ba yang ma yin la /
translated: not future, and not present,🔽and yet it exists?

original: yod pa yang yin na ni des na 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag tu yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa yang yin na ni des na 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag tu yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists, then it is unconditioned and it would always exist.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe chos bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe chos bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya'o /
translated: Therefore, when a phenomenon does not perform its action, it is not tenable to say that it is future.

original: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: If action were different from the phenomenon, that error would occur, but it is not different.

original: de'i phyir skyon der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that error does not occur.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de nyid dus su mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de nyid dus su mi rung ste /
translated: If that is so, then it is not tenable that it is time.

original: gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na chos de de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod bzhin du ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te chos kho na bya ba yin na chos de de'i bdag nyid kho nar yod bzhin du ci'i phyir res 'ga' ni 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: If the activity itself is the dharma, then why is it sometimes called the past,

original: res 'ga' ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: sometimes the future,

original: dus rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: dus rnam par gzhag pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: since the temporal distinctions are not established?

original: chos gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //🔽gang skyes la ma zhig pa de ni da ltar @241a * //
analyzed: chos gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no // gang skyes la ma zhig pa de ni da ltar @241a * //
translated: Any dharma that has not yet arisen is future.

original: byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byung ba yin no //
translated: Any that has arisen but not yet ceased is present.🔽Any that has ceased is past.

original: gang zhig pa de ni 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang zhig pa de ni 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la mi 'grub pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is not established in this?

original: 'dir de nyid brjod par bya dgos te /🔽gal te ji ltar da ltar gyi rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dir de nyid brjod par bya dgos te / gal te ji ltar da ltar gyi rdzas su yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: This must be stated.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la yang yod na ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la yang yod na ni /
translated: If the past and future exist in the same way that the present substantially exists,🔽then why do they not arise?

original: de bzhin du /🔽yod na ci'i phyir ma skyes shig / chos de'i rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na ni ji ltar na ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du / yod na ci'i phyir ma skyes shig / chos de'i rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na ni ji ltar na ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: If they exist in that way,🔽then why do they not arise?

original: zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhig pa zhes bya ba 'di 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If they exist in the nature of that dharma, how could it be established that they are unarisen or have ceased?

original: gang zhig med pas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ci zhig ma byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig med pas ma skyes pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ci zhig ma byung bar 'gyur /
translated: What is it that did not exist previously that is called “arisen”?

original: gang zhig med pas zhig pa zhes bya ba yang phyis ci zhig med de /
analyzed: gang zhig med pas zhig pa zhes bya ba yang phyis ci zhig med de /
translated: What is it that does not exist later that is called “ceased”?

original: de lta bas na gal te ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod phan chad dus gsum rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te ma byung ba las byung ba dang / byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod phan chad dus gsum rnam pa thams cad du mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, if one does not assert that what did not exist previously exists and that what existed previously does not exist later, then the three times are not established in any way.

original: gang yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de yang skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir tshig tsam ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'du byed kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes smras pa de yang skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir tshig tsam ste /
translated: Also, the statement “Because it possesses the characteristics of conditioned states, the error of permanence does not arise” is mere verbiage, because arising and destruction are not tenable.

original: chos de rtag pa yang yod la mi rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos de rtag pa yang yod la mi rtag pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no //
translated: This statement, “That dharma is permanent and impermanent,” is unprecedented.

original: yang smras pa /🔽rang bzhin yang ni rtag tu yod //
analyzed: yang smras pa / rang bzhin yang ni rtag tu yod //
translated: Again, it is said:🔽Intrinsic nature always exists,

original: dngos po yang ni rtag mi 'dod //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni rtag mi 'dod //
translated: But things are not asserted to be permanent.

original: rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan //🔽dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal //
analyzed: rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan // dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal //
translated: Nor does a thing arise from its own nature.

original: gang yang gsungs phyir zhes smras pa //
analyzed: gang yang gsungs phyir zhes smras pa //
translated: It is clear that “Īśvara” is a convention.

original: kho bo cag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes smras te /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes smras te /
translated: We also say that the past and future exist.

original: sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin la /🔽rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes de ltar byas nas yod de zhes bya'i /
analyzed: sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin la / rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes de ltar byas nas yod de zhes bya'i /
translated: That which occurred in the past is past.🔽That which will occur if conditions are present is future.

original: rdzas su ni ma yin no /
analyzed: rdzas su ni ma yin no /
translated: We say that it exists in this way, but not substantially.

original: da ltar bzhin du yod do zhes de skad du zer /
analyzed: da ltar bzhin du yod do zhes de skad du zer /
translated: We say that it exists as it is in the present.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar yod /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar yod /
translated: Otherwise, how could it exist?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du yod mod /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid du yod mod /
translated: It exists in the nature of the past and future.

original: gal te rtag tu yod na de ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba de nyid nye bar gnas so /
analyzed: gal te rtag tu yod na de ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba de nyid nye bar gnas so /
translated: If it always exists, how could it be called past or future?

original: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dgag pa'i phyir sngon byung ba'i rgyu dang / phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu sngon byung ba nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du shes par bya bar 'das pa yod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dgag pa'i phyir sngon byung ba'i rgyu dang / phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu sngon byung ba nyid dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du shes par bya bar 'das pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavån taught the existence of the past in order to refute the view that denies cause and effect, and in order to understand that the cause that existed previously and the effect that will exist later are, respectively, past and future.

original: ma 'ongs @241b pa yod do zhes gsungs par zad do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs @241b pa yod do zhes gsungs par zad do //
translated: Thus, in order to refute the view that denies cause and effect, the Lord said that the past exists, in order to understand that the cause that has occurred previously and the effect that will occur later are just past and future.

original: yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi sgra yin pa'i phyir te /🔽dper na smra ba po mar me snga ma med pa yod do //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi sgra yin pa'i phyir te / dper na smra ba po mar me snga ma med pa yod do //
translated: The word “exists” is a verbal sound.🔽For example, when someone says, “The previous lamp existed, the later lamp exists,”🔽and again, when someone says, “The lamp has gone out, but I did not extinguish it,”

original: phyis med pa yod do zhes smras pa dang / yang dper na mar me de shi ba ni yod mod kyi kho bos ni ma bsad do zhes 'dzer ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: phyis med pa yod do zhes smras pa dang / yang dper na mar me de shi ba ni yod mod kyi kho bos ni ma bsad do zhes 'dzer ba de bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: in the same way, the Lord said, “The past and future exist.”

original: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the past and future would not be established at all.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor tshugs can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor tshugs can rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Well then, how do you interpret the statement by the Bhagavān in the context of the wandering mendicants who hold staffs and wear their hair in topknots?

original: las 'das pa dang / zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang ; bral ba dang / rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yod do zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: las 'das pa dang / zad pa dang / 'gog pa dang ; bral ba dang / rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yod do zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu /
translated: “Whatever is past, exhausted, or ceased, or has changed, that exists.”

original: ci de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
analyzed: ci de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
translated: Do they not assert that karma arises in the past?

original: de las ni rgyud de las des kun du drangs par 'bras bu bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las ni rgyud de las des kun du drangs par 'bras bu bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān stated this with the intention that the continuum of that being has the power to produce the effect that is drawn out by that karma.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar yod na 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the past would not be established as existing in its own entity.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: This must be understood without doubt.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mdo las /
translated: Because the Bhagavān said in the Sūtra on Ultimate Emptiness:

original: mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
analyzed: mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong la /
translated: “When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa na yang gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and when it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas kyang slar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /🔽gal te ma 'ongs pa'i mig cig yod par gyur na ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag mig ni ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas kyang slar 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te / gal te ma 'ongs pa'i mig cig yod par gyur na ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhes gsungs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, monks, the eye arises from what did not exist, and having arisen, it ceases.🔽If the future eye existed, it would not be said that it arises from what did not exist.

original: gal te da ltar gyi dus su ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi dus su ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na mi rung ste /
translated: If it is said that it arises from what did not exist in the present, that is not correct,

original: dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because time is not a different object from the thing.

original: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: If it is said that it arises from what did not exist in its own nature, then it is established that the future eye does not exist.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni re zhig 'dir yid dang chos rnams la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ji ltar yid skyes par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni re zhig 'dir yid dang chos rnams la brten nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ji ltar yid skyes par byed pa'i rkyen yin pa
translated: How is the mental faculty a condition that generates the mental consciousness?

original: de ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra 'am /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra 'am /
translated: Are phenomena like that?

original: 'on te chos rnams dmigs pa tsam @242a * //
analyzed: 'on te chos rnams dmigs pa tsam @242a * //
translated: Or are phenomena merely the object of observation?

original: zhig yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /🔽re zhig gal te chos rnams skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhe na ni ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa bskal pa stong na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: zhig yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste / re zhig gal te chos rnams skyed par byed pa'i rkyen yin no zhe na ni ji ltar na ma 'ongs pa bskal pa stong na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: yang na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na mi 'byung ba gang yin pa de da ltar gyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par 'gyur /
translated: First, if phenomena are conditions that generate the mental consciousness, how could phenomena that will arise in the future, in a thousand eons, or that will not arise generate the present mental consciousness?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'jug pa thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'jug pa thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: And it is untenable that nirvana generates the mental consciousness because it is incompatible with all engagement.

original: 'on te chos rnams dmigs pa tsam zhig yin no zhe na ni 'das pa dang ma 'das pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: 'on te chos rnams dmigs pa tsam zhig yin no zhe na ni 'das pa dang ma 'das pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: If you say that the object of consciousness is the mere thing, we say that the past and future are the object of consciousness.

original: gal te med pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin na zhe //
analyzed: gal te med pa ji ltar dmigs pa yin na zhe //
translated: If you ask how a nonexistent can be an object of consciousness,

original: da ni 'dir de ji ltar na dmigs pa yin pa de ltar yod do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: da ni 'dir de ji ltar na dmigs pa yin pa de ltar yod do zhes smra'o //
translated: we reply that it exists in the way that it is an object of consciousness.

original: de'i ji ltar na dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ji ltar na dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it an object of consciousness?

original: byung bar gyur pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /🔽'das pa'i gzugs sam /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste / 'das pa'i gzugs sam /
translated: It is said to be that which has been and that which will be.🔽When one remembers past form or sensation,

original: tshor ba dran pa na yod do zhes bya bar ni su yang mi lta'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa na yod do zhes bya bar ni su yang mi lta'o //
translated: no one thinks that it exists.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: One thinks that it has been.

original: yang ji ltar da ltar gyi gzugs nyams su myong ba de ltar 'das pa yang dran no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar da ltar gyi gzugs nyams su myong ba de ltar 'das pa yang dran no //
translated: Just as one experiences present form, so one remembers past form.

original: ma 'ongs pa ji ltar da ltar du 'gyur ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ji ltar da ltar du 'gyur ba de lta bu ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis mkhyen to //
translated: The Buddhas know the future in the same way that they know the present.

original: gal te yang de de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni da ltar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang de de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni da ltar du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists in the same way that it will be, it would be present.

original: 'on te med do zhe na ni med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te med do zhe na ni med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: If you say that it does not exist, then you are accepting that a non-existent is perceived.

original: gal te de nyid sil bu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid sil bu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the atoms in a scattered state, that is not so,

original: sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not perceive the scattered state.

original: gal te yang de ni gzugs de kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang de ni gzugs de kho na yin te /
translated: If you say that it is just that form,

original: rdul phra rab tu gyes pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab tu gyes pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhe na /
translated: but the atoms are scattered,

original: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams rtag par 'gyur te ;
translated: then the atoms would be permanent.

original: de lta na rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du 'gyur gyi cung zad kyang skye ba yang med la 'gag pa yang med pas 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rdul phra rab bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam du 'gyur gyi cung zad kyang skye ba yang med la 'gag pa yang med pas 'tsho byed kyi rtsod pa blangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it would be a mere aggregation and dispersal of atoms, and not even the slightest thing would arise or cease.🔽The Sūtra master’s argument would be accepted.

original: mig ni nam skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig ni nam skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong zhes rgyas par gsungs pa'i mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sūtra that states, “When the eye arises, it does not come from anywhere” would be rejected.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ji ltar na sil bu nyid yin /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang ji ltar na sil bu nyid yin /
translated: How could feeling and so on, which are not aggregations of atoms, be scattered?

original: de dag kyang ji ltar byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran te /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran te /
translated: We remember the past and future existences as they have occurred and as they are experienced.

original: gal te yang de dag de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang de dag de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist as they are remembered, they are permanent.

original: 'on te med do zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te med do zhe na ni /
translated: If they do not exist,

original: med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya @242b bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya @242b bar grub pa yin no //
translated: then it is established that a non-existent is perceived.

original: gal te med pa yang dmigs pa yin na skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te med pa yang dmigs pa yin na skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a non-existent is perceived, then a thirteenth sense sphere would be perceived.

original: 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa med do snyam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the object of the consciousness that thinks, “The thirteenth sense sphere does not exist”?

original: ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The name itself is the object.

original: de lta ni 'o na ming de nyid med do zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ni 'o na ming de nyid med do zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, one would understand that the name itself does not exist.

original: gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the object of one who perceives the non-existence of sound prior to its production?

original: sgra kho na yin no //
analyzed: sgra kho na yin no //
translated: Sound itself is the object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gang zhig sgra med pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, one who seeks the absence of sound would have to produce sound.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni yod na ji ltar na med pa'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni yod na ji ltar na med pa'i blor 'gyur /
translated: If you say that it is the future state, then if it exists, how could it be the cognition of a non-existent?

original: gal te da ltar med pa yin no zhe na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te da ltar med pa yin no zhe na ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the present state, then that is not so,

original: gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the same.

original: yang na de'i bye brag gang yin pa de ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'grub ste /
analyzed: yang na de'i bye brag gang yin pa de ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'grub ste /
translated: Or else, if it is a particular of that, then it is established that it arises from what has not yet arisen.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni yod pa dang med pa de gnyi ga yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni yod pa dang med pa de gnyi ga yin no /
translated: Therefore, the object of consciousness is both existent and non-existent.

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de dag gis shes pa'am mthong ba 'di ni gnas med do zhes gang smras pa de ji lta bu /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de dag gis shes pa'am mthong ba 'di ni gnas med do zhes gang smras pa de ji lta bu /
translated: Well then, how can it be said that “there is no opportunity for a bodhisattva to cognize or see that which does not exist in the world?”

original: 'dir bsam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan dag snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni yod pa kho na la yod do zhes bya bar lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan dag snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni yod pa kho na la yod do zhes bya bar lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The idea here is that others who are conceited about their knowledge see what does not appear as existent, but we see what exists as existent.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,🔽because it is not tenable that the object of consciousness is both existent and non-existent.

original: blo thams cad kyi dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin na 'di rtog par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: blo thams cad kyi dmigs pa yod pa nyid yin na 'di rtog par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: If the object of all cognitions exists, how could it be a conception?

original: yang na khyad par yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang na khyad par yang ci zhig yod /
translated: Or else, what is the difference between the two?

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this is undoubtedly so.🔽Thus, the Lord has said, “My śrāvaka bhikṣus, come!

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du nga'i nyan thos kyi dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba nas de ngas nang gtams na nub khyad par du 'gro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan du nga'i nyan thos kyi dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba nas de ngas nang gtams na nub khyad par du 'gro //
translated: If I fill the east with sentient beings, the west will become empty.

original: nub gtams na nang khyad par du 'gro ste /
analyzed: nub gtams na nang khyad par du 'gro ste /
translated: If I fill the west with sentient beings, the east will become empty.

original: yod pa la yod par shes la /
analyzed: yod pa la yod par shes la /
translated: They know what exists as existing.

original: med pa la yang med par shes so //
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes so //
translated: They know what does not exist as not existing.

original: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par shes la /
analyzed: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par shes la /
translated: They know what is surpassable as surpassable.

original: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: They know what is unsurpassable as unsurpassable.”

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the reason “because consciousness has an existent object” is also not correct.

original: gang yang 'bras phyir zhes smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang 'bras phyir zhes smras pa /
translated: As for the reason “because of the effect,”

original: mdo sde pa rnams ni las dang 'das pa las @243a * //
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ni las dang 'das pa las @243a * //
translated: Sautrantikas assert that karma is past.🔽

original: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi brjod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi brjod pa kho na'o //
translated: The Sautrantikas do not say that the effect arises from the action and from the past.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How then?

original: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las te /
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi khyad par las te /
translated: From the particularities of the stream that has the action as its antecedent.

original: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained in the refutation of the self.

original: gang gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa de'i 'bras bu rtag tu yod pa kho na bas de la las kyi nus pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gang gi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su yod pa de'i 'bras bu rtag tu yod pa kho na bas de la las kyi nus pa ci zhig yod /
translated: For those who maintain that the past and future exist as real entities, the effect is always existent, so what activity of the action is there?

original: bskyed par nus so //
analyzed: bskyed par nus so //
translated: It is capable of producing.

original: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las dang 'byung ba zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las dang 'byung ba zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: But then it is established that arising occurs from what has not yet occurred.

original: yang thams cad yod pa kho na yin na da ni gang la gang zhig 'dus te /
analyzed: yang thams cad yod pa kho na yin na da ni gang la gang zhig 'dus te /
translated: If everything exists, then what is the point of the coming together of what?

original: de lta na lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du gang yod pa di ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta na lo rtsis pa rnams kyi rtsod pa skad du gang yod pa di ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: In that case, the argument of the astrologers is established: What exists exists only.

original: gang med pa de ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang med pa de ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: What does not exist does not exist only.

original: med pa la ni skye ba yang med do //
analyzed: med pa la ni skye ba yang med do //
translated: There is no arising of what does not exist.

original: yod pa la ni 'jig pa yang med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa la ni 'jig pa yang med do zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that which exists does not perish.

original: 'o na da ltar du byed pa nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na da ltar du byed pa nus pa yin no //
translated: But if the present is capable of action,

original: da ltar du byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: da ltar du byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: what is the present?

original: gal te yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhe na ni rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhe na ni rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the bringing about of the object, then it follows that the present is permanent.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la yang de ji lta bu /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams la yang de ji lta bu /
translated: And how can the non-material have a present?

original: de 'dren pa gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'dren pa gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: And that which brings about is itself produced from what was not.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig yin no zhe na ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par zhig yin no zhe na ni ma byung ba las 'byung ba grub pa yin no //
translated: If it is a particular of its own nature, then it is established that it is produced from what was not.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad du /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas su yod par smra ba'i thams cad yod par smra ba ni bstan pa la legs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i rdzas su yod par smra ba'i thams cad yod par smra ba ni bstan pa la legs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not good for the Sarvāstivādins, who maintain that past and future exist as real entities, to teach that all exists.

original: ji skad du mdo las thams cad yod do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du smra ba de dag ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las thams cad yod do zhes gsungs pa de bzhin du smra ba de dag ni legs pa yin no //
translated: It is good to teach that all exists just as it is said in the sūtra.

original: mdo las ji lta bu thams cad yod ces gsungs she na /
analyzed: mdo las ji lta bu thams cad yod ces gsungs she na /
translated: How does the sutra state that all exist?

original: thams cad yod ces bya ba ni bram ze skye mched bcu gnyis kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad yod ces bya ba ni bram ze skye mched bcu gnyis kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The statement “all exist” means that the brahmin has only the twelve bases.

original: yang na dus gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na dus gsum ste /
translated: Or else, the three times exist.

original: de ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du ni bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained how they exist.

original: yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang med na ji ltar na des sam /
analyzed: yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang med na ji ltar na des sam /
translated: If the past and future do not exist, how can one possess them?

original: der ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: der ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can one possess them through that?

original: de las skyes pa /🔽de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des ldan la /
analyzed: de las skyes pa / de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des ldan la /
translated: One possesses them through the generation of that.🔽One possesses that affliction through the possession of its cause, the negative tendency.

original: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pas dngos po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas yod pas dngos po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: One possesses the thing through the possession of the negative tendency that focuses on it.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: The past and future definitely exist.

original: gang zhig drang bar mi nus pa de la ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang zhig drang bar mi nus pa de la ni 'di ltar /
translated: But if it is impossible to interpret the sutra literally, then it is said:

original: chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin//
analyzed: chos nyid dag ni zab pa yin//
translated: The nature of things is profound.

original: @243b de gdon mi za bar rtogs pas sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @243b de gdon mi za bar rtogs pas sgrub pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: One should understand that this is not a proof that the past and future exist.

original: gang skyes pa de 'gag pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang skyes pa de 'gag pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod de /
translated: There is a way in which it is said that what arises is also what ceases.

original: gzugs skye la gzugs 'gag go //
analyzed: gzugs skye la gzugs 'gag go //
translated: Form arises and form ceases.

original: gzhan skye la gzhan 'gag pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan skye la gzhan 'gag pa'i rnam grangs kyang yod de /
translated: There is a way in which it is said that what is other than what arises is also other than what ceases.

original: ma 'ongs pa skye la da ltar 'gag go ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa skye la da ltar 'gag go ;
translated: The future arises and the present ceases.

original: / dus kyang skye ste /
analyzed: / dus kyang skye ste /
translated: Time arises.

original: skye ba dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because arising is included in time.

original: dus las kyang skye ste /
analyzed: dus las kyang skye ste /
translated: Time arises.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the future time is not a single moment.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa 'di rdzogs so /🔽// / da ni dngos po gang zhig spangs na de dngos po de dang bral ba yin nam /🔽gang dang bral na des dngos po de spangs pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa 'di rdzogs so / // / da ni dngos po gang zhig spangs na de dngos po de dang bral ba yin nam / gang dang bral na des dngos po de spangs pa yin zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This digression is finished.🔽Now, when a thing is abandoned, is it separated from that thing?🔽Or, when it is separated from that thing, is that thing abandoned?

original: re zhig gang dang bral na des dngos po de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang dang bral na des dngos po de spangs pa yin no //
translated: First, when it is separated from that thing, that thing is abandoned.

original: spangs la de dang ma bral ba yang yod de /
analyzed: spangs la de dang ma bral ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also abandonment that is not dissociation from that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: sdug bsngal mthong spang bya spangs kyang //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong spang bya spangs kyang //
translated: one abandons objects to be abandoned by seeing suffering,

original: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
analyzed: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
translated: but possesses the remaining pervasive negative tendencies.

original: dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i ;
analyzed: dang po'i rnam pa spangs kyang de'i ;
translated: Even though one abandons the first aspect,

original: / yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis //
analyzed: / yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis //
translated: one possesses the remaining stains that are its object field.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa ni skyes la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa ni skyes la //
translated: When the knowledge of suffering has arisen

original: kun 'byung shes pa ni ma skyes pa'i tshe sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung shes pa ni ma skyes pa'i tshe sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i ris spangs pa yin no //
translated: and the knowledge of origin has not arisen, one abandons the class of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de spangs kyang de la dmigs pa kun du 'gro ba kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyis ldan no //
analyzed: de spangs kyang de la dmigs pa kun du 'gro ba kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyis ldan no //
translated: Even though one abandons that, one possesses those objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin that focus on that truth.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ris la yang rnam pa dgu las dang po'i rnam pa spangs na de spangs kyang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams kyis lhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ris la yang rnam pa dgu las dang po'i rnam pa spangs na de spangs kyang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams kyis lhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Also, in the class of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation, one possesses the remaining afflictions that focus on that object even though one abandons the first of the nine aspects.

original: dngos po gang la phra rgyas du zhig rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di re re nas bshad na ni brjod par bya ba mang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po gang la phra rgyas du zhig rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di re re nas bshad na ni brjod par bya ba mang por 'gyur te /
translated: If we explain the words “in regard to which real entities how many negative tendencies are active?” in a piecemeal fashion, there will be a great deal to say.

original: de lta bas na ci nas kyang 'bad pa chung du chung dus 'dri ba'i tshogs mang po go bar 'gyur bar bsdus te rnam par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na ci nas kyang 'bad pa chung du chung dus 'dri ba'i tshogs mang po go bar 'gyur bar bsdus te rnam par 'chad par byed do //
translated: Therefore, we will explain them in a concise fashion so that we can understand the many questions with a small amount of effort.

original: mdor bsdu na chos ni bcu drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na chos ni bcu drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, there are sixteen real entities:

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnam pa lnga lnga dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnam pa lnga lnga dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: five types that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the realms of desire, form, and formlessness; five types that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin; five types that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation; and five types that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: sems kyang bcu drug ste /
analyzed: sems kyang bcu drug ste /
translated: There are sixteen minds:

original: de dag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag nyid do //
translated: those very same.

original: de la chos gang zhig sems gang gi dmigs pa yin pa shes par byas nas 'di la ni phra rgyas 'di de snyed cig rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la chos gang zhig sems gang gi dmigs pa yin pa shes par byas nas 'di la ni phra rgyas 'di de snyed cig rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rtag par bya'o //
translated: Having understood which real entities are the objects of which minds, we should always understand that “this many negative tendencies are active in this.”

original: de la re zhig / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong goms pa yis //
analyzed: de la re zhig / sdug bsngal rgyu mthong goms pa yis //
translated: First, those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and origin

original: spang bya @244a * //
analyzed: spang bya @244a * //
translated: are abandoned by seeing and by cultivation.

original: 'dod khams las skyes pa //
analyzed: 'dod khams las skyes pa //
translated: Those born in the desire realm🔽are the three of one's own realm and one of the form realm.

original: rang gi gsum dang gzugs gtogs gcig / dri med rnam shes spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rang gi gsum dang gzugs gtogs gcig / dri med rnam shes spyod yul lo //
translated: The domain of stainless consciousness.

original: de dag ni rang gi yang yin la gsum yang yin pas rang gi gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi yang yin la gsum yang yin pas rang gi gsum mo //
translated: They are one's own and also three, thus they are the three of one's own.

original: de ni gcig kyang yin la gzugs su gtogs pa yang yin pas gzugs gtogs gcig ste /
analyzed: de ni gcig kyang yin la gzugs su gtogs pa yang yin pas gzugs gtogs gcig ste /
translated: That is one and also belongs to the form realm, thus it is the one of the form realm.

original: de ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: This is the aspect of the analysis of the words.

original: re zhig sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni sems lnga'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni sems lnga'i dmigs pa yin te /
translated: First, phenomena of the desire realm that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin and those to be abandoned by the path of meditation are objects of five minds.

original: rang gi khams pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rang gi khams pa gsum ste /
translated: They are the three of one's own realm.
